text:
Smooth with chocolate / coffee overtones. Not bitter. Not cloying. Very nice brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark black in color
Heavy head that dissipates
Strong stout flavor 
A meal all it's own
Chocolate aroma
Would be good in a milkshake

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aus der Flasche auf der Berliner Biermeile 2013 getrunken. Ein schön balanciertes Stout. Lecker!
bomber pours black with mocha head aroma is roasted barley taste is the same with chocalate and ashy notes good for the style

Draft Rogue chocolate stout. Black with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate heavy with some coffee sneaking in, malts and slight nutty. Flavour of chocolate, slight coffee feeling, caramel malts, slight nutty taste.

cant believe I have not rated this before. bomber shared. it pours a dark brown medium body with mocha head. the aroma is chocolate chocolate and chocolate with roasted malts. the flavor is chocolate chocolate chocolate very flavorful very good and delicious. I know I have had this several times and it remains a favorite. one of the best chocolate stouts out there.

Serving: from bottle.

Aroma: light cocoa.

Appearance: average-sized, light-brown initial head with fair lacing and mostly diminishing longevity. Clear, cola-brown body.

Taste: lightly acidic, cocoa initial flavor and lightly acidic, cocoa, roasty finish with long duration.

Palate: full bodied with syrupy texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: excellent flavor.

Served on tap at Rogue. Black color with a tan head. Malt chocolate aroma. Chocolate sweet light malt flavor. Medium light body. Not a lot of complexity but very smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from Liquor Barn in North Burnaby. A very dark ale with generous tan head and a distinct chocolate nose. The chocolate is obvious, but not overstated. Silky smooth, sweet, with trace hop bitterness. Dee.lish.usss! 4.
1 pint 6 oz. bottle. Black with a tan head. Aroma was chocolate malt, marshmallow, roasted, vanilla. Taste was mild sweet, chocolates, caramel, roasted malt.

Bottle. Chocolate, oats and coffee aroma. Black stout appearance with a very small brown head. Roasted coffee and dark chocolate with some underlying hoppy bitterness. Medium body. Well balance finish. Very drinkable.

Color opaco, negro ébano. Espuma cremosa color marrón. Aroma intenso a chocolate, ligero toque acaramelado. Sabor a chocolate con ligeros toques de café. Amargor medio-alto y duradero, equilibrado con el sabor a chocolate y un ligero dulzor.

Appearance: near opaque black with the merest hints of brown around the margins, one fat finger of dense light brown head, good retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: chocolate, roasty malt, mild coffee. (7/10) Taste: moderate-low sweet, moderate-high bitter. (7/10) Palate: full body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter finish. (3/5)

I recently tried their Hazelutely Choctabulous, but hadnt tried its 40% component, so decided Id give it a shot. And, having closed the circle on this, it all makes sense now. This is dominated by bitter chocolate, with no hint of milk chocolate sweetness, making it not as one-dimensional as the 60% component Hazelnut Nectar, but definitely simple. Combining this ones bitterness and chocolate flavours with the nutty sweetness of the Hazelnut Nectar basically provide all the components for a candy bar, and makes Hazelutely Choctabulous greater than the sum of its parts. (And yes, I retained some of both components and mixed them myself. Calling it magic might be gilding the lily a tad, but its definitely worth doing, if you can lay hands on both components but not the blended bottle.) (14/20)

Kicsi, nem túl tartós hab, fekete szín. Illatában a csokoládé minden mást elnyom. Enyhén édeskés, feketecsokis, kakaóporos ízvilág, némi aszalt gyümölcsös beütéssel és egy kis komlós fűszerességgel. Közepesen testes, erősen szénsavas, közepesen keserű. Kellemes, jó egyensúlyú sör, lehetne egy picit krémesebb.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2009 (Day 1), Earls Court, London Aug 2009 - Dark Brown, almost Black, in colour. Very Chocolate in both aroma and taste. Very Malty; rich dark chocolate, roasty malts, coffee. Hoppy; citrusy hops. Sweet chocolate roast malty balanced by hoppy bitterness. Terrific Stout! (2009-08)
De grands arômes chocolatés, tirant sur lamertume. Complexe et écoeurante mais une expérience riche en arôme

Huge chocolate smells with a malt scent underneath. Pour dark and opaque but with bright light a tinge of red can be discerned. Thick tan head with tiny bubbles and lots of lacing. Chocolate milkshake tastes with a balancing sour coffee grounds finish. Very nice for a sweet one.

Bottle. Dark brown. chocolate, roasty aroma, some coconut milk and chocolate chips. Mildly bitter, roasty, dry with lots of chocolate in the mouth. Both cocoa nibs and chocolate syrup. Full body, lively carbonation, dry bittersweet chocolate finish. Nice for dessert. 4500th rating!

Bottle poured into white wine glass. Pours dark opaque with beige head. Nose of dark chocolate and rosted, earthy malts. Taste is coffee and dark high cocoa percentage chocolate. A bit watery middlepart

65cl bottle. Best before 2015-02. It poured a pitch black colour with a minimal light brown head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Notes of cocoa, milk, barley. Flavour is sweet. Lightly roasted, malty, cocoa and dry milk. Some dried fruits. Just a hint of bitterness. Long lingering aftertaste.
Pitch black an thick pour. Caramel colored head. Smells and tastes like chocolate. Sweet and then roasted malts leads to an enjoyable slightly smokey finish with hints of cocoa powder.

Pitch black color with thin beige head. Very little lacing. Aroma is intense chocolate, rum essence and hints of caramel. Taste is roasted coffee, again chocolate and rum. Alcohol is subdued, Creamy, medium carbonation. Very good.
Genialne! Czekolada a? kipi! Bardzo lekkie i bardzo pijalne. Mo?e troch? za s?odkie, wi?cej ni? 300ml ci??ko by by?o wypi?
0,25l on Tap. Schwarzes Bier mit cremiger brauner Schaumkrone. Angehmer Geruch nach Röstmalzen und Schokolade, das wird intensiv im Geschmack bestätigt. Vollmundig!

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación imperceptible y no muy presente en boca. Aroma lejano a malta tostada y chocolate por un tubo (da la sensación, por el aroma, de que va a ser una cerveza muy dulce y empalagosa). Nada más lejos de la realidad. El sabor es chocolate puro, sí, pero hay una buena carga de lúpulo al final del trago que le da un carácter amargo muy interesante. Más placentero que si la cerveza fuera verdaderamente dulce (que no lo es; diría que trata de representar un chocolate puro amargo en forma de cerveza). La textura en boca es muy interesante también porque la esperaba más espesota. Muy buena.
On tap. Pours balck with tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee. Sweet malt flavour, milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla and fruity notes

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy dark tan head. Clea aroma of chcocloate, coffee and malt, with hints of fruit. Sweetish flavour of chocolate and malt, with bitter, roasty notes of coffee and touches of yeast, vanilla and fruit. Malty and estery aftertaste with roasty notes. Good.

[backlog] 25-09-15 // bottle shared at Spiegelau Masterclass Tastin, Frankfurt. Poured into Stout glass. Dark brown almost black. Beige foamy head. Intense chocolate in the nose. Taste is forward chocolate malt, some caramel and roasted notes. Very cream texture.

- schöne fast schwarze Farbe
- Aromen nach Schoko und Vanille, mit einer wunderbaren
 Intensität, wie ich sie selten bei einem Bier erlebt habe
- leicht ölige Konsistenz mit optimaler Kohlensäurebeigabe
- eine leichte Grundbitternis begleitet das Bier geschmacklich
 so perfekt, dass es nie ins unangenehm Süße abrutscht
- auch im Abgang bleibt das Ganze unverändert in Balance
Fazit: Stout At Its Best

Aroma of chocolate (of course) some coffee and fruit notes also present. The body is dark black and a creamy dark tan head. The flavor is all chocolate, it seems to change from a bitter dark to a sweeter lighter chocolate as it goes down. Overall a pretty nice beer so if you like chocolate and beer this one is for you. Originally rated on 11/2/08.

Full body, sweet&sour, atrong chocolate flavor. Opaque. 
Very tasty. Worth searching



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 650mL. Home. A shining black beer with a medium beige foamy head ; average retention. Roasty nose, chocolate, light coffee, herb, cereal. Medium dry bitter refreshing ; sweet note. Medium body, thin creamy texture, soft carbonation, bitter dry chocolate lasting finish. Overall, great ! Not so sweet.

Disappointing as I really enjoy their double version. Pours dark with small brown head. Aroma is the best part with chocolate dominating as expected among the roast. Flavor does not follow. Initial chocolate fights to remain known through the sip, while semi-sour notes, and not quite matching hop bitterness takes over. Finish is a little biting. Could be smoother and sweeter to be enjoyable for me.

Poured into a Guinness pint glass the head reaches about 3 fingers of a pillowy khaki colored head which dissipates in moderate timeliness. The aroma and flavor are sensually potent for a fat man like me because this is the first sweet stout that emphasizes the cocoa flavor deftly. The creamy mouthfeel adds a milkshake quality that denotes greatness for a one-of-kind dessert stout.

Bottle in wine glass. Pours black with a medium- carbonation leaving low anticipation. The aroma is good though. Dense with chocolate and roasted coffee. Taste is rather balanced with an initial fruity note that is sedated once finishing the bottle.
Bonne bière, mousse légère, arômes multiples et parfois surprenant, niveau gustatif généreux. Globalement une bière sympathique

Rogues Chocolate Stout is one of the finest examples of Pacific Northwest American craft ales -- it is exactly what you might imagine a great chocolate stout to be.

Earthy strength, full-bodied, and little sour, this isnt a softened stout like brews that rely on nitrogen or lactose. The high alcohol content is a little easier to detect in this beer than smoother stouts, which can be disappointing to some. A hearty, powerful brew for those who are looking for exactly that (like me ;).

Pours clear black, with solid, dark head. Chocolate and oats in aroma, with a note of coffee. Its sweet, slightly sour and roasty from dark malts. Body is medium, with medium-high carbonation. Low biterness, but it is not a con in this type of beer. Overall its a great chocolate stout, but I slightly prefer Samuel Smiths, because of higher sweetness and still maintaing better drinkability (probably because of softer carbonation).

Dark brown body with a thin brown head. Aroma is milk chocolate, sweet dark fruit, vanilla. Taste is sweet and with a mild bitter finish. Medium to heavy body with average to soft carbonation. Very nice.
Aroma of cocoa & milk chocolate. Black with long lasting brown head. Surprisingly dry & bitter. Medium body, sticky texture & soft carbonation.

0.65l bottle from The George and Dragon, Barcelona - shared with my girlfriend. It pours a deep dark brown one with a really good looking dark brown chocolate top. The aroma is just like smelling a chocolate bar. dont think Ive nosed a beer as chocolaty as this in, oh, I dont know how long. Lovely milky chocolate with mocha and cocoa powder. Kinda sweet and caramelly also, but the chocolate is just so overwhelmingly nice. The mouthfeel is light oily and the carbonation level is below average. The chocolate is almost just as present in the taste as it was in the aroma. Its really round and surprisingly balanced this. Traces of cold coffee, fudge, cocoa nibs and some roasted malts appear. Guess you could call it a Nesquik/O-boy for adults. Scary lightdrinkable, tasty and just a plain old damned nice chocolate stout. 02.02.2013

Black body with a large, creamy, medium brown head that stays a finger-thick layer until the glass is empty, good lacing. Sweet, malty and Intense aroma that isnt exactly very complex: its mostly a massive sweet chocolate overdose, backed up by other roasted malty notes, some fruits in the back and hints of both lactic sugar and brown sugar. The chocolate is less sweet on the palate, its dark and bitter with additional dry and dark roasted malt to further contrast the sweetness. Also fruits in the background, together with wood, and lactic sugar and brown sugar. Moderate to light sweet taste with a moderate bitter finish. Medium body, it actually feels a bit too light-bodied for the intensity of the aroma and flavour. Nice creamy texture, though, with a light dryness in the finish. A lovely brew indeed! 
[65 cl bottle, enjoyed 16 months after BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika (RIP), Oslo]

Pours in very black colour with medium size light brown head, medium lacing. Strong aroma of chocolate, some coffee notes. Medium sweet, ligtly bitter, no sourness, definitive chocolate taste. Full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long chocolate aftertaste
Draft @ Ølbaren. Pours black without much foam. Aroma mostly chocolate. Light body with taste of chocolate malt and an okay deal of bitterness. Bitter aftertaste with notes of chocolate malt. Okay.

Piana brązowa, ładna, z czasem degeneruje się obwoluty wokół kieliszka. W aromacie dużo mlecznej czekolady, odrobina amerykańskiego chmielu, troszkę karmelowości. W smaku natomiast gorzka czekolada, trochę mlecznej, odrobina kawy, odrobina chmielu, odrobina słodów palonych. Goryczka jest krótka, lekka, palono-chmielowa. Profil jest raczej wytrawny. Piwo jest kremowe i gładkie. Alkohol idealnie zakamuflowany. Dobry balans między smakami. Oczekiwałem, że będzie trochę bardziej słodkie. Nagazowanie średnie w stronę niskiego.
From tap at Taphouse. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, chocolate, caramel, bitterness, hops and nuts.

Bottle. Opaque brownish-amber with frothy brownish head, nice lacing. Aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, licorice and almonds. Sweet flavor followed by bitterness, notes of milk chocolate, roasted malt, almonds, some smokiness, coffee, somewhat dusty. Medium to full-bodied. Very nice.
Rogue Chocolate Stout - uzupełnienie ocen piw pitych przed używaniem ratebeer.

Sweet malty with high sweet chocolate prominence, some caramel sweetness in support, flødeboller with very nice vanilla nuances throughout and into the finish, Lovely sweet stout.
Tap. Black, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

Aroma - pure chocolate and marshmallows. Awesome. Black, perfect lacing. In taste also- nothing except chocolate, bit of biscuits and marshmallows. But its a little bit to thin. Was hoping it will be like melted chocolate. But still its really good.

En rigtig chokolade-øl, den smager helt vildt meget af chokolade, uden at det bliver overdrejen. Det gode ved det er at den ikke smager så meget at det ikke er øl længere. Den er fint humlet i eftersmagen, så det bitre passer fint som afslutning på den søde, chokolade indledning. En god øl, at afslutte juleaften, som den blev brugt til.

Butelka 0,65 w Samych Krafta vis a vis. Przepiękny aromat: kakao, mleczna czekolada, wanilia, wszystko skontrastowane z lekką palonością. W ustach lekkie ale nie wodniste, znacznie bardziej wytrawne niż wskazywałby aromat. Smak przesunięty w stronę gorzkiej czekolady i z lekkim posmakiem śliwki kalifornijskiej w tle. Goryczka umiarkowana, nie za długa. Dość mocno wysycone jak na styl. Znakomite, warto!

Nose is heavy chocolate and roast. Pours jet black, little head. Delicious chocolate on the tongue with a luscious mouthfeel from the oats. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep brown-black with a creamy beige head. Aroma of milk chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, coffee and grass, some earthy notes. Sweet and roasted malt flavors, caramel, chocolate, prunes, vanilla, mocha, bitter and dry finish. Medium-bodied, smooth and creamy. Yummy.

Pours near black with tan head. Unlike most very chocolate stouts it is not too sweet. Very authentic chocolate taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: sweet milk chocolate, ganache.
Taste: dry with some bitterness.
Flavour: roasted nuts, bitter chocolate, roasted oatmeal.

Good.

Bottle. Pours in black body with coffee like creamy brown head. Aroma has strong aroma character, pretty exact, probably extract. Taste has strong roasty flavors upfront, light bitterness at the end. Body is full, creamy, medium carbonation.

The beer has a beautiful dark appearance. The color of the beer is a nice dark brown, with a slightly ruby red glow. The beer pours a nice soft creamy foam, with a yellowish color. The bulk of the foam collapses, to leave almost nothing behind. The smell is very nice. There is a good sweet chocolate aroma, combined with some nice roasted aromas. It reminds me of the Porterhouse Chocolate Truffle Stout. All those nice dark bitter tones, balanced out by the sweetness of the chocolate, delicious. There are also some nice fresh hop tones in the smell. The taste of the beer is slightly less. There is less of the chocolate deliciousness. There are some nice roasty bitter tones and a fresh fruity hop flavor. The aftertaste is nice and bitter. All in all, a delicious stout, like it should be. A good preparation for my trip to Dublin
Dark black, light brown lasting lacing foam head. Stron chocolate aroma, getting better when beer gets warmer. Bitter chocolate taste, great beer. (Sofia 201604)

Bottle shared at hopaholic. Black colour with a small fast disappearing black head. Nose of cocoa and some light rhum in the background. Taste is chocolate wih some roasted malts. Nice beer, but hoped for a fuller mouthfeel.

Black, firm beige head. Aroma of chocolate, loads of chocolate, light soy sauce. Flavour chocolate, bit sweet. Finish malts, chocolate and cacao.(from 355mL bottle shared @ home. As Chocolate Bear Beer. Thanks for bringing me the bottle, Katrin)

Ein Stout kann im Glas kaum was verkehrt machen. Schön hier: Der leicht braune Schaum, erinnert gleich an Luftschokolade. Und die riecht man auch, superlecker. Reingebissen, klar, ein Stout, und mit dem Abgang kommt die Schoki, leckerleckerlecker, etwas bitter, dann süß, megasüffig. Gigantisches Dessert-Bier!
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, burnt wood, coffee. Taste is a mixture of sweetness (lactose?) and roasted bitterness. Smooth mouth feel.

Deep black with medium brown head. Nose is chocolate and cream. Aromas are dark chocolate, coffee, wood and roasted malts. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter and chocolate finish. Very nice chocolate stout!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep black, thin mocha coloured head, medium lacing. Massive Milk chocolate aromas. Great interplay between chocolate, bitter hops, oats and roasted malts which provide a smoky finish. Minimal carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Magnificent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mediocre foam. Chocolate, duh. Espresso. Watery. Slightly roasted. Meh. Choco-too-late-not-for-the-second-round.
