Appearance: black with dark brown head.
Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, some coffee.
Taste: lot of chocolate, balanced bittersweet.
Palate: smooth, lasting body, low carbonation.
Overall: very nice.

650ml bottle at home in Munich with goflo and claudi, courtesy of Claudi. Aroma is dark chocolate, light caramel, toffee. Amazing. Appearance is black with a dark brown, thick foam. Taste is sweet and light bitter. Dry and perfectly balanced with a soft to medium strong carbonation. Just right. Impressive.
Nice chocolatly, maplelike aroma. Soft sweet bitter woodlike and cacaoflavours. Bitter dry aftertaste.

Black color with brown foam layer. The smell is an absolutely delightful sweetish mild chocolate aroma. The taste is almost harsh and aggressive compared to the smell. The taste is sweet, has chocolate and roasted coffee bean aromas and a decent, but still almost too strong, carbonation. Compared to the smell and aftertaste, this beer seems nearly watery, despite its rich flavors. The aftertaste is mild with a strong but calm chocolate finish and hints of roasted coffee beans.
Leos Hartwell bottle(31-Jan-16)Sweet choc aroma.Black,ok head&suds lace.Sweet choc plum flavour.Sweet choc roast finish&herbal choc aftertaste.
Muy sabrosa y facil de beber. Dulce, chocolate con leche y final de caramelo. Tremendo envase de 650 ml.
Bottle: Poured into a shaker glass, it was an opaque brown with a tall tan head. The aroma was chocolate malt. The taste was semi-sweet and it had a medium body and a creamy mouth feel.

coffee, chocolate, black, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, cream. Wow, incredible dark chocolate aroma, hints of coffee. Dark black. Head looks oddly a bit like oil and water; curious separation going on. Velvet chocolate at first, transitioning into a slight bitterness, ends as soft as a pillow. Sweet but not cloyingly so. Very, very well done. If I was a choco-alcoholic I would inject this into my veins.

Black colored, medium+ tan creamy head with nice lacing. Aroma is sweet malty, caramel, chocolate, roasted malt, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is medium sweet chocolate, some caramel, milky and dark chocolate, nuts, roasted dry bitterness, lasting bitter chocolate aftertaste. Medium+ bodied, soft+ carbonation, creamy. Choco goodness!

Pours a pitch black color, topped with a decently sized head, dark beige color. Strong sweet chocolate aroma, lots of cocoa in there as well. Taste is dominated by chocolate notes, some sweet and some dark bittery chocolate feel. Moderate bitterness in the finish. Semi full body, actually quite on the light side. Mild roasty aftertaste, but very lasting. Nice, especially aroma is amazing.
Huge chocolate nose. Nice body carries through to a good chocolate finish. Solid stout.
Smell of dark chocolate, coffee, malt, come in deep dark brown, taste of chocolate, malt, hop, bailey, right bitterness, smooth, slightly slimy, very good stout for price

Tap. Pours deep black with a decent beige-brown head. Crazy aromas of baker's chocolate with some dark roasted coffee. Taste begins rather sweet malty, transitions after a second into a hoppy bitter note and then into a long aftertaste featuring said aromas. Very soft palate. Possibly too overwhelmingly chocolatey for me, but impressive nonetheless.
A nearly black pour with a tan head. The aroma has mostly milk chocolate. It has full, robust body with average carbonation. The taste is roasted and mildly bitter.

66cl bottle. Black with a thin bubbly head. Aroma is light roasted, earthy, with a rich milk chocolate finish. I expected sweetness but it is fairly dry, more refreshing than filling. Low bitterness, medium carbonation, light body.
Rated from old notes. Immediatly sweet with strong chocolate notes. Nothing subtle here. Chocolate and lots of it. One dimensional disappointment.

Delicious. I love to treat myself to this when I can, as often as possible. It is a wonderful winter beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A really nice chocolate stout with a decent amount of carbonation for the style. A nice treat beer to spilt with the wife.
Much lighter bodied than I was expecting, surprisingly refreshing and drinkable, quite heavy carbonation. Plenty of roasted malts and chocolate. Really tasty.
Robe brune aux reflets cuivrés. Mousse beige. Arômes chocolat et caramel. Goût, chocolat, café, légèrement fumé. Final chocolat. Longue en bouche. Une très bonne Stout.

Strong pleasant milk cocoa aroma with sweet caramel and bread.
Pours a black color with garnet tints and a lasting creamy brown.
Chocolatey flavor with strong bitter malty roast, bread, coffee. 
Medium bodied with medium high CO2, lasting bitter roast finish.
Enjoyable stout. The roast is a bit more intense than I would prefer though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle ty Stefan. Pours deep black with a tan head. Aroma of deep cocoa, vanilla sugar, nutty, roast, malts. Taste is sweet with cocoa, coffee, light vanilla. Decent.
From bottle, Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of sweet milk chocolate, vanilla, very candy-like. Taste is Extreme sweet, artificial, thin body, lots og chocolate. Light nutty and roasted notes.
Schwarz. Geruch nach Schokolade, dazu leicht nach Röstgerste. Im Geschmack dann leicht restsüß. Zum Ende bitter, aber ausgewogen (Flasche 2m über MHD). Wie zartbitterschokolade.

Douce, légèrement amer, assez fluide, pas très onctueuse mais pleine darômes et saveurs : agrumes, épices, chocolat, notes végétales.

Bien balancée et subtile.

650 ml bottle. Pours deep black with medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, oatmeal, coffee and caramel. Medium body with soft carbonation. Taste of chocolate and coffee with long bitter finish. Fine beer.

650ml bottle. Deep brown/black colour with a nice beige head. Chocolate, sweet, liquorice and oat in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is bitter with some sweet chocolate notes. Long dry, bitter and light astringent finish. Overall, a very good beer.
This is a great stout. Thick and smooth, almost like a milkshake. Aroma is fabulous.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with slight yeast and with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, vanilla and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced, but it is mostly simply delicious. The added chocolate works wonders and this reminds of the one and only Chocomel.
(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of chocolate, chocolate liqueur, coffee; balanced flavour, on the dry side, long light bitter finish

Aroma chocolate, caramel, 
Appearance black, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, average carbonation, 
Overall it feels like a chocolate dessert in a glass. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Bottled. Poured into snifter. This is an amazing stout. Big flavors of dark chocolate on the front, back, and everywhere in between. Like eating a savory dark chocolate bar. Delicious!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Marrone scura, praticamente nera, schiuma nocciola di buona persistenza.
Abbastanza acida, aroma di caffè e cacao, leggero aroma di frutti rossi, zucchero.
Al palato sempre acida, prevale il caffè tostato sul cacao amaro, con una bella coda amaricante tostata.
Corpo medio leggero, poco carbonata, oleosa.
Pretty close to a perfect brew. Wonderful chocolate aroma and flavor. Smooth palate. Thanks Rogue.

Very dark pour, thin tan head. Aroma of, well, chocolate along with some indistinguishable roasted something. Bittersweet chocolate on the nose and palate. Seemed a bit thin, not very sweet, with a strong chocolate profile. Definitely got the bittersweet (not milk) chocolate angle, but was not as rich or roasty or really anything to make me excited.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of chocolate with hint of espresso. Pours black with tan head. Taste is lightly sweet at first with a medium bitter finish. Full bodied with thick texture. An amazing chocolate and beer combination.

Big bottle into fancy stout glass. Black w good tan head. Aroma of chocolate with hints of vanilla and oak. Robust taste - distinctive bitter chocolate. Smooth almost creamy but w some rougher bitterness coming through. Good solid stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A rich and beautiful light brown persistent foam fills the top of this very fragrant stout. The fragrance is characterized by good dark chocolate (Belgian?).
The dark chocolate flavor is pronounced in this stout, it is slightly sweet and very little bitter. The taste is replaced by a short-term lightly hopped taste and it also contains some hints of coffee. The stout is not as sweet as I expected. The finish is marked by good quality chocolate mixed with a moderate amount of coffee.

Pours dark black medium dark brown head. Aromas of chocolate, oatmeal and malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle into tumbler. Totally totally black beer with foamy tan head. Cinnamon chocolate nose, some cloves, some liquorice. Surprisingly light and fizzy in the mouth. Finish is milk chocolate and cocoa. Lingering finish becomes quite bitter. Great beer but I didnt expect it to be so quaffable. So...a 6.3% Sweet Stout that is easy drinking and not very sweet, alright!

I expected more sweety notes. A lot of chocolate, nice sweet chocolate aroma, But only in aroma. Nice big brown-dark head. It has strange taste, like choco-soap. Its hard, a little bit heavy and boozy. Good one but I prefer Aphrodisiac from Dieu du Ciel
0,66l fles gedeeld met bryanvdv. Zwart met een bruine kraag. Smaak en geur doordrenkt met chocoladé maar ook bourbon noot. Niet verkeerd, mist echter wat in de boddy.
Pours black with a tan head. Aromas of sweet malt and chocolate. Taste the same with some smokeyness. Decent lacing in the glass. Light to medium mouth feel but very smooth. Nice depth of flavors.

Bomber into tulip glass. Pours a dark brown with a large beige head. Leaves plenty of lacing. Chocolate, and lots of it! Milk chocolate and cocoa, hazelnut, roasted malts, oats, coffee, caramel. Definitely a good amount of hops cutting through as well. Full bodied, thick and chewy texture, moderate carbonation. An all around excellent sweet stout!
BOTTLE 22 OZ. Almost black with a beige head. Cheap chocolate flavourings. Taste is light sweet, fake chocolate, moderately bitter finish with notes of bitter mold. Questionable.

Shared bottle at home. Pours black. Like, totally black. Foam is beige. Aroma of a typical (Imperial) Stout. Taste is extremely interesting: typical stout at first, then slight chocolaty, then not, then an aftertaste as if you were drinking a nice hot cocoa. Really nice beer.

undated 650ml bottle shared with 2 friends. Served in large wine glass. 

Plenty of chocolate flavor in this one, although a little more in the milk (vs. dark) chocolate vein and not quite as chocolately as my gold standard: Youngs Double Chocolate Stout. Theres a fine rich, chocolate finish that is about as good as it gets, with a nice bit of dark roasted malt flavor, a faint hint of coffee, and a touch of spicy hops. The beer is mildly hoppy throughout at a level that is well matched to the malt and chocolate. The last statement applies to both the aroma and the flavor. 

O - excellent. A must try for any chocolate lover. Lacking the splendid head but nonetheless on par with my gold standard: Youngs Double Chocolate Stout.
This beer smells like Mom baking a chocolate cake. Tastes of bitter chocolate and coffee with a light mouth feel.
Luvly stout from 650ml bottle frothy rich chocolate aroma the taste is likewise smooth creamy dark chocolate malty hoppy flavours & a bitter sweet finish

Bomber. Black in color, foaming light brown head an beautiful lacing all over the glass. Aroma of coffee and chocolate combined with some slightly roasted malts notes. Taste is sweet, roasted malts and chocolate. Very good, very enjoyable.

Pretty black pour w/ a big mocha head & leaves decent lacing. The aroma is an enticing blend of chocolate & light roast. The flavor is dominated by the chocolate & ultimately finishes roasty & bitter. The mouthfeel is light & creamy. Overall, tasty & well done!

65cl bottle, served in tulip. Pitch black colour with a nice tan head. Chocolate and sweet malts on the nose. The flavour is so good and peculiar: at first it seems one of those coffee stouts, but after a few minutes it is the chocolate what dominates. Pleasant hop presence. Round on the palate, no cloying sweetness at all. Full body, perfect carbonation. Definitely as good as the Double chocolate version. Cant choose.

Poirs a pitch black body with a very quickly settling dark brown head. Nose has very intense notes of chokolate, coffee, roasted coffee beans and caramel. Taste is overall surprisingly bitter, dry and roasty with a bitter, lingering finish. Soft carbonation and a palate on the rich side. Very nice, full-bodied and well balanced stout for its ABV.
Distinct chocolate aroma. Slight other roastiness. Pours black with brown head. Nice chocolate flavor not too sweet. Nice thick body.
Great stout - so easy to drink its almost a quaffer - totally satisfying and enjoyed.

Dark, with a semi-sturdy mocha head. 

Milk chocolate nose. Simple but effective! 

Chocolate and slight roast in the taste. Just like the nose, simple and nice vanilla.

Nase: Caramell, Tabak, Vanille. Geschmack: Schockolade zartbitter, Vanille, ein Hauch von Rauch, vollmundig.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a pitch black with a creamy, mocha-brown head. Aromas has chocolate, dark "pålægschocolade", milk chocolate, caramel, vanilla and marshmallows. Taste is sweet like chco milk, roasty and dark chocolate bitterness in the finish. Slight lactose sweetness maybe. Smooth body and average carbonation.
Very mellow and smooth chocolate beer from a brewery that does chocolate well. Good body and balance.

Bottle. Pours black brownish with creamy brown head, some big bubbles. Aroma is pålægschokolade, malts grains, roast, coco, fudge, some vanille and slight earthy. Slight smores. Taste pålægschokolade, slight spicy hops, sweet, milk chocolate. light year really creamy body and chocolate milk. dry roasty finish. Loads of lactose feel and sweetness. Full body for ABV.
Black opaque colour, mediumsized brown head. Chocolate in aroma. Flavour is hops, chocolate, malts and slight roast. Especially in aftertaste. Chocolate bomb, and I love it

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2016 Bottle 650ml at tderoeck place in Gent Belgium. Thank you Tim for hosting us.Great dinner time.26.06.2105.Finally to try something from this guys.Thanks Tim "Oh my God" once again.Pour it thick dark color with black head.On the nose chocolate.Taste of chocolate,some vanilla, little bit dry, low alcohol and very drinkable.Interesting.

Update :

Draft 0.15l at Tap Takeover Rogue Farms at In De Wildeman.05.03.2016.Pour it dark color with small black head.Aroma dark chocolate.TAste coffee,dark chocolate,body is totally flat.Aftertaste some mocha coffee and some chocolate. 7 3 7 3 15

26/VI/15 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2015-819)  
Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very sweet, milk chocolate, caramel, quite some chocolate, hot cocoa. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: little sweet, lots of dark chocolate, hoppy, vanilla notes. Aftertaste: slightly sweet, hoppy bitterness, mocha, vanilla, chocolate.

Hevelka 2015 (dzień drugi, epizod szósty). Niestety zbliża się dla mnie moment zakończenia tej wyjątkowo udanej imprezy. Czas na coś wyjątkowego więc podchodzę do Alchemików. Moja uwagę przykuwa napis "Wyjątkowy stout" pod produkcją browaru Rogue. Chcolate Stout rzeczywiście pachnie jak wyjątkowo dobra czekolada. Niestety na zapachu porównanie z czekoladą się kończy bo w smaku jej w ogóle nie czuję. Może się nie znam a może to po prostu zmęczenie materiału.

Delicious brew..tons of chocolate and smooth as hell....yummy...
Really great stuff....(#537)....

Solid stout appearance.. just a bit below the gold standard. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, lactose.. maybe a hint of licorice. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth, with a touch of bitterness... Palate is a 4.5, but Ill round up to 5... close enough. Taste is good.. somewhat bland.. I get the oats, chocolate.... respectable.
Nice stout, odd chocolate malt notes, mild to medium carbonation. Didnt seem interesting enough to surprise me - just a nice tasting beer. Nothing special
The nose is coffee grounds, brownie, bakers chocolate. Flavor is same plus roasted chestnuts, char. Chocolatey but not sweet.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Pours totally black with short lasting dark tan head. Chocolate aroma is inviting. Bitterness up front. Some cream in the mouthfeel but chocolate dominates. Maybe a bit forced at the end of the day. Coffee and roasted flavours and enough sweet malt make it still pleasant to drink.

Bottle from Mitsuyas labeled Chocolate Bear Beer Bitter. Poured into an English tulip pint. Deep brown with some slight ruby highlights with a tan head that leaves a nice ring throughout. Big bakers chocolate nose with some earthy hops, burnt espresso, cacao nibs and cocoa powder all present. Average carbonation with a cola-like mouthfeel. Taste is bittersweet with a great lasting biter finish that lingers like pure baking cocoa on the tongue. Theres a really nice acidity balance present as well. Really nice stout.

Draught at Brickmakers/ Wien 7. Liquid bitter chocolate. Extremely good..........

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from swanbourne. Deep brown pour with beige head. Lots of vanilla and milk choc on the nose. Flavour is choc as expected but quite a firm bitterness and boozy finish. Seemed a bit out of whack. Still ok
Pours a jet black color with a foamy tan head. Aroma is chocolate and roast. Flavor is bittersweet chocolate. Overall pretty good, though the bitterness is a bit harsh.

Pitch black beer with a big foamy brownish head.
Smell is sour fruitiness and milk chocolate. Leather, maybe some nuts, but mainly lots of chocolate.
Taste is watery first but then gets overwhelmed by milk chocolate. Not sweet, just very creamy oily and smooth chocolate taste. With a touch of mineral. Quite smart.

On tap at beertemple, amsterdam. Body is pitch black, head is big, brownish, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is cocoa, flavor is chocolate, mild coffee, brown sugar. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting dark chocolate, later quite hoppy as well. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Excellent dessert beer, tons of chocolate, not too sweet, great one.
Pik zwart met een mooie beige kraag. Ruikt chocolade, cacao. Smaakt dun, chocolade, geroosterd. iets te dun.

Draught at the Rogue, Newport, OR. 
Dark brown colour with a small tan head.
Chocolate, nougat, sugary sweetness, cocoa and mild bitterness in the aroma. 
The flavour is roasted malt, dark chocolate, cocoa, moderate bitterness and some coffee notes. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, cereal, chocolate, coffee, roasty, herbs, brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thick feel, creamy, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Pours a deep dark brown with a khaki head from a bottle. Aroma of dark chocolate, flavor of dark chocolate, floral, hint of black coffee, some caramel notes, bittersweet. A little thin in the mouth. Good beer.

Piwo ładnie prezentuje się w szkle, bujna drobna piana oblepiająca szkło. Z butelki czuć mleczną czekoladę, kakao i kawę wiedeńską. Po przelaniu aromat czekolady Milka i czekolady Lindt przenikają się sprawiając troszkę mdlące odczucie. W smaku ciekawie - nie jest sodko, dość treściwie, lekko popiołowo, szorstko, nieduże drobne nasycenie. Bazą smakową oczywiście deserowa szwajcarska czekolada, pozbawiona zbędnego cukru czy kwaskowatości - czysty czekoladowo-kakaowy smak, któremu towarzyszy delikatna paloność, kawa zbożowa i wyraźna ziołowo-żywiczna goryczka od chmielu Cascade. W afterteasie doszukać się można nawet zakamuflowanych owoców tropikalnych i rodzynek. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. 
Choć jest to Sweet Stout, to trzeba zaznaczyć, że świetnie zbalansowany i idący w kierunku wytrawności, bardziej pijalny niż zalepiający.

Ottima. Odore di cacao in polvere e cannela,pulito ma intensissimo e bellissimo. Cacao dolce in bocca.che tende al fondente sul finale,con sentori di orzo tostato. Beverina e quasi liscia,una delle stout più buone mai bevute.
In bottiglia. Colore marrone con schiuma beige fine e abb persistente. aroma di cioccolato, cacao, leggero terroso. Birra semplice, morbida, dolce ma non stucchevole.
Wonderful dark chocolate aroma and taste. Not aggressively bitter or sweet, just chocolate, chocolate and more chocolate. And malt. And a hint of roasted coffee.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kleur kraag. Smaakt chocolade, vanille en beetje koffie. Smaakt chocolade, crème, vanille.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2015 Bij mark in de tuin. Chocola, karamel schuim. Zwart zwart. Smaakt puur. Lekker . stijl is de vraag

I am glad that I tried this. I love dark chocolate stouts, and this didt let me down. Very dark appearance with a mocha-tan head. Taste of chocolate malts, caramel, a little coffee, light hops...very tasty. More on the sweet side versus bitter. This is something I would surely buy again, especially if they sell it in 6-packs.

Always thought I rated this ages ago, but apparently not! What an awesome beer.

Tap at the Bierfestival Groningen.
Pours opaque black with a tan head. Sweet chocolate aromas, toasty character, earthy hops. Very sweet. Milk chocolate flavours, minimal cocoas bitterness. Super smooth texture. A classic
Dark black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate and nuts. Taste of bitter dark chocolate, coffee and a nutty aftertaste.

Pours black with a large tan head.
Nose shows milk chocolate, dry roast, cocoa.
Similar flavours, loads more dry roast, a fair bit of bitterness but some sweet milk chocolate too.
Flavor and aroma of bittersweet chocolate, some coffee cocoa included. Nice silky finish. Some finish of roast bitterness and earthy hops.
Always a classic in their series. Good chocolate notes and flavors. The stout is rich and creamy. Exactly what it says it will be. No surprise rogue is rated so highly across the board.
On tap at Café Gaspar. Tobacco aroma, with hints of overripe fruit and custard sauce. Tasty and full of flavor with tobacco, and chocolate flavor. High acidity, a little bit ashy. Long aftertaste .
Bottle. Dark brown colour, chocolates and roasted malt aroma. Taste is coffee chocolate roasted malts

Pours a dark black color with a medium white head. Aroma is dark chocolate and oats. The taste is chocolate, cocoa, oat, and very light hops. It finishes with a bitter burnt malt flavor that I dont find very pleasant. The mouthfeel is soft and creamy with medium carbonation. Pretty good despite the relatively low ABV.

Bottled. Very dark brown to blck colour. Sweet chocolate aroma with some light roasted notes. Taste is sweety milk chocolate with right maltiness and some hop on backgorund. Medium to high body. Blance is good. But chocolate was to intensive what maybe caused some kind of extracts imo.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2016 From bomber. Pours black with a one-finger thin beige head. Some lacing. Aroma of baking chocolate,  vanilla,  and roasted malts. Taste is bitter chocolate and bitter hops, not much sweetness and to my senses, not very good. Medium mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Revised. Same score.

Pours dark black/brown with some foamy head. Smells like chocolate and beer with some smoky malts, tastes similar with strong dark chocolate tones. Mildly oily palette, very smooth and tasty, no ridiculous over carbonation.
Bottle: Exactly what you think its going to be. Lots of sweet chocolate flavors, but the thicker mouthfeel is very nice. Good Stuff.

Aroma: Very roasted malt and chocolate. 
Flavour: Roasted malt and chocolate sweetness and a fruity bitterness. A creamy mouthfeel and a dry finish. 
Colour: Almost pitch black with a lasting brown head.
From: Voldby købmandsgård Dec. 2014.

Láhev 650 ml. Aroma je sladové s nádechem mléčné čokolády. Pěna je světle hnědá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je temná. Chuť má příjemný čokoládový nádech s jemným ovocným podtextem, fini je středně kávově hořký a drící. V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jedná se o vcelku chutný stout.
Wow. Chocolate.... Pretty much like eating a tootsie roll. It almost tastes artificial, but it sure is good
Aroma is of chocolate. Pours a deep black with a brown head. Taste is of chocolate up front and on the finish with malt and oat in between.

Poured from the bottle into a Lager glass. Pours a dark black with a dark brown head. Aroma consists of Hersheys chocolate syrup, roasted oats, and mocha. Taste starts sweet on the tip of the tongue and ends dry with very little lingering bitterness. The chocolate flavor is the part that lingers. Thick bodied beer with moderate carbonation and a creamy mouth feel.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 Zapach tego piwa jest obłędny - czekolada i to jaka! Bardzo słodka, niezwykle aromatyczna, kojarząca się z czekoladowym shake-em albo nadzieniem najlepszych czekoladek. Gdybym miał zamknięte oczy to nigdy nie zgadłbym, że to piwo. Byłoby genialne, ale skoro to wynik dodanych aromatów? Równie dobrze może pachnieć Chanel No5.
Pierwszy łyk i... zaskoczenie - piwo jest lekko kwaskowate i wytrawne. Wprost odwrotnie do zapachu. Straszliwa niespójność. Po takim aromacie spodziewałem się czegoś słodkiego, nic bardziej mylnego. Piwo jest średnio pełne, gładkie w smaku. Czuć delikatną kawę i ponownie czekoladę, taką truflową. Końcówka to lekkie słody palone i umiarkowana goryczka.
Surprisingly good! Butterscotch, eggnog, chocolate cake, coffee liqueur, vanilla; very smooth, great lingering finish.
chocolate, roasty, smoke, hoppy, moderate carbonation, bitter finish, needs pairing with pizza or burgers, light foods would be overpowering

660ml bottle in Stuttgart, beer at first was served a bit too cold. black color, coffee colored head. smells coffee, dark fruits, bitter chocolate, roasty aroma. full body, taste of coffee, chocolate, light ash, light medical , good bitter roasty finish.

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno brązowa, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, wysoka, ładnie zdobi szkło.
AROMAT: Jest słodko. Mleczna czekolada, praliny, orzechy laskowe, kokos. odrobina cytrusów, czarne owoce (jeżyna, jagoda), jest ziołowość i karmel, są również kwiatowe akcenty oraz paloność.
SMAK: Cała masa smaków, aż trudno opisać! Ziołowe karmelki (cukierki ślazowe), czekolada, słodowość, leśne klimaty (żywica, jeżyny). Finisz przyjemnie cytrusowy - długi i zalegający. 
OGÓLNIE: Przebogate piwo. Czekolada jest od początku do samego końca. Jest też fajna kontra cytrusowa, bardzo delikatna, choć zalegająca. Odnosi się wrażenie, że z każdym następnym łykiem odkrywamy coraz to nowe smaki. A przy wszystkich jego zaletach jest również niesamowicie pijalne. Jestem w szoku!
reamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty aroma, fantastic chocolate notes. Powerfull chocolate flavor. Really great. Creamy palate

Dark brown, almoust black beer with a two finger high mocca-colored head. 

Nose: Chocolate, roasted malt, dark bread, oat and coffee.
Taste: Brown sugar, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit and caramel.
Body: Full body, compex texture. Medium carbonation. Smooth taste. Bitter ending. 

Great stout!

Pours a thick and black. Smells like a chocolate and caramel; very strong caramel, coffee and dark chocolate notes. long bitter finish; flavors stay resident in the mouth for quite some time. Not as sweet as many other chocolate stouts I have tasted, but very good.

caramel, chocolate, nuts, marshmallows.
black, small brown head that does not last long.
light sweetness, medium bitterness.
light body, thin feel, lively carbonation, bitter finish. Very nice beer, wouldnt mind having it again.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown, with a creamy mocha head. Aroma is very chocolatey, with roasted malts and cardamom. Medium body, with full texture, and soft carbonation. Flavour is burned malts, with cold coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate and notes of leather. Earth end bitter malts in the finish.

bottle, pours black with stable tan head. intense cocoa aroma with some roasted notes in background. Medium bitterness, bitter chocolate in taste, quite dry. Light body, soft carbonation, pleasant bitter chocolate aftertaste,
Pours a dark brown almost black with a thick khaki head. The aroma is chocolate, sweet malts, brown sugar, and caramel. The taste is chocolate, dark fruits, and roasted malts.

On tap @ 111 Castellanza. Marrone, velata, schiuma beige finissima e persistente. Bei riflessi rubino. Aroma intenso, cioccolato fondente, cacao in polvere, tostatura, leggermente erbaceo. maltato (caramello), toffee. Gusto abboccato, quasi amabile allingresso, poi tostatura e luppolatura mitigano la dolcezza con una punta di acidità ed un amaro elegante. Mediamente corposa, quasi oleosa, poco carbonata. Poco calda. Equilibrata ed armonica.
(Bomber bottle). Dark brown complexion with fluffy tan head and glass lacing. Flavor is chocolate, malt with subtle hops that finishes bittersweet.   ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Katsuragawa Aeon. Labelled as Chocolate Bear Beer. Huge sweet chocolate aroma, something nutty and malty as well. Flavour is sweet, chocolatey and malty and has a nice dry oatmeal finish.

Strong smell of chocolate. Very dark brown colour, dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, some licorice, some oat. Medium bitter, very sweet. Soft but plentiful carbon, semi-ashy texture. Finishes with some pepper.
The head is ok, the body black. It smells, chocolate, malty, roasty, creamy. The taste is chocolate, malty, creamy, bit roasty, good
Strong dark chocolate aroma and taste. Excellent dessert beer. Less good with Mexican food.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Aroma: big chocolate, dark roast coffee, mild alcohol
Appearance: opaque black, with fluffy tan head
Taste: mild sweetness, bitterness that builds to a sharp, lingering finish
Palate: light-medium body, not much carbonation, bitter finish

Chocolate up front is a bit muted compared to the huge bitter finish. Somewhat disappointed based on expectations.

Had to get used to it in the beginning, but after a couple of sips, this one got me in quite a good way. Pours dark black with a brownish head that lasts long. Bit like a coffee if you ask me. Aroma is dark sweet with clear cocoa notes and some dark fruits. Some dark roasts as well. Beautiful sugars, great coffee. Really nice. Taste is heavy bitter with a clear note of the chocolate. Sweetness is overwhelmed by the bitterness. However, you still feel the chocolate, burnt caramels, coffee, the dark fruits and the roasty notes. Something spicy as well. Bit of a warmishness in the boozy, long finish, that is mainly roasty and bitter. Yet the chocolateness remains pretty strong. It is pretty good though. Nicely full bodied, bit of a creamy, thick texture that fits with the whole of this brew. Great. Nice brew in general. Balanced more towards the bitter side, yet the creamy and sweetish kick in it gives it something smooth that makes it a lot more softer. Really interesting and definitely worth another try.

BOTTLE. Poured black with a fluffy tan head. Drinking chocolate powder on the nose more so than "a chocolate bar". Creamy texture with a Chocolate malt hit up front , slight dark chocolate bitterness at the back end. Really good beer.
Sourced Cellarbrations @ Capel

On tap at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Black body with a nice brown head. Aroma is sweet, with chocolate, some roasted and raspberries. Taste is medium sweet with choolate, burnt caramel, roasted notes, dark fruits, raspberries. Medium body with low carbonation.

Enjoyed as chocolate bear beer... Dark black pour with light tan head... Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted malts... Flavor has a solid chocolate malt base with a slightly bitter chocolate and roasted finish...solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quite right amount of flavor and aroma of chocolate in beer. But there are some watery taste too unfortunately. Lovely bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. Wonderful beer to enjoy. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
On tap. Milk chocolate characterize both aroma and taste. Bitter and roasted final. Lively carbonation, medium body.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours dark muddy brown with firmly packed tan head. Cherry choc on the nose, carbed a bit too high imo, frys turkish delight aboounds - though not as much as its big brother double choc. Espresso bitterness lingers nicely

Bottle. Opaque, nearly black pour with a creamy brown head. Aroma is soft, creamy chocolate. Flavour is mostly chocolate, some malty notes underneath, nicely balanced between sweet and bitter. A bit of a metallic note at the end, keeps it from being outstanding, but mostly a very nice chocolate stout.

ENG: 650ml bottle from Liquor Mart Winnipeg, poured into the glass. Color is very dark brown, almost black with brown head (the head doesnt last too long, but there was some nice lacing). Roasty aroma of chocolate and vanilla, and something like a sweet dessert cream and caramel. Overall the aroma is very sweet and deep - amazing. Theres huge presence of dark chocolate (like ice cream) in taste, but also spices and a very nice, mild bitterness in aftertaste. Gives the feeling of stickiness and sweetness but its not really sweet (thats the chocolate which "fools" your brain), well actually its bitter, but nice and mild. Low carbonation, great drinkability. Amazing chocolate beer, definitely a returner! ~~~/////~~~ PL: Butelka 650ml kupiona w Liquor Mart Winnipeg, przelana do szkła. Bardzo ciemno-brązowa - brunatna, niemal czarna barwa z jasno-brązową pianą (która nie była zbyt obfita ale pozostawiała ładny lejsing). Palone aromaty czekolady, wanilii oraz jakby słodkiej śmietanki deserowej, karmelu. Aromat bardzo słodki i głęboki - coś wspaniałego. W smaku bardzo mocno ciemno-czekoladowe (przypominające smak lodów), ale także przyprawy i lekka - przyjemna i nie zalegająca goryczka w posmaku. Uczucie lepkości oraz słodkości (ale tak naprawdę to piwo nie jest słodkie lecz lekko i przyjemnie gorzkawe, to tylko ta czekolada "oszukuje mózg"). Niskie nasycenie, świetna pijalność. Niesamowite piwo czekoladowe, jedno z lepszych jakie piłem - na pewno do niego wrócę!

03.01.2015, 0,65l bottle @ home:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, dark sugar, chocolate, dark malts, vanilla, caramel, grass, roasted grain, coffee. Taste is slightly dry roasted, dark malts, grass, minerals, burnt caramel, bittet chocolate, roasted grain, hay, burnt coffee, dark sugar. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice.
Chocolate and coffee smell, chocolate taste. Delicious. So amazing. 750 ml bottle shared with a buddy in banff.

a real chocolate beer!!!!!!! caramel, chocolate, roasty, toast, resin, dough, leather, earthy, licorice, brown, black, clear, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, flat, long finish,

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Botella. @XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine. Sevilla 26/12/2014
Botella de @Vivalabirra, Oviedo. 06/12/2015
Color negro, espuma beige, sabor dulce, toques cacao, buena.
Amazing black color...nice chocolate aromas, super strong flavors, sweet aftertaste and a bit unpleasant finish,but still a great nightcap beer.
22 oz bottle. Aroma: roasty, malty, and chalky, with hints of chocolate, bread, and dirt. Taste/Palate: creamy and slightly sweet; finishes astringent.

500ml served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a brown color forming a medium to small beige and bubbled head that dissipates quickly leaving only very few spotty lacings in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of chocolate and cocoa in the nose. Sweet. Strong notes of roasted malts, chocolate malts, crystal malts, oatmeal. Milky hints. Flowery hops in the very end. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of chocolate, cocoa, roasted malts, chocolate malts, crystal malts, oatmeal. Creamy and milky. Earthy notes. Good bitterness. Good mix of hops and roast bitterness. Great bittersweet balance. 
M: Creamy body. Medium to low carbonation. Cocoa in the aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. 
[ BA Review @ 01/02/2014 ]

Poured from tap to glass. Dark hue with creamy brown head that settled. Aroma is chocolate, toffee, caramel, roast. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and crisp Carbonation. Taste is sweet with a slight astringent bitter following. Overall this is a nice brew.

Bottle as chocolate Bear Beer Bitter. Rich dark and milk chocolate nose, vanilla, caramel. Black with a pretty brown head. Tasty dark chocolate flavor, dry but a bit milky, nicely bitter finish. Medium body, jsut rightl this is damn good stuff. Good bitterness last a long time.
Wow have had this from the bottle many a time just had it on tap and it is so amazing!! Bitter Belgium chocolate all over, dessert beer of champions!!

large frothy light brown head. flat black thick body. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. aroma: waffle, chocolate, chocolate icre cream, malt. if: light bitter sweet (chocolate). ff: moderate bitter light sweet; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. toques de café permeados por chocolate amargo. final de trufas. 75s

Black color with a bit of an amber-brown highlight and beige small head. Aroma is coffee and cocoa beans. Taste is cocoa at the beginning, milky feeling, and then theres bitterness kicking in with a dry coffee finish. Very well-balanced, one of the better Chocolate Stouts!

Bottle at home. Has a black colour with a beige head. The aroma is dominated by cocoa, coffee, chocolate truffles and burned wood. The flavour has more roasted malt, ash and chocolate in the background. Has a slick and silky mouth feel. A fantastic dessert beer. Nicely roasted and filled with chocolate.

Opaque black. Minimal head. Pungent chocolate, roast, malt, caramel and vanilla aroma. Thick, creamy and smooth. Absolutely delectable. Chocolate, caramel, roast, vanilla and malt all coalesce and formulate a wonderfully smooth and complex flavour that finishes with a mildly bitter hoppy/roast taste. Rogue continues to supplant its competitors.
Black color with tall brown head, aromas of chocolate and coffee, oily texture, light bittersweet finish.
650ml bottle at home. Dark brown with a soapy tan head. Medium body with low carbonation. Great chocolate sweetness. Cacao, vanilla, roastes malts, brown sugar and herbs. Great tasty brew.

650 ml bottle. Pours black with moderate tan head. Aromas of rich chocolate with a bit of vanilla and roasted malts. Up front flavors are the same with a weak bitter dry chocolate finish. Pretty much all chocolate though quite enjoyable.
0,65l bottle @ Metro, Lahti. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and chocolate. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, chocolate and some coffee. Excellent!

Its always fun to try a Chocolate Stout. Rogue Chocolate Stout is fun to drink for reasons beyond the novelty of the experience. This is an expertly balanced stout all the way through. But well get to that. Appearance is superb. Color is black as my soul, and the head is rocky and appropriately cocoa colored. Smell points mostly to coffee but toasted malt and cocoa beans shine through, too. Flavor is chocolaty without being excessive. Roasted coffee hits the front of the tongue. The middle is sweet, milky, malty, rich, and creamy. Finally, the hops help to create a final sensation that captures the fruity, spicy character of bittersweet chocolate. Cant wait to try the Double Chocolate Stout!
Amazing aroma of chocolate and vanilla, great looking dark colour not much head. Amazing taste of chocolate and vanilla with a watery feel and a weak chocolate palate.

Bottle.

A- Bakers chocolate, milky, coffee, roasty.

A- Black color, dark color, brown head.

T- Mocha, milk chocolate, slight bitterness, coffee, malty, roasty, nutty.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty finish.

O- A smooth and milky stout that is very well balanced and smooth. The aroma is more of a dry bakers chocolate and the palate is more of a milk chocolate route. Overall, this is one of Rouges best beers in my opinion.

Rated from notes taken 6 Mar 2014 -- Its been a long while since Ive had this beer. Great roasty malt flavor that is deepened by the chocolate flavor. Very enjoyable beer to drink pretty much anytime.

Pours black with a beautiful dark tan head. Aroma is of dark chocolate, sour milk, coffee and tootsie rolls. Tastes of dark chocolate syrup, coffee, smoke, roasted malt, and even some mint. Has a dry heavy body with low carbonation and a burnt aftertaste. This is a very nice dessert replacement.
Black colour, tan brownish head. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate. Taste is light to medium sweet, a lot of chocolate flavour. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Very nice
bottle. Black with one finger head. Nice thick pour. Old bottle, but chocolate flavors are strong. A touch of oxidation, but overall, flavors are excellent. One of the better Rogue beers Ive had.

Color negro con espuma beige algo ligera. Aromas de cereal dulce, chocolate. Cuerpo medio-bajo, inicio dulce, que recuerda claramente al cereal al que se une un sabor achocolatado que hacia el final adquiere un amargor  terroso moderado muy rico. Excelente.

Dark black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate and nuts. Taste of bitter dark chocolate, coffee and a nutty aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with white head. Nose is chocolate, chocolate and more chocolate, oatmeal maybe. Taste is chocolate, coffee notes. Impressive taste when looked at ABV. Great stout.
40cl @ tap. Aroma di cioccolato evidente, schiuma ottima ne fanno una scura dolce ma non stucchevole. ottima.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 Mørk farge med medium høyde på skummet. Aroma av sjokolade, røstet malt og noe kaffe. Smaken er stort sett det samme. Medium konsistens, behagelig bitter i ettersmaken.

Solid stout but I wrecked my palate so my taste was off. Notes of dark chocolate, coffee, and soft vanilla. Flavors of semi-bitter chocolate, roasted malts, and lactose sugar. Low carbonation, semi-dry, with a very slight bitter finish.

Well there you go, dammit! Pure chocolate scrumptiousness! Perhaps the best Sweet Stout I have ever had, maybe even the best Stout. Its spot on beauty kicks things off, opaque as is possible and with a generous, lasting medium-dark tan head. The smell is fiendishly wondrous; rich, dark smooth chocolate, roast malts, dark cherries, vanilla and leather speak this beers scent. The taste matches magnificently, the taste of all things lingers, leaving you longing for more. The texture is amazing, smooth, full bodied, lightly oily. A perfectly bittersweet taste is left behind, as well as the best tan lacing I have ever seen. A glorious gulp, wish I had more of these.

"great interplay with the bitterness of the hops and the sweetness of the chocolate. a little high and tight on the carbonation, but a great, super choclatey bitter beer...great for floats :) a little thin on tap as well, but still very good. the aroma is amazing."
Fin og rund kaffe og sjokolade. Litt tørrende sot. God svak aroma av rosinish i tillegg til kaffen. Rund finish, over 40
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av god sjokolade. Smak av sjokolade og kakao. Moderat karbonering og bitterhet. Tap @ Melkebaren.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2014 Drunk with chris and mary at their place in prague 50. finally made it there. pours dark dark brown with a tan head. strong bittersweet aroma, milk choco, a little coffee. taste is bitter chocolate. quite thick and creamy. some more malty choco would have been nice but its still great. slightly hoppy edge as well. chris said its like drinking a chocolate milkshake and hes right

650mL bottle BB 01/08/14
Looks good; jet black body small tan head.
Nice aroma; milk coffee, dark chocolate - in a good way, not artificial - toasted nuts & cereals, caramel, with a generous helping of citrusy hop.
Full body, smooth texture bit oily, moderately low carbonation.
Palate starts with some sweet chocolate (70% cocoa-like), touch of caramel & nuttiness, then dries out with leafy, resiny hop, citrus rind and a bold lingering bitterness.
Tasty stuff, additional chocolate flavour noticable, but not overdone.

Bottle - good size tan colored thick head, black color, roasty and chocolate aroma and flavor, mild coffee notes, mildly silky finish - pretty good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep, dark brown with a large creamy tan head which lingers a bit.........aroma is chocolate, raisins (Chunky bar?) ........taste is rich chocolate, coffee aftertaste, dates but far too thin for the amount of flavor. Needs mouthfeel, body, chewiness whatever you want to call it....far too much flavor to be so thin.

Thought it would be closer to a imperial stout, but this one lacks the full, thick richness of a good RIS. Chocolate and some coco. Thin palate and very bitter. Should not be their highest ranking beer.

This isnt a. Bad beer, but its not a great beer either. It pours a deep silky black with a thick tan head. The aroma is very straight forward- lots of chocolate notes with subtle smoke. This smokiness carries through in the taste, as does the chocolate. Initially very sweet, with a creamy mouthfeel. The fi ish is weird though with a hoppy bitterness that I dont get. One minute Im tasting yummy chocolatey goodness and then this weird bitterness?? Sort of strange. But up to the finish this is a great beer. I wish theyd tweet it a bit and fix the finish,
Botella de 65 cl, adquirida en Slainte. Color negro. Sabor a malta, chocolate, dulce, ligeramente a regaliz.

Smells like milk chocolate candy (M&Ms). Small head, but nice rings of light brown lacing. Tastes more roasty than I anticipated. Fairly bitter finish. Some acid. Nice beer; not amazing. Not understanding the high overall rate.

Aroma is acidic. Metallic. A hint of chocolate. Oatmeal. Lighter. Sweet

Looks fine. Tan head. Black. 

Taste is very sweet like aspartame note. Chocolate on the finish. Like a milk chocolate. Acidic on the finish. Decently balanced but so dry. Hops hops hops on the finish. 

Palate is.... Not so good. Super dry and lingering hops on the finish. Its a chocolate stout... Shouldnt be hops on the finish. Medium light body. 

This is beer is ok.... The taste is good but the palate is rough. The hops on the finish are really not what Im looking for in a chocolate stout. Had this in the same sitting as a founders breakfast and that was def better.
Tap, Crowbar. Smells chocolate! A bit thin, perhaps. Taste of chocolate, hint og coffee.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Big bottle, served in TeKu. Pours gently with thick, creamy and beige head. Aroma is toffee, some vanilla, chocolate and subtle coffee. Very creamy and pleasant. Taste is quite dry with lots of chocolate, roasted malts, some coffee, oily texture. I think more sweetness would correspond well with soft mouthfeel, otherwise beer seems a little bit too dry for me. Anyway, its another great beer from Rogue, extremely enjoyable.
Pretty good, not my favourite. I miss a nice body but its really drinkeble and enjoyable. I like the roasted barley and the chocolat. Rogue rules but this aint my cup of tea.

Intense mocca pie... great... more darker chocolat tones in the back... light body, a bit watery.. roasted finish with more chocolat... soft carbs... quickly fading head... sweet n a bit bitter, lacks some sweetness?
Avalanche de chocolat sans écoeurer. Assez légère et facile à boire. Bonne stout mais pas si exceptionelle que ca.

Shared at my Summer Plunder Tasting by Kery. A dark cola pour which is black with ruby highlights. 5% great cocoa nib aroma very smooth. Medium bodied with a bitter dark cacao flavor and some sweet vanilla notes. A nice solid chocolate stout.

Totally black with thick beige head. Nice lacing. Strong aroma of sweet chocolate, hint of vanilla and mocha. Good at nose, but taste is even better! Lots of chocolate, coffee with milk and vanilla background. Texture is oily. Full body. Low carbonation. Awesome stout, one of the best Ive drank.
Dyp sort farge. Lite skum, ring langs kant. Mye duft av sjokolade, kaffe og vanilje. Gos smak av sjokolade, kaffe og vanilje.
I wanted more than I got. The aroma is amazing, but aside from that I thought this let me down somehow. Its not bad, its just not good.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Chocolate stout with thick, beige, creamy head and dark mahogany colour, approaching black. Aroma strongly dominated by cocoa powder, toffee and chocolate bars, some coffee and dark fruits as well; very chocolatey taste, like a fluid bar of bitter chocolate, powdery, soft mouthfeel, oats and cocoa powder, sweetish and yeasty but assertively roasted bitter in the end with leafy hops. Great if you like chocolate.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes fast schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv schokoladig, röstmalzig, Vanille. Geschmack röstmalzig, Schokolade, Vanillee, leicht würzig.
Keg at brewdog Edinburgh. Pours black, nose is light chocolate, taste is bitter, sweet chocolate.

(Rogue Chocolate Stout) Bottle 650 ml at home, poured into a snifter. ABV 6.5 on the importers sticker. 
Totally black colour on the body, very thick as I pour it. Small brown head, maybe half a finger in size, no more than that. Average retention, minimal lacing left behind along with a foam island on the surface.
Aroma is full of chocolate, very lactic, oats, light mocha. Very appealing and inviting.
Dessert in a glass. Lots of chocolate and all kinds of it. Milky chocolate, dark bitter chocolate, chocolate fudge. All the sweetness balances out on the finish with light roasted malts and a nice, mild bitterness that brings again in mind chocolate. Fantastic!
Medium thick body, notable carbonation. Sticky palate.
Truly great beer!

Sample at Gents Bierfestival 2014. THX for sharing todays beers!
APPEARANCE: black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: chocolate, sweet, coffee.
TASTE: chocolate, coffee, bitter, nice.
Pitch black, with a large head. Aroma of a stout with some sweet accents. Weak taste, quite bitter. Full body, medium carbonation. Not very special.

Aroma of slightly charred, roasted malts. The chocolatey tones also come through as the beer comes up to temperature. Flavour is roasty and has some light coffee too. Pleasantly chocolatey in the finish and aftertaste.

Sampled @ Gents Bierfestival 2014. 650 ml. bottle. Spare mocha frothy head. Lightly cloudy blackish dark brown. Smell is creamy eastern European chocolate, sugar sugar, vanilla, mocha,..; Taste is sweet, cookies, sweet, sugar, above all creamy eastern European chocolate, chocolate sauce, mocha, vanilla,.. Creamy lighter body. Very nice chocolate beer not top because it still doesnt accomplish tasting like high quality Belgian chocolate (not sure if any beer has managed doing that) but very enjoyable all the same of course.

Aroma: Dark chocolate with great dose of vanilla. The roasted malts takes only small part in overall smell. First impression - very good.
Taste: Dark chocolate with very balanced bitterness on the foreground, but a couple second later vanilla joins them and it taste like classy pralines. You can feel a little bit of orange peel and bananas. There is also something like toffee candys. I think that classic chocolate muffin will be the best choice for that beer.
To sum up, very good beer, and if you like chocolate stouts it have to take part on your shopping list.
Price: [Warsaw, Poland] 34 PLN = 8 Euros

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, orange
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lighty sour
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect

Butelka 650ml.
OCZY : piwo jest ciemnobrązowe ale nie jest przejrzyste i z daleka wygląda na czarne jak smoła. Piana jest średniej wielkości i jest brązowa. 

NOS : piwo ma rewelacyjne aromaty ciemnych palonych słodów i czekolady. Czekolada wychodzi na pierwszy plan, do tego sporo śmietany i wanilii, toffi... niesamowity zapach mlecznej czekolady i ciepłych lodów. Do tego delikatnie orzechy, sernik, lody bananowe, skórka pomarańczy... zapach ogólnie urzeka. 

USTA : piwo jest mało nasycone o konsystencji kakaa. 
Piwo jest faktycznie dosyć słodkie o dominujących nutach ciasta, czekolady i pianki śmietankowej. Gorycz jest subtelna na początku i staje się coraz bardziej wyraźna. Nuty podobne są w części do palonych nut kawy ale tylko w części bo reszta zasługi należy się chmielom. Chmiele są na tyle niezapomniane, że udaje im się wydobyć spod tak mocnego charakteru słodowego tego piwa. Są to nuty podobne do pestki grejpfruta i skórki pomarańczy. Posmak jest subtelny i nie zalega tak jak w tym stylu potrafią piwa. Tutaj mamy do czynienia z typowa cierpkością podobna do popielniczki i gorzkiej czekolady. 

ODCZUCIA : piwo zrobiło na mnie wrażenie. Jest to pierwsze tak bardzo autentyczne czekoladowe piwo jakie piłem. Oprócz tego jest łatwe w piciu i świetnie zbalansowane. 

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 6/10
styl : +2

Bomber poured into beer mug. It taste of dark chocolate. It starts with a sweet roasted flavor then fades into bitterness with a lingering taste similar to coffee. I would really love to try this on a nitro tap.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow, what a good bear. Aroma and taste of chocolate, marshmallows, coffee and some malt. Great beer.
Bottle. Aroma chocolate, tobbacco, sweet wood, vanilla. Almost black colour. Brown head. Taste sweet wood, vanilla, chocolate, sweet all the way. Really smooth mouthfeel. Very very good. Excellent.

Flasa. Cierna farba, hneda kremova pena. Vona kavova, lieskove oriesky, sladka cokolada. V chuti tmave a prazene slady, sladka cokolada, v pozadi lieskove oriesky. Telo slabe, vodove, vyssia nasytenost. Pivo krasne vyvazene, pitelne, krasne chutne.

Bomber into a pint glass. Pours black, with a moderate tan head which quickly fades into a disc on the surface. Not much aroma, but faint notes of dark malt and oatmeal present. Taste is dark malt and good chocolate. Finish is long, with a creamy mouth feel and long finish with just the right note of hop bitterness. Very good.

Bottle, Beer Moth, Manchester. Black pour with a fast fading tan head. Sweet chocolate snout with notes of vanilla and roast. Smooth, sweet chocolate laden flavour with some malts present. Some hop bitterness emerged towards the finish. Drinkable but Im not really sold. Seems over-rated.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2015 Pechschwarz, schöner fingerdicker Schaum. In der Nase Schokonoten, Kakao, Holz, Süße, minimaler Alkohol. Am Gaumen Kakao, Bitterschokolade, Süße, angenehme Bitterkeit, Vanille Holz, Kaffee, leichte dunkle Früchtenoten. Cremig, gut karbonisiert.

Bottle - Pours black with a big tan head. Chocolate, espresso and some hop. Taste is chocolate up front with a dry finish. Theres a hop taste in the middle which Im really not sure of. Medium mouthfeel.

Appearance was clear black with diminishing creamy beige 1/2 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are chocolate, roasted barley, mocha latte sweetness, no alcohol. Taste are chocolate coffee upfront with middle mocha sweetness and roasty finish. Palate was smooth creamy CO2 with medium body, lasting roasty light dryish finish. A enjoyable chocolate stout, smooth out the finish, then would be stunning.
Black pour, tan head. Nose is huge chocolate, a touch vegetal, roasted malts. Taste is chocolate, roasty. Thin mouthfeel.

The aroma reminds me of a sweetened coffee or perhaps a Baileys with coffee, it truly is intoxicatingly outstanding. Bitter chocolate also on the nose. I also detect some slight hop bitterness on the aroma and it is very pleasant.

Pours a dark brown with a tan head that endures well over a couple of minutes and leaves great lacing everywhere. 

Dark malt sweetness on entry but not overly sweet, The bitterness will always be present. On the palate the bitterness pops out very nicely, perhaps a bit exaggerated, but it works well given the other elements present here.

When it warms up enough, the chocolate aromas shine more than the coffee ones. However the bitterness will stay on the palate for a rather long time, unless youre having a rich chocolate dessert with this, which I feel is what it was made for. An outstanding bittersweet example of this style and would probably be a great component in a cocktail.
Tap at Lazy Dog. Pours an opaque cola brown work a ring of tan head. Taste of chocolate and roasted malts. Aroma is heavy on the malts, roasted almost burned, with more of the nice chocolate notes.

Bottle. Very dark brown - almost black, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, faint roasted malt, artificial like (milk)chocolate. Body is medium to full, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light roasted malt and (milk)chocolate, light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, some roasted malt and light (milk)chocolate with light hoppyness. Artificial like (milk)chocolate dominates aroma. OK flavor with roastiness and light bitterness. Bit one-dimensional, lacks character.

On-tap at Roundhouse Taproom in SoHo, Central as part of a 5-in-1 beer platter and kindly shared by WheatKing. Thanks Adam!
Opaque black colour; Half finger head and creamy beigr foam which lasted for 1 minute; Small sticky lacing and zero carbonation; Very Sweet aroma of malt, with massive milk chocolate, light coffee, cream, sugar and Belgian waffles; Mid to light sweet taste of roasted dark malt, with light nuts, tart notes, black coffee, dark chocolate, molasses notes, strong lemon, bitter hops and sharp grass; Mid to light body. Dry palate;
Mouth feel is strong nice chocolate and coffee, creamy and not too sweet. All in solid good body. Yes!... Hoppiness is strong grassy nose. Strong lemon and grassy hop in taste; Bitterness is strong and solid for a lasting, tart and bitter finish; Quite dry after taste. Quite creamy to mouth.

Comments: This one is a close match against Youngs Double Chocolate Stout. Whereas Youngs tends to be creamier, this one is all chocolate - more dark than milk - both in nose and taste. Will definitely wanna try the bottle in the future to see it for real. For now, though, its quite a top stout even on tap. A few good one from Rogue!

On tap at the Roundhouse, Hong Kong. Pours very dark brown, tan head. Nose is powdery chocolate, licorice. Flavour is moca choc/coffee, slight dry roast. Finish has roast, sweetness, a hit of molasses.

Pours black with a creamy head. Aroma with light roastiness and chocolate. Taste is like having chocolate in your mouth. Very intensive as not only having bitter but also a hint of milk chocolae on the palate. Very well balanced. Chocolate stout at its best.

Black pour under a foamy dark khaki head. Lovely nose featuring creamy milk chocolate and some light roast notes. Full body with a nice creamy milk chocolate flavor, sweet lactose notes, a gentle black malt roastiness, and a gentle pseudo biscuit-like finish.

Transfer from BA review from 6-6-12- 
Served in a 10 oz chalice glass

Appearance  Served a deep-deep brown color with a very small light tan head. The head faded very fast leaving almost no lacing.

Smell  A nice aroma of chocolate with some roasted malt notes mixed in are the biggest. These create a slightly semi-sweet chocolate smell when mixed with a lighter sweeter aroma of toffee and milk.

Taste  The taste is of a roasted malt with a good deal of dark chocolate up front. As the taste advances it sweetens some with the toffee flavors coming to the tongue. This toffee creates a more milk chocolate/semi-sweet chocolate bar like flavor in the middle of the taste which, as time advances further continues to strengthen. It is a very satisfying flavor that carries to the end, where some coffee flavors bitter the taste a bit and leave a very satisfying coffee infused dark chocolate flavor on the tongue.

Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the creamier side with the carbonation level being on the lower side. Both suit the flavor profile of the beer quite well and allow all the chocolaty flavors to be sensed by the tongue.

Overall A very nice chocolate stout that is very easy to drink. Rouge has done a nice job with this one and I would recommend.
Delicious chocolate treat with a hoppy finish. Beautiful to look at and even better to taste. Another great beer from Rogue!

One finger head, wonderful chocolate nose. Rich creamy chocolate and coffee on the front. Lightly malted and salt, more bitter than sweet. Smooth, but slightly short, abrupt finish. A nice enjoyable stout.

Aroma: 4/10. Smells of burnt malt and hops, very metallic aroma characteristic of those terrible hops Rogue insists on using.

Appearance: 5/5. Looks like I want my stouts to look like; opaque black with a medium-thick gray-tan head that lasts.

Taste: 6/10. Burnt malt, bitter coffee, notes of cocoa (not chocolate, just cocoa, and burnt-tasting cocoa at that.) Too much hops used (just like everything else Ive had from Rogue, sigh.) Metallic. More like a Guiness-style dry stout than the sweet treats Im used to.

Palate: 4/5. Nice mouthfeel, creamy head, smooth on the tongue. Lingering roast/burnt malt flavor and hoppy bitterness. 

Overall: 14/20. A really well-crafted beer that, unfortunately, makes that same classical Rogue breweries problem: Letting the hops run wild over everything good about the beer. If you prefer Guiness-style dry stouts to traditional sweet stouts, youll probably rate this a lot higher. But unfortunately, for my palate, this isnt the beer Im looking for, and Rogue breweries continues its losing streak with me.

Its very dark brown, almost black in color. The body is quite opaque with a few streams of tiny bubbles that are only visible near the sides of the glass. The head is thick and pillowy with excellent retention. It has a dark tan color and it leaves behind cool tan lace that slowly slides down the sides of the glass. The aroma has a pleasant blend of dark and milk chocolate with doughy sweetbread malt. The flavor has a wonderful balance with a mild, subtle malt base with semi sweet chocolate and some roasted flavors that turns more bitter sweet and dark chocolaty as the hops add a mild bitterness. The palate is smooth and mellow with a medium body that gets thinner and drier in the finish. Carbonation is active yet still smooth. Over all this has an easy drinking character with nicely balanced flavors that work well and complement each other wonderfully.
Good stout, was exacting a little more sweetness, was a little more bitter than sweet so cant agree with the perfect blend of bitter and sweet. Good stout however.

22 oz bottle from Evergreen Discount. Thick, black appearance with a creamy light brown head. Fresh cocoa and chocolate aroma adding notes of dark malts, roasted coffee, oats, toasted grains and earthy hops. Similar flavor, bitter chocolate and light sweetness. Rich, earthy and lightly hoppy with a lingering finish. Medium body, somewhat dry feeling.

Chocolate stouts are probably my favorite beer category (right now) and this one didnt let me down. Very nice semi-sweet flavoring and nice mixture of hops. It wasnt as dark as I like most of my stouts, but all in all a great brew.

655ml bottle

Appearance: black beer with a big creamy brownish head with good retention,leavi behind allmost no lacing.
Aroma:chocolate, roasted malts, light coffee
Taste: Dark chocolate ad roasted malts. Bittersweet, with enough bitterness to fiish the botlle easilly.
Medium body, slightly below average carbonation, creamy texture

Very well balanced, chocolate stout. A bit one dimesional, but its very refined.
Not usually my style but this brew has won me over. Where their Mocha Porter is a shrinking violet this one is full on in your face with the chocolate - which makes it a fabulous desert beer.

W aromacie mnóstwo czekolady, głównie słodkiej, mlecznej, choć bardziej gorzka i nuty palonego słodu też są obecne. W smaku bardziej wytrawne aniżeli można się spodziewać, dość pełne, dużo czekolady deserowej, paloność, lekki kwasek, finisz chmielowo palony, przyjemny.Smaczny stout!
Bottle. Black beer with very good head. Lots of chocolate in aroma. In taste chocolate, roastiness, coffee. Very creamy. Very good chocolate stout.
Taste like chocolate heaven in a glass of rich stout goodness.everything is right about this wonderfully smooth beer.try if you can get it.

zwart ondoorzichtig met fijne schuimige bruine kraag.
aroma van volle melkchocolade, geroosterde mouten, zoet chocolade.
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, zwak bittertje, stevig, geroosterde mouten, pepertje, lichte hoppen, vol van body, romig en glad van textuur, lage co2, afdronk is chocolade en zoet. Over het algemeen een goede chocolade stout

22 ounce bottle. Opaque black color topped by a big rocky tan head. Rich chocolate malt aroma reminds me of my first glass of Ovaltine. Sweet cocoa and malted milk are the predominant characteristics. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor has a dry, chalky mineral palate. Finishes dry and bittersweet. A very nice stout, indeed.

This stout has a distinct chocolate taste, with a good head and medium body. I guess for a chocolate beer, this is pretty good, but I personally like beer to taste like malt and hops. It is well balanced.

This chocolate stout is one of the most truly chocolate in its flavor. It is penetrated by a smokiness which lingers. It has a rich black color and creamy head. If you are going to call something a chocolate stout this is it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at beertemple, amsterdam. Black color, brown head. Aroma is full chocolate, roasty. Nice roasty body, chocolate, hoppy end. Very good and tasteful stout full of chocolate.

Draft. Black body with tan head. Aroma is roasted malts some coffee some cocoa some caramel. Taste is also the same as the aroma with some dried fruit notes and I think some mint. Aftertaste is roasted malts and medium bitter.
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a big, creamy head. Aroma: a lot of chocolate, some cocoa, coffee. Taste of chocolate, coffee. Beer is medium bodied, creamy, not very bitter. Good stout.

Draught at Craft Bier Fest Wien. Pitch black body, with a big, creamy, tan head. Aroma of dark, melting chocolate, cocoa powder, coffee, some dark fruits. Tastes of coffee, cocoa beans, chocolate, wood, dried fruits, some honey. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy, with a lively carbonation and it finishes bitter-roasty and slightly sweet, with coffee and cocoa beans, wood and some honey. Really tasty! Dark, complex and still quaffable and pretty easy to drink.

Dobre prawie doskonale piwo bardzo ciemne geste nieprzezroczyste. Brazowo-czarne z kremowa i bezowa piana, moze nie za wielka i srednio trwala. Aromat czekolady wiadomo, w smaku budyniowe czekoladowe troche owsiane. Ale czekolada naturalna dodana przoduje. I tak powinno byc w tym piwie. Gozkawa i ciemna pewnie taka zastosowali. Slodkie ale bardzo umiarkowanie. Gozkosc czekolady wspaniale tu rownowazy te proporcje. Swietne do deserow. polecam
650 ml bottle. Dark brown with medium light brown head. Aroma is sweet, dominated by chocolate with notes of roasted malt and vanilla. Flavor is the same with a bittersweet finish.

Tasty beer, smells nice and has a nice flavor, without being over powering. Hides the 6.3% well.

Pours a pitch black color, absorbing all light trying to get through. Aroma of cacao and coffee. Taste of coffee and bitter chocolate with lively carbonation and hops. Nice brew.
Wow. Thats a lot of chocolate in there. Solid cascade hops (not too noticeable behind all the chocolate malt) in a light stout. Now Ive got to get my hands on the imperial.
Bottle. Yup it's chocolate. Pours black with nice tan head. Nose is pure chocolate syrup. Taste is more powdery tasting. Nice bitter chocolate aftertaste.

Molt bona cervesa, amb molt aroma i gust a xocolata.
Muy buena cerveza, con mucho aroma y sabor a chocolate.

Aromat niesamowity, jakbym głowę wsadził do worka z kakao.
