caramel, coffee, chocolate, earthy, black, cloudy, frothy, medium sweetness, full body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

a very nice chocolate stout, soft flavours with a lingering aftertaste
At BBF. Black colour with tan head. Chocolate, coffee and milk aroma. Milk chocolate , sweet taste, also some coffee. Medium body.
smells like chocolate shake. pretty carbonated. dreamily creamy. earthy oatey flavor, rich chocolate truffle finish

Draught @ BBF 2014. Black beer with a beige head. Aroma has delicious dark chocolate roasted malts and sweet coffee. Flavour has a lot coffee, malts and chocolate. Despite all this its not too heavy, quite fresh actually.

Pours a finger of tan head on a black body.
The aroma is rich chocolate, a little coffee, and roasted malt.
The taste is nice and chocolaty with some mild coffee bitterness in the background to balance it out. 
The texture is crisp with some smoothness on the side and moderate carbonation.
Quite enjoyable.

On tap at Pipes of Scotland. Black with tan head. Aroma with massive milk chocolate plus some darker chocolate notes, roasted and creamy. Taste is not as thick as the smell promised, massive chocolate, milk chocolate, light smoke with low bitterness. Decent

Teku/Nonic glass. Pitch black with great, medium lasting, beige, big head. Good lacing. Aroma is not very inviting. Aroma is chocolate, but block of chocolate not hot liquid chocolate. This is really nice and the aroma is not too strong. Taste is coco, dark chocolate, some roasted malts. Medium sweet, light to medium bitter with some very light sour elements. Thick texture, creamy, low carbonation, medium body. In overall you really feel that chocolate, it could be more sweet, beside chocolate nothing knocked me down. Worth trying.
From tap @ BBF 2014. Nice aroma, chocolate with coffee, sweet, nesquik. Flavor has moderate bitterness with notes chocolate, light roasted malt, sweet.
On tap at Barcelona Beer Festival 2014. Dark dark red color. Thin to medium head. Smooth body. Chocolate and roasted aroma. Wheres my milk? :(

650mL bottle. Pours pitch black with a nice mocha head. Amazing milk chocolate aroma which follows through to the flavour with a bitter coffee backing and a slight spice/fruitiness from the hops. Nice beer.
Excellent on tap, chocolate aroma and aftertaste are exceptional. Smooth texture, smallish tan head and a hint of malty sweetness.
An excellent stout. Pours with a well defined head and appearance is near perfect. Moderate flavour of chocolate, but not too strong to overpower the hops, as well as a slight hint of coffee.

Pours an ebony brown with a chocolate malt aroma. Taste is distinctly coco and roasted malt. A little too much malt overpowered the flavor. The taste wasnt as simple and complex as expected which lent itself to being less than enjoyable. I prefer the double chocolate ...

Barwa: ciemna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana jasno brazowa, obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, stosunkowo szybko opadająca, ale ładnie oblepiająca szkło.

Aromat: czekolada do potęgi (głownie gorzka) i nieco kakao.

Smak: słodowy, niezbyt pełny. Czekolada gorzka, wytrawna paloność oraz lekka goryczka, ale posmak pozostaje czekoladowy.

Interesujące piwo, ale jak dla mnie zbyt deserowe. Wolę raczej nieco bardziej pełne, mocniejsze i słodsze wersje stoutów. W tym przypadku gorzki posmak nieco przytłacza odbiór. Piwo dla miłośników takowej czekolady.
Smells chocolate amd coffee. Pour rich chocolaty brown. Nice chocolate notes while drinking, a little coffee taste too. Overall a good beer, especially if you like chocolate

330 ml bottle in Fort Lauderdale FL. Is a nice and dark almost no head but a layer of small tan bubbles that cover covers its surface. Char, chocolate, coffee, malt aroma. Smooth, with sweet and similar to the aromas taste. The small bubbles that you see on the head, you get that same feel on your palate that gives this beer a creamy, milky texture.

Appearance: Dark brown/black with finger thick tan head.
Aroma: Chocolate, fudge, caramel, toffee.
Taste: Medium bitterness, low/medium sweetness and low sourness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, light body, average carbonation, abrupt astringent chocolate, fudge, toffee, caramel, bitter sweet, malty finish.
Comments: Very tasty and glass lace.
caramel, coffee, roasty, chocolate, vanilla, woody, black, minimal head, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,

Bottle. Pours dark with big head but it disappear quite quickly. Aroma of cocoa, dark chocolate and vanilla. Taste: chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Medium body. It could be more creamy and a bit sweeter.
Draft sampler at The BeerHive in Pittsburgh. Complex and maybe mysterious, this one has quite a lot to offer. A nice natural taste of cocoa without pretension or excess.
Huge cocoa nose, peanut butter. Creamy chocolate, nuts, roasted cereals, bitter cocoa finish. A perfect valentine brew with a big cocoa character without being too sweet.
chocolate, toast, coffee, roasty, black, cloudy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, lively,

Pours dark with fizzing tan head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt and milk chocolate. Medium mouth feel and carbonation. Aftertaste is some sweet chocolate, acidic coffee and some lingering hop bitterness. Overall: overrated. Very bland. Good implementation of chocolate.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.

 Egészen sötét, szinte fekete, vörösesbarna színe van, habja világosbarna, méretes, krémes állagú, de könnyednek tűnik és elég kitartó. Illata olyan, mint a forró csokis tejnek, édeskés, olyan, mintha még tejszínhab is lenne benne és zabkekszet is kapnánk mellé. Ízében is sok csoki van, de van benne kávé is bőven, pirított magvak, kis fás fanyarság és még a komlót is kiérezni belőle. Közepesen testes, elég szénsavas. Utóíze keserédes, kicsit égetett fás, és elég száraz. Ahogy melegszik, úgy veszti el az édességét, ami jól áll neki. Finom!
Draught at Bishop Arms Savoy, MAlmö december 2013. Black beer with a creamy beige head. Milky, chocolate and vanilla aroma. Chocolate, vanilla, coffee flavour with licorice notes.

almost black colour, huge, dense dark brown head - brilliant appearance; aroma of intensive chocolate and cappuccino; taste of roasted coffee and some shocolate - based on the aroma I expected something more sweet and complex, but anyway, its a perfect stout

Un liquide brun tiré dune pompe au Tap42. Une mousse mesurable et résistante. Un nez joli de vanille de Magagascar, de malts chocolatés, davoine grillée. Des saveurs sèches de cacao et de café avec une pointe de vanille légèrement grillée. Une bouche soyeuse. Un corps moyen. Des bulles suffisantes. Une finale qui nest jamais sucrée sur des malts noirs et sur des notes vanillées.

Black colour with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Flavour is chocolate and roasted malts. Not as sweet as I expected. Nice dark chocolate bitterness in the aftertaste. It would be even better with a bit more thickness. That being said, this is a wonderful brew.
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 Draft. Pours black. Aroma is chocolate and hints of malts. Taste is roasted malts and chocolate with mild bitterness.
chocolate, caramel, floral, dough, vanilla, black, minimal head, brown foam, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, lightly sour, full body, lively, long finish,
seriously, how does this get such a good rating? im not getting how this gets a perfect score. pretty forgettable.

Rating #950 - Feb 4, 2014- Beer 7 in the @coopwinespirits February discovery bag. Dark brown pour with a weak off white head. Cocoa and vanilla on the nose, and big coffee earthy malt notes. Taste is very rich in coffee and chocolate, mild vanilla bean. Balanced for a sweet stout, very palatable indeed. Nicely put together.
Pretty dark, tan head. Smells of roasted oat and cacao. Tastes the same with some citrus hops and a long roasted oat finish. Sweet, vanilla, not sticky. Ok but chocolate is mild and quite bitter.
Milk chocolate aroma. Little touch of dark berry. Big dark berry taste, bitter chocolate too. Awesome looking head and good lacing. Thin palate. Needs more punch.
Bottle 65 cl from AbM @ casa Salminen/Säntti. Pours black with a beige head. Sweet chocolate aroma, slight vegetable. Sweet milk chocolate flavour.

This stout pours beautiful almost black with a fluffy tan cloud for a head, this combination always gets me excited because it is the quintessential uniform for stouts everywhere. The aromas remind me of a handmade chocolate and coffee shop near me (Margaret River Chocolate Factory) where the smells of milk and bittersweet dark chocolate fight with freshly made coffee to make this heavenly nose candy that makes me salivate. The body is watery with a lively carbonation, the taste is a nice balance between the sweetness of the chocolate malts and the bitterness of the hops resulting in one tasty beverage!

Bottle:
Pours black, with a thick, tall, brown head.
Milk chocolate-infused coffee and cream aroma.
Creamy, malty, bitter chocolate/cocoa powder taste.
Very nice sweet-to-bitter balance.
Great.
Bottle @JustBeer. Aroma of roasted malts. Very black with brown head. We can taste hints of chocolate, not too present though. Round palate, light bitterness.
Bottle @joes thnx to benzai. Black color. Smells chocolat, roasty, sweet, vanilla. Tastes chocolat, vanilla, roasty.

Bottle shared with Dutchdrebus, Joes, judyvv and Ansjelaah @ weekly tasting. Opaque pitch black color, small to average sized light brown head. Aroma has malts, chocolate and -unfortunately- some "hopjesvla", which I really really dislike. Taste malts, chocolate, some bitter and again that hopjesvla. Yuk. Not my thing at all. Too bad.

Bottle @ joes thx to benzai. Very dark brown to black colour with a small beige head. Smells chocolate, sweet, vanilla, roasty. Very nice smell. Tastes nesquick, watery, chocolate. Thin body, nice carbo.
A pretty decent chocolate stout. Not crazy chocolate, just that added sweetness at the end of an already powerful beer.
Delicious chocolate aroma. Flavors of milk chocolate, sweet cream and cooked oats. Mild hints of coffee. I prefer darker, more bitter chocolates, but this was still pretty good.

Bottle. Pours black with a thick, creamy tan head. Chocolate, roasted malt and oat aroma. Rich chocolate, roasted malt, oat, slight hop and caramel flavors. Full creamy body and a sweet chocolate finish. N

Keg (ALEhouse, Riga)
Gorgeous chocolate aroma, sweet and just makes me melt. Black, keggy tan head. Harsher palate, watery, fizzy carbonation. Rich roast hinting towards bitterness. Not so full. A bit transient. But nice dry old hops in the finish, a bit dusty. Disappointing after yummy aroma, but still good.

big foamy beige head on a dark brown almost black beer.
aroma is sweet, very sweet chocolate, mocca, cacao.
taste is rich dark sweet and bittering chocolate, and cacao.
medium body medium carbonation

Tap. Almost pitch black color. Small brown head, stays. Looks delicious. Milk chocolate, sweet, mild roast in aroma. My nostrils want to explode. Dark chocolate, roast, minerals, limestone, watery flavor. Smells better than tastes. Nice dark chocolate bitterness in aftertaste. Would drink again.

Tasted from bottle. Great looking beer. Pours black with a thick rocky beige head. Aroma is big time chocolate with a little coffee. Taste is obviously chocolate and roasted malt. A little sweet bit definitely not overly sweet. Really well balanced with bitterness. Slight dry finish with full body. Excellent well balanced sweet stout.

nice chocolate,sweet aroma..great pour into a tulip..black with 3 finger tan head...sweet but not overly so cuz of the IBUs..very good sweet stout with decent ABV of 6.3

Bottle at home. Pours black with a tan head. The chocolate aroma is just great. Taste is chocolate, roasted malts, and coffee with a nice, long, bitter aftertaste. Should have been a bit more creamy to be really great, feels a bit too thin.

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pitch black body, large caramel-hued head. Nose is massive cocoa and milk chocolate tones, elegantly intertwined, with hints of roasted barley, cream and white sugar. Taste is roasted grains, milk chocolate, cocoa, cream, hints of coffee, mild caramel and straw in the back. Medium to full body, medium to high carbonation. A real full-on chocolate stout, well-brewed by Rogue.

Fra fad, Søernes Ølbar, sort med fint beige skumhovede. Kakaomælk. Vanillienoter. Mokka. Mild bitterhed. Forholdvis let krop. Tør mundfølelser af kakaopulver. Smagen minder om Kattetunger fra Anton Berg. God i små mængder, vulgær i længden.
Chocolate! Pitch black. Thin head. Taste of chocolate, malt, batteries. Bitter finish. Not as thick as hoped. Chocolate but not much else going on. So so.

Aroma - chocolate, Taste - chocolate :) Nice beer if you like chocolate :) After an IIPA it was to sweet for me, but there is some bitterness. Also a bit roasted malts that you can feel somewhere on the tongue. This beer stands up to his name :) My wife probably would love it!

22oz. Bomber. Well of course there are aromas of chocolate. Dark brown with a foamy light brown finger width head and nice lacing. Taste is exactly what you'd expect. Chocolate. Some nice bitterness also. Not too sweet. Nice roasted malt character also. My wife is a chocoholic and she loves it.

22 oz bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a clear dark brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have a nice sweet chocolate character, caramel, some light roast, powdery chocolate. Body is thin but the flavor is good. Had this many times, but hadnt rated.
Pours black with a thick, creamy tan head. Chocolate, roasted malt and oat aroma. Rich chocolate, roasted malt, oat, slight hop and caramel flavors. Full creamy body and a sweet chocolate finish.

From a bomber at the Gingerbread party 2013. Pours dark with a mocha head. Dark chocolate and coffee with a sweetness from the roasted oats and a slightly bitter finish. Like a chocolate covered espresso bean... Yum!

on tap @ALEhouse, Riga 
Pours black with tan brown thick, rocky cap, super thick lasing from the top of the glass. Aroma - sweet malty, dark caramel-syrup with chocolate and cocoa tones. Taste is similar but with 1:1 balanced hopping bitter in the finish, not too light not too aggressive hopping - just in time, average sweetness for dark beer. Medium body, compote texture, light dry finish, mild bitter aftertaste, average carbonation. Was surprised to see category here cause thought that this one is average+ hopped porter - too light in body to be stout and not so sweet to be sweet stout. Pleasant brew but questions about style remains.

I enjoyed this one out of a cask at Redlight Redlight. Pours an opaque black with a creamy brown head. The aroma is unmistakably chocolate. The taste followed suit with with dark chocolate and notes of sweet roasted malt. It reminded me of a chocolate milkshake. This one is definitely one of my favorite chocolate stouts.

Pours an opaque black with a frothy brown head and good lacing. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts and a mocha latte. Taste is roasted malts, dark chocolate, grassy hops and anise. Excellent balance between malts and hops a d the best chocolate stout Ive tasted to date.

Pours a very dark brown with little light coming through and a small light brown head with a bit of lace. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, sweet, and coffee. Flavour is chocolate, roasted malts, light bitterness(dark malt/cocoa like), and a grainy/chocolate like mouthfeel.

Pours black with a thick foamy cappuccino head. Nose is a bit bready at first and then rich chocolate comes through. It's rather like smelling a chocolate croissant. Taste is bitter with notes of dark chocolate and a touch of anise. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. Pretty good brew, but not among the best.

Okay, so Ive become partial to stouts, and especially chocolate stouts, and this is a great example. Enormous head that lasts and lasts. Aroma is fine chocolate and coffee. Bitter aftertaste but not in a bad way.

Bottled: Unk

A: Pours a nice dark brown ale with a single finger of fine latte head. This dissipates over several minutes to a thick sheet of the same. cobweb lacing. Excellent clarity when one can see light.

S: Milk chocolate, cocoa, dark malts. Sweet, raisins, some hints of prune. Slightest metallic scent. A little yeast on the finish.

T: Nose>taste. Dry, dirty, slightly bitter. Some coffee grounds. The milk chocolate is left behind and only the bittersweet bakers chocolate is left in the finish. For a stout the flavors dont add up to much IMO.

M: Medium to thin with moderate carbonation. Would like to see more creaminess in the body, a bit too dry on the palate. 

O: Everything seems to go great until the taste, then things dont go so well. I think the flavor is a bit one-dimensional and fails to highlight the chocolate as adverted. The body is thin and forgetful. Not a beer of fame for me.

Serving type: bottle

05-27-2011

Start is moderate roasted malts, quite watery texture and then comes all joy. Very mellow choco aroma in nose and in taste, surprisingly hoppy for sweet stout, but as it says - makes great balance. Very pleasant moderate sweet with bittersweet looong quite dry finish. Interesting combo of biterness from choco and bitterness from hops. Very nice brew with great finish and aftertaste
Near black with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and malt. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Mild bitter finish.
22 ounce bottle. Pours almost black with a nice tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and malt. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, and coffee. Finish is somewhat bitter. Very nice.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2014 Does it get any better than this??? My goodness. Bomber at The Ginger Man, Houston. This baby is full of chocolate and roasted aroma. Strong Chocolate and roasted malt taste, very sweet and mildly bitter. My favorite sweet stout, nay, my favorite stout out there. Perhaps my favorite beer, period. So good I bought another bomber at the Ginger Man! Bravo, Rogue.
Tap at Rogue, Portland. Colour is black with brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, sweetness and malts.
Soft, smooth and full bodied. Lots of chocolate and cocoa, fantastic. Good length too.....yum

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark black with a three inch plus dark tan head that lasts. Taste is of chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, fruit, vanilla and some hops. Similar aroma. Has a decent body with a slight bitter and dry finish. Easy to drink and quite enjoyable. Worth picking up again.

Drank at home Irvine, CA. Black pour with great brown head. Strong chocolate front with a bitter finish. Very dark chocolately.... Good brew.

Smells of chocolate...taste is too strong though...bitter too...too much of a beer unless youre freezing to death lol

On tap at Øltorget Mathallen, september 3rd 2013. Deep black body, creamy tanned head, looking seriously good! Aroma is roasty with lots of dark chocolate, tar, prunes. Questa chocolate stout è semplicemente perfetta. Cremosa e saporita. Una vera soddisfazione per il palato. Rogue si è veramente superato! Ottima!

@Party Source. Opaque dark brown with a fluffy tan head, thick curtain of lace. 22oz bottle pours a dark black color with a nice tan head. Aromas of bittersweet chocolate, light coffee. Full bodied, not to sweet, very good

Unlike most chocolate stouts, Rogue tastes like dark chocolate instead of light, milky-sweet chocolate. More like cocoa. Pours out a black, inky darkness. Superb lacing. Bitter cocoa permeates this ale. Beautiful thick brown head that builds as it settles, much like a Guiness. A bit if a bitter aftertaste, but I think that's what they're going for here.

Bottle. Pours black with creme colored head that lingers. Little visible carbonation with coffee aromas. Nice coffee and dark chocolate flavors over roasted malt. Not as sweet as other variations of this style.

From a 22 oz bottle shared at home. Pours black with a tan head. Chocolate nose. Flavors of chocolate malted milk shakes. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, smooth and slightly smoky finish.
Dark black. Creamy tan head. Sweet chocolate....lots of cocoa. Lasts on the palate. Burnt. Fricken awesome.

Bomber...pours murky black with finger of tan head. Head dissipates quickly...mild lacing. Smells of light malt with sweet chocolate. Tastes strongly of chocolate and coffee bittersweet with a dry finish.

Pours a thick black with a finger width of mocha colored head that dissipates. Strong front chocolate aroma, hint of coffee perhaps and malt. Flavor is coffee and chocolate with a bitter finish. Ah bobs average beer
Draft poured @BusboysandPoets in Hyattsville, MD. Solid, dark pour. Creamy, foamy, tan head. Great chocolate, coffee nose. Bitter on the palate. Taste did not live up to nose. Dry backend.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 Tasted from bomber bottle into a tulip pint glass. It poured an opaque dark reddish brown colour with deep fluffy tan head of spritzy little bubbles, long-lasting with lots of lace. Aromas of chocolate cake with chocolate frosting, toasted malts, cherry syrup. Flavours of a tart London Porter plus cocoa nibs, bright coffee-like acidity, balanced hoppy bitterness. Bomber. Pour us dark brownish black with a tan head that fades pretty quick but decent lacing. Smell is dark malt, chocolate syrup, a little coffee. Taste is a lot mellower than the aroma. Strong scent of chocolate. Opaque dark brown colour. Chocolate flavour with notes of burnt caramel and malt. Medium body with mild carbonation. Would definitely buy again.

Not much chocolate. Had aroma and taste of vanilla. Almost a fake vanilla taste. Thin mouthfeel. Disappointing.

Almost a non existent aroma, but a roasty chocolaty is barely noticeable. Full bodied middle flavor that is full of chocolate and a bit of roasted coffee. It has a medium finish that is not too bitter

Year old. Smooth dark chocolate aroma with roasty malts and some hoppyness. Thick creamy light brown head and very dark brown almost black body. Smooth chocolate and hoppy flavor with roasty malts. Smooth on the palate.

Pours black with a 3-finger tan head that dissipates fairly quickly that leaves lots of lacing. You can smell the 'imported chocolate' right off the bat with some malts & hops. La biere sent le chocolat mais tres peu. Elle est tres noire mais possede tres peu de viscosite pour un stout. Elle goute beaucoup plus le chocolat que son odeur le laisse croire. Une bonne biere mais elle ne merite pas 99...

Sample @ GABF 13. Pours a pitch black beer with a medium sized beige head on top. Aroma is faint chocolate, malts and coffee. Flavour is big on bitter dark chocolate with a slight touch of vanilla in the back. Caramel in the base. Long bitter, hoppy finish. Nice brew.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2015 On tap at BrewDog London. Great ballance between sweetness and bitterness. Strong concrete flavour. Just a hint of chocolate which does not dominate the flavour or aroma. Best sweet stout Ive had so far.

Tacky looking bottle - not that that matters.  Black with a big tan expanding head.  Smell - yeasty, some chocolate syrup.  Medium body.
