Bottle 50 cl. Black with a nice lighbrown head. Aroma of chocolate, dark fruits and vanilla. Nice medium bittersweet taste with a long chocolate and some sence of pepper-cake end. Nice

It pours opaque black with mahogany highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: dark chocolate, coffee, sweet grains, and milk chocolate. The taste is medium bitter; there are notes of: the aforementioned aroma notes, and a slight liquorice. The palate is medium bodied, slick, has medium carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, nothing all that special.

22floz/650ml bottle into a tulip glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Nice, rich, creamy milk chocolate. Quite pleasant!

Appearance: Opaque body with a thick and creamy, but dissipating, dark tan head.

Taste: Sweetish milk chocolate, rounded out by the roasty oatmeal and malt, and just a teeny bit of resin flavor from the cascade hops on the very end. The flavors all work together nicely.

Palate: Full body. Moderate - long malty finish.

Overall: Chocolatey, yes, but not a sweet stout. Its quite good, but be warned that if youre looking for a creamier, sweeter stout, its not this guy. This one is more roasty and has just a bit of sweetness. Quite nice!

Bottle (22 oz). From Chris, thanks! Black with a medium creamy beige head and good lacing. Aroma is mainly of chocolate along with roasted malt, light fruity notes and light hops. Taste is slightly sweet with chocolate, roasted malt, fruits notes, light caramel and citrus. Alcohol is completely hidden. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Silky mouthfeel. Pretty simple, yet really well-crafted Stout. No flaws, but nothing than stand out either.

Great stout, although I would call it more of a porter because the body isnt too thick- more of a mild/medium body but this is not a drawback. Chocolate aroma. Nice chocolate flavor that isnt too sweet and is held down by a slight bitterness and fizz on the tongue. Mild coffee flavor as is typical with these beers. Good overall.
Very nice. The chocolate never threatens to overpower, held in check by a slight sourness in the middle and a decent bitterness in the finish.

Chocolate!!!! É o que melhor descreve essa cerveja. Acompanha muito bem sobremesas, mas enjoativa se tomada em grandes quantidades.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cerveja muito boa. Sabor de chocolate bem marcante. Ótima para beber com sobremesa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650mL bottle. Pours black with a fine, thick, persistent tan head that coats, rather than laces, the inside of the glass. Aroma of hot chocolate, roasted malt, nuts and the vaguest hint of hops. The hops come through more in the flavour, with some acidic fruitiness behind the roast and chocolate. Reasonable bitterness and not too sweet.

Medium body, a little astringency (from the oats presumably), soft and creamy carbonation with a burnt bitter finish.
March 2010. 22 oz. bottle. Poures dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee and dark roasted malt. Slightly sweet, then finishes bitter. Excellent!
On draft at the brass tap, poured a black color with aromas of roast, coffee, and earth. Flavors follow suit, ok stout, thin on the palate for me.
Very dark pour with lots of chocolate coffee and caramel. Very nice beer. I'd like to try the imperial version. This was almost perfect.

650ml bottle. Pours black with a medium sized light brown head. Aroma is clearly chocolate-y. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, lots of chocolate and a hint of hops. Sweet and smooth with a bitter finish from the hops. Low carbonation and above medium body. Pretty good.

Split a 22oz bottle with a friend. This pours a dark brown color with a fluffy brown head. The aroma is mixture of cocoa and malts. I was expecting a heavy, dense, volume with this but instead its rather light and creamy. The most obvious taste being the unsweetened chocolate and malts. I was expecting a little something more and different from this one.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2016 Smells amazing, pours thick and dark with a thin head. It is so smooth and rich its almost a sin to drink. I absolutely love this stuff, go and buy it now.

Pitch black with a dark khaki colored head which has good retention and lacing. Nose consists of milk chocolate, roasted barley, malts, coffee and some mild hoppiness. Flavor is rich milk chocolate, cocoa, roasted barley, malts and a slight hoppy flavor. Body is moderately weighted and the carbonation is a notch above mild. Great tasting chocolate stout and a good way to introduce beer drinkers to a darker style of ale.
Dark brown, low carbonation. Sweet bitter imperial stout. Full body. Aroma of sweet chocolate and some notes of coffee.
Tap, pours a nice black, aroma is chocolate and taste all chocolate and a nice creamy refreshing chocolate, really nice beer.

Würzig malziger Antrunk, gleichermaßen röstig und schokoladig. Trocken malziger Mittelteil, geringe Herbe. Die Vanillenoten, die im Geruch deutlich hervorkommen sind geschmacklich nur mild vorhanden. Bitterer im Nachgeschmack, weiterhin konstant und beruhigend malzig. 12/9/9/10/9/9
22oz bottle, dark pour, aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Taste - dark chocolate, roasty (maybe oats), some coffee. Well balanced, complex brew. Slight bitter finish, Medium mouthfell. Good brew!!
Excellent brew! Hoppy, chocolate notes. Swirly head. Rich, frothy. Laces glass with a tan ring. Absolutely smooth and sweet wash down. Welcome addition for stout aficionados and lovers.

dark brown with about a finger of cream colored head that eventually dissipates. strong chocolate aroma. roasty malt flavor with strong chocolate. medium to low carbonation. mild bitter finish. very chocolaty but not overly sweet. very nice.

I poured a 22oz bottle into a tulip glass. It had no freshness date. It cost $7.49 ($0.34 per ounce).

Appearance: Deep shade of black out of the bottle. Pours to a large, brown, frothy head which retains and laces very well.

Smell: Dark chocolate candy, some roasted malt.

Taste: When a beer is named "Chocolate Stout," you go in with an expectation. And while Rogue Chocolate Stout is plenty chocolaty, its not all chocolate all the time. Its more of a strong stout that happens to have a bitter dark chocolate taste on the finish. Its also quite bitter with significant hop presence throughout. 

The thing about big stouts is that theyre pretty bitter from the roasted barley. Theres a taste akin to burnt toast right away here. Its dry and slightly astringent, but theres an underlying sweetness. It doesnt change much at the apex, though the second half of the swig is the best part as thats when all the chocolate is revealed. Its a bitter dark chocolate, and not particularly sweet or milky. A hint of vanilla can be detected, as well as some minor citrus flavors from the Cascade hops. At 69 IBUs, theres a reason the hops are prominent here. Theres a minor oatmeal sweetness on the aftertaste, though it fades quickly. A solid, well-balanced stout, though I cant help but want even more chocolate.

Drinkability: While Rogue Chocolate Stout is no session beer, its not imperial beast, either. Its a full-bodied beer for sure, though the mouthfeel seems a little thin for the style. Its comfortable, though, and its goes down smooth. A slightly dry residual aftertaste, but its tolerable. At 6% ABV its a relatively strong beer, though most drinkers should have no trouble handling all 22oz themselves.

On tap at Rogue Distillery & Public House in Portland. Very nice aroma of chocolate. But the taste, while good, tastes more of chocolate extract than chocolate itself. Theres also some unexpected cinnamon in there. Thick and smooth body.
Pours a black with a tan head. Tan lacing down the glass. Aroma of smokey chocolate. Slightly thin but a great easy drinker.

Draught @ Rogue Ales Public House, San Francisco, CA
Pours black with a light tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt and milk chocolate. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 On tap @ La Capsule Lille,FR - Color: very dark black beer with no carbonation and medium heavy brown head. Smell: coffee, chocolate, milk and malt. Taste: chocolate domination and coffee presence, small bitterness. Aftertaste: chocolate and coffee.
Svart öl med brunt, mörkt fast skum. Doft: Choklad pudding, vanilj, Baileys. Smak: Kakao, Baileys, kaffe, vanilj, rostad mandel.

Really, really love the aroma of this beer. Vanilla bean, sweet milk chocolate, roasted malts.

Appearance is lovely as well with a deep dark brown and chocolate colored head.

Taste was underwhelming in my opinion. Not bad though, dark chocolate bitterness, toasty malt with bittering hops. I prefer more velvety mouthfeel with less carbonation in my stout. Could sniff this thing for days though.
Aroma - chocolate, milk, oats, cocoa, vanilla. Taste - dark chocolate, roasty, some coffee. Slight bitterness. Medium mouthfell. Very good
Dense dark pour with a tan head. Great aroma of chocolate and bready malts. Flavor is initially sweet and heavy on the chocolate. Followed up with an unexpected hit of hops. Nice nice brew

Bottled 650ml. -from Za Popent Pivoteka, Ljubljana. Black coloured, medium sized brown head, cocoa and Tortica (Croatian chocolate/hazelnut wafer) in the nose. Light roasted malt, chocolate, and cocoa with strong bitterness. Long lasting bitter finish with some hoppy notes. Smooth and pleasant but to be honest this one is overrated.

Inky appearance with a creamy brown head; an almost smoky chocolate aroma; a mellow taste of cocoa that comes out after the brief fizz on the palate; would have preferred it silkier; overall, an enjoyable porter that will always be a good choice, but may not be the first choice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A beautiful brew. One of my first stouts since Ive had craftbrew obsession. A dark ebony appearance. Taste is dark roast malt with hints of chocolate and nuts and slight hop bitterness. A great brew I will enjoy again
Alltof stór flaska af þessum drukk fyrir einn mann en ég lét mig hafa það. Dásamlegur ilmur, nóg af súkkulaði þar. Ekki eins fyrirferðamikið í bragðinu fannst mér en hann er þéttur og góður.

(Bottle) Clear, nearly black, with dark tan head. Chocolatey aroma with hints of malt. Rich, smooth velvety medium body with excellent gentle but refreshing carbonation. The flavour is chocolatey, and whilst it is dominant it is neither losing nor overpowering. At the start it is complemented with some biscuity maltiness and maybe hints of vanilla. Towards the finish some contrasting burnt bitter and tangy notes appear providing balance, and a good finish. An excellent beer.

On tap at Brewers on the Bay. Pours black with a brown head. Moderate chocolate here on both the flavor and aroma. This seems more like a sweet stout than a chocolate specialty. Not bad, but could use more chocolate in this batch at least.

From a 650ml bottle on 21/7/2013 (shared by Butz with thanks). Pours close to black with a big tan head. Has a very pleasant, strong aroma featuring milk chocolate,a touch of coffee and some roastiness. The flavour is very chocolatey, including milk but particularly dark, with the bitter shading the sweet. Finishes with a lovely satisfying hoppy, roasty bitterness which lingers. Has a medium to full body and low to medium carbonation. Rogue, have been a bit hit and miss for me, but this is a winner. A lovely, rich, flavoursome stout.

Bottle. Very dark black/brown with lasting and lacing tan head. Aroma is massively chocolate with a slight coffee hint. Taste is complex.dark chocolate start with bitterness. Some burnt roasty notes finishing with smooth high cocoa chocolate bitterness that lasts and lasts. Very fine example of this style amazed to find this in Walgreens.
Bomber. Nice reddish tan head. Dark clear body. Awesome aroma. Much like southern tiers choklat but with a little less body and not quite as smooth.
Bomber. Near black with a dark, dense head. Tootsie rolls, sweet chocolate and malt.

Its dry and light...at first. This initial sensation cleanses the chocolate sweetness well, however it doesnt fully clean it up. Therefore, it strikes me as unfocused, as its caught between dessert beer or drinkable dry stout. Drinkable, though. O: This would make a rock-solid everyday stout if it were A) in 6 packs and B) less expensive. Its still a decent offering, and better than the double.
Cannot stop drinking this beer. Truly a favorite. Ridiculous chocolate nose and taste, but without a doubt a stout. Rogue at its best.

Pretty good looking, pretty blackish, except you can see a little light getting through on the pour, leaving a nice brown lasting head with some pretty good lacing.

Aroma is quite chocolatey. I get a lot of chocolate and not a whole lot else, except for maybe a touch of roasty notes and a tinge of coffee.

Flavors come out as more complex than the nose, with a good blend of bitter, chocolate (dark and milk), sweetness, coffee, burnt, roasty and toasty notes. Its quite tasty, with a good bit of complexity. The bitterness is pretty high, but it blends with the sweetness and cocoa/chocolate flavors well. 

Body is pretty thick and chewy, with a bit of an bitter, dark semi-sweet chocolate aftertaste. 

I really like these thick and rich stouts that arent jam packed full of alcohol. This is a good one, I would certainly have it again. I cant remember if I like it better than their regular oatmeal stout or not, as its been a while. I recall liking it tho, and I would guess this one is somewhat similar in overall nature.

dulces notas de chocolate y malta tostada con un ligero toque de cafe,al paladar lupulo balanceado con un buen after taste a chocolate lupulo y cafe,bastante persistente,es una gran cerveza me gusto mucho
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Nice jet black body, good mousse-like head. Great aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted barley, asphalt on a hot day. Flavour is mocha-like with a hoppy finish. Great layering, super tasty, but I wish the mouthfeel was just a little less watery. Thats about my only nitpick, but otherwise its an amazing brew.

Great beer. From 22oz bottle to shaker. Smells malty, slight chocolate but strong vanilla. Pours an almost black color, similar to Guinness with a thick tan head. Taste is sweet, bits of caramel malt with chocolate and a punch of vanilla.
0,65l bottle. Pours brown/black color, beige medium head. Smell of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Taste of chocolate, coffee, not that sweet as expected.

Jet black pour with a creamy tan head.  Lots and lots of milk chocolate and vanilla, roasted malt, biscuit, floral hoppy bitter finish.  Soft to medium carbonation and full bodied.  Very moreish and very delicious.

Faint nose of malt and chocolate.
Pitch black, fairly loose head, vanishing rather quickly.
Great malty chocolate taste, simple palate.
Not bad a brew.

In spite of the chocolate, I wouldnt style it as a sweet stout. Lovely aroma of cherry bonbons. Black as sin, the flavour is a perfect balance between sweet, and bitter, nice sour and definitely dry. Thats the only thing I can add, really, to over two thousand ratings. Its a dry stout, and a pretty damn perfect one.

Portion of a 22 oz bottle into a regular glass.

A: Pours a dark burgundy color with good opacity. The head is a two finger mocha shade. Good lacing is left down the glass.

S: Theres a decent chocolate character backed by some roasted malts and citrusy hops. The chocolate is sweet, though a touch off putting. Far from bad, though.

T: Chocolate gives way to a roasted barley finish, laced with some bitter hops. It strikes a better balance than the double version. All in all, the flavor profile is simple, but not cloying.

M: Its dry and light...at first. This initial sensation cleanses the chocolate sweetness well, however it doesnt fully clean it up. Therefore, it strikes me as unfocused, as its caught between dessert beer or drinkable dry stout. Drinkable, though.

O: This would make a rock-solid everyday stout if it were A) in 6 packs and B) less expensive. Its still a decent offering, and better than the double.
Deep brown color with tan brown lacing. Cocoa aroma. Nice and rich, dessert please. Depending on setting, give me this beer year round.

A - Black color with ruby highlights. 2 fingers of billowy mocha head that makes craters as it slowly sinks. Awesome looking beer.

S - Dense chocolate jumps right out, rich malt, dairy sweetness

T - Dark cocoa up front almost has a grassy bitterness to it. Roasted malts kick in an become more pronounced as it warms. The bitterness rides through and builds at the finish.

M - Full bodied, mild to medium carbonation makes it silky and coats the palate evenly.

Well done stout here. The nose boasts sweet dairy chocolate while the flavor gives you more of a dry roasted cocoa flavor. Excellent carbonation and feel.

Serving type: bottle

11-20-2011
Deuce.  Pours a dark near black with tan head.  Smells chocolatey and sweet.  Taste of bitter dark chocolate and roasted malt with a bitter hops presence in the aftertaste.  Good stuff.
Had this on draft at bait shop in Des Moines. Crazy mocha and cocoa flavor. Like a pile of white chocolate. The most chocolaty beer I've ever had

650ml bottle. Pours an opaque black, with a medium tan head, which lasts reasonably well but does not leave much lacing. Bitter roasted malt and bittersweet cocoa notes mix with sweeter milk chocolate and very light citrus hops in the aroma. Mild herbal and lemon hops up front lead into a bitter cocoa kick, which smoothes out into full-bodied milk chocolate. Roasty malt notes come into the mid-palate, with cocoa and lemon hops in the finish. There is dry, bitter cocoa aftertaste. This is much more bitter than other chocolate stouts I have tried, which have tended towards the smooth and sweet end of the spectrum. Its an interesting contrast to those, and a novel take on the style, not to mention a very fine beer.
Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma is chocolate, chocolate, chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate up front, heavy malts in the mid palate and a little old leather for the finish. Awesome.

Bottle. Pitch black, tan head, great lacing like a root beer float. Roasty nose, not really coffee but there is something like orange chocolate. Might be a turn off if you are a stout traditionalist. Flavor is milk chocolate and bitter roast, touch of vanilla. Great value.

Pours black with medium brown head and leaves a couple of lines of lacing.  The aroma is very nice chocolate.  The taste is chocolate with a slight bitterness that balances the sweet chocolate nicely.  It got a full body and creamy texture.
Very dark stout beer, with a bit ofchocolate that perfectly balances The bitterness

Had on tap at the hay merchant. One of my favorites. Actually it was the double chocolate stout. Very rich chocolately flavor with a hint of espresso. It even smells like chocolate. Very similar to drinking a cold (hot) chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A chocolate stout that delivers. Dark chocolate aroma backed up by smooth make backbone. Chocolate still present in the flavor compliments the nutty malt well with a balanced bitterness. Would have had more but there were other taps on offer.

Keg @ Our Black Heart 2014/4/9 Really really good Chocolate Stout. Chocolate here there everywhere but also well balanced, good ABV and a great body for the style. So many of the same style are too strong, viscous & sweet but this is spot on.

65 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20110101.
Pours pitch black color with a small beige head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, caramel malts, some toasty notes, cocoa, mild coffee and dark fruits. Flavor of milky chocolate, dark malts, cocoa and caramel. Velvety palate. Excellent
Split a bottle after eating some fondue with chocolate - which is the perfect pairing since this is very close to liquid fermented chocolate.

22oz bomber. Pours a dark brown/black color with a 1/2 inch of tan head. Aroma is of strong chocolate with a bit of roasted malts. Taste is also very chocolatey, some malts, a touch of hop bitterness.

bomber - pours very dark brown with thick brown head and thin lacing.  Nose is milk chocolate.  Flavor adds roast, bitter chocolate, and oats.  Not as sweet as the style name would suggest, but still sweet for a stout.  Not as bitter a Rogue beer would suggest.  Lightly smoky finish with hoppy bitterness.  Metallic aftertaste. I expected something better.

Bouteille 22oz. De couleur noire et opaque. Nez intense de chocolat noir,  de malt rôti, léger de café doux et de houblon herbeux aux petites notes citriques ainsi quavec des traces de vanille. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement crémeuse. Faibles notes fruitées (fruits confits) avec des traces de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche rapidement suivi dun goût de chocolat noir amer, de malt rôti avec des traces de mélasse sucrée. Parallèlement, lon retrouve une légère-moyenne amertume de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques et florales à laquelle sajoute progressivement un léger goût de café noir jusquen finale. Post-goût long, moyennement amer de rôti, de houblon herbeux, de chocolat noir avec des notes de café.
Dark chocolate cherry aroma and malt, slightest hint of bitterness without being overpowering
Smells delicious, but the taste doesnt match up. I rarely say this about a stout, but I wanted a little more sweetness to fill in the chocolate flavors.

Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma of oats, and semi sweet chocolate brownie.  The taste is dark malt, oats, chalky chocolate flavor.  The mouth feel is light.  This is good, but I prefer Southern Tier Chokolat
Helt oerhört med choklad. Har aldrig varit med om liknande. Som flytande choklad.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 2013/03/01 - Pours an opaque black color with a foamy beige head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, coffee, toffee and milk chocolate. Medium mouthfeel, perfect carbonation and a bitter coffee aftertaste. Chocolate is evident, but not overpowering. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of the most beautiful pours Ive ever seen. Smells great also. Not as full-bodied as Id like.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Poured from bomber bottle, with thick chocolately foam. 50/50. Sweet chocolate notes with a subtle aroma. This beer hits all the right notes.

Une mousse épaisse et brune. 
Un arôme de chocolat (orangette même), une amertume qui reste en bouche un moment. Une très bonne stout qui accompagnera bien viande rouge ou dessert. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Black with a small light brown head. Aroma is chocolate. Like the instant cocoa powder you mix with milk. Also a bit of roasted malt and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet and light roasted bitter. Medium body, average carbonation, watery/oily texture. Vanilla and chocolate in the finish. A light version of Soft Dookie? Or the other way around. Nice if you like vanilla and chocolate.

Pours coffee black with a nice tan head. Aromas of chocolate, and more chocolate. Flavor is milk chocolate, roasted malts and some chocolate covered coffee beans to round out the bitterness. Did I mention there is chocolate in this? Not bad overall, actually rather enjoyable but also seems like it could get tiresome. Good one and doner, but odd label...
This beer had a number of complex and unique flavors.  A sweet chocolatey start with a slightly unpleasant hoppy finish.  As a side note, a strange picture to use for the label.

Good stout, but wouldnt drink more than one at a sitting.  Very chocolaty and sweet.  Nice when youre in the mood.  Good pallet and aroma.  Very nice finish... Not a sticky sweet mouthful.  Good beer, but I need to be in the right mood for it.  If youre in the mood for a caffe mocha or a hot chocolate, but would prefer some ABV, this is the right choice.  If you like Youngs Double Chocolate Stout, give this a try.  I think youll prefer this.
65cl bottle. Really intense chocolate aromas. Pours very dark, creamy, with nice tan head, persistent, some lacing. Taste is oily, kind of sweet. Enjoyable.

Draft at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured completely  black with a thin tan head. The aroma is hugely malty, leading to a rich, malty, medium to weak bitter flavour. The chocolate is there on the palate and in the aftertaste. Its rich but not overpowering. A really superb Chocolate stout which even outrates Youngs Excellent chocolate stout. Needs to be served "warm". Around 10 degrees C Id say. Any cooler and you will lose the flavour.

Bottle - Pours dark brown with a light tan head. Nose is milky chocolate with some light roast. Taste is the same--tons of sweet chocolate, a bit of roast, and a lightly bitter milk chocolate/coffee finish. Nothing rough or hard to drink with this beer, though its more watery in the mouth than Id normally like. Tasty stuff.

Black, black, black with a muddy brown head. Looks delicious. Aroma is sweet chocolate with a slight mocha-ness in there somewhere. Taste is bitterness and smooth milk chocolate all wrapped up together. The bitterness lingers, but not ridiculously. Very easy stout to drink. Overall, a good one, but not a classic.

Bottle from South Lyndale Liquors (Minneapolis, Minnesota, 27/11/12)
Aroma: Chocolate is very dominant here.
Appearance: Dark brown, almost black, with a thick brown head.
Taste: Medium sweetness, and a very slight hint of bitterness in the finish.
Palate: Full bodied, creamy, and a soft carbonation.
Im normally pretty underwhelmed by Rogue, but this was wonderful. One of my favorite dessert stouts.

Black. Thick, rocky tan head. Tan lacing.Aroma of dark milk chocolate. Flavor is upfront chocolate, then surprisingly bold hops. Finish is hop bitterness with slight milk chocolate to smooth it out. Full creamy body.
chocolate, hoppy aroma.  Dark dark brown color with large, long lasting head.  Rich dark chocolate taste, slightly hoppy aftertaste.
UPDATED: JAN 16, 2013 Nice dark chocolate flavor. Not much aroma.  Slightly acidic taste to it.  Not a bad value overall.

Pours a thick opaque brown with nice fluffy tan head, good lacing.  Cocoa and roasted malt aroma.  Dark chocolate and roasted coffee flavor with a bitterness that comes midway through that's not completely pleasant.  Full mouthfeel with moderate bitter aftertaste.  Initial chocolate is nice but bitterness is not.  Had camping at Wallace State Park with Chris. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cocoa hoppy taste. !!!!!!!! via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing chocolate stout, so good, rivals Southern Tier chocolate, buy this asap! Pleaseeee

Has some nice coffee bitter scents with chocolate. Taste is a nice baking/dark chocolate, finishes well with the chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Black pour with creamy beige head.  Full aroma, oat and chocolate.  Flavour is roast malt, chocolate and chocolate.  Balanced finish
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
22oz botle shared by Shaun,cheers!
Poured a dark brown colour with large but fast fading dark head.Light chocolate and coffee aromas.Tasted of chocolate and coffee but on the bitter side rather than sweet.Decent tasting stout.

Poured from bottle into pint glass. An almost opaque body with about 1.5 fingers of beautiful brown foam.  In a couple minutes the head receded into lacing.  It smells mostly of baking chocolate with a touch of malty sweetness.  The taste opens just as it smells with a long finish of bitter chocolate, roasted malts, and some bitter hops.  Its medium-bodied with nice soft carbonation and a slightly oily texture.

As long as you are ok with it being more bitter than sweet, this is a wonderful chocolate experience.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Pours dark , brown fast fading head .. Little chocolat smell
Taste is too much carbo for the style . Little bitter/sour , choclat is only very little there... Not like i thought it would be

Rerate @ Gents bierfestival Nr 5 
Smell is pure chocolate , very nice mouthfeel and intense chocolate taste . Way better ( palate has changed ? other batch ? fresher / older ? )

Bottle, from my Secret Santa, many thanks. Almost black colored beer with medium beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, raisins. Taste, chocolate, oatmeal, chocolate cream, vanilla, hints of coffee, wood. Coffee bitter finish with milk chocolate. Very tasty beer.
Poured from a 22oz bottle with a nice thick head and malty aroma with the appearance if black coffee. Taste was malt, slight hints of chocolate, and oats. Enjoyable and easy to drink.

From notes, 22oz Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown color with a nice foamy head. Aroma is chocolate, toasted malts and slight aromatic bitters. Flavour of sweet malts, bitter chocolate, some coffee and nicely balanced hop bitters.
Opaque black with creamy tan head. aromas of citrus, roast, toffee malts. Creamy coffee and mocha notes. Med body. Acrid coffee sweet roasted malt finish. Tasty

It pours out a thick black with a one inch foamy tan head. The smell has milk chocolate up front with some nice vanilla entering in sweetly. Light malted roastiness comes through slowly as it warms. The taste is bitter and sweet in different aspects. The mouthfeel is mostly thick. It has about a medium sort of feel. It is fairly drinkable. Overall, this is pretty good. I like it and would come back again.

Poured from the bomber into an English pint glass.  Black with a mocha colored head.  Aroma is milk chocolate.  Flavor is milk chocolate with some roasted malt and some grassy hops towards the finish.  Palate is smooth from the oats with a lingering bitterness from the roasted malts and hops.  Overall this is exactly what you want a chocolate stout to be!
Packed with chocolate but not overly sweet thanks to the roasted malts. Velvety and with a lingering delectable chocolate palate

(Alla spina) Aroma dolce  quasi di pocket coffee spettacolare. Nera impenetrabile con un bellissimo cappello di schiuma densa e fitta. Al palato riemergono di nuovo le note di cioccolato al caffè con un corpo denso e magnifico. Dolce viene riequilibrata da una piacevole luppolatura finale. Magnifica! una splendida bevuta.

660 ml bottle. Pours an opaque black with a nice, resilient beige head. Smell is chocolate. Taste is cocoa, chocolate, oats. Nice black chocolate, cocoa bitterness. Medium bodied, soft-to-maybe watery mouthfeel. A solid chocolate stout!
Bomber bottle poured black w/ creamy tan head. Moderate aroma of chocolate malt. Not sweet w/ a bitter roast finish. Tastes are dark chocolate and smokey roasted malts. Medium bodied.

22oz Bottle. The pour was a very dark muddy brown almost black with an average (1-2 finger) medium brown rocky head that receded steadily, down to a thin film with a large collar and had fair spotty lacing.

The aroma was loaded with chocolate right up front along with some burnt malts, a light resin hop and a doughy yeast and had notes of coffee, dark chocolate and a mild nutty presence.

Taste was bitter sweet and malty with a note of dark chocolate in the beginning, and then became moderately bitter with a bold dose of coffee and yes more bitter chocolate towards the finish. The flavor hung around for quite a long time after the swallow, with a very bitter mocha coffee taste left lying on the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was full in body with a dry, oily texture and a nice soft carbonation.

Overall and simply put, this brew is a Chocoholics dream and I am hooked...
Pours dark black with a dark brown head. Strong nose of chocolate. Overwhelming chocolate aroma with hints of roasted coffee. Liquid chocolate... Nice smooth body. This is delicious.
Bomber into glass.. pours dark black dark brown head...arona and taste are the same milk chocolate snd coffe ..hints of raisen..goid shiz

650 mL bottle to flute
Chocolate, nutmeg, toasted malts, grain. Colour is deep opaque brown with a long lasting, thin and creamy tan head. Light sourness and bitter to the end. Full bodied, creamy and astringent.

A milk chocolate aroma right up front with a creamy head that is reasonably rich and had good lacing.  Oats and toasted malts break through the odor towards the end.

Oats is a major contributor of the taste and this beer has a bit of sourness to it with bitterness arriving at the end of the palate.  Dark chocolate aftertaste reminding me of the aftertaste after having good dark chocolate. 

Great overall taste profile with good balance and decent complexity. I would drink this again! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rogue Chocolate Stout

Quick review.

Amazing milk chocolate aroma! The taste is uncomplicated and straightforward with dark chocolate and a bit of sweet milk chocolate. Mouthfeel is smooth with moderate carbonation. If I'm in the mood for a chocolate stout, this is readily available and cheap. Good go-to beer.

-
Earthy and chocolatey. Fantastic chocolate stout.like better than the more expensive double chocolate,  not as overbearingly chocolatey.
Opaque dark pour with tan head.  Strong roasted aroma with nice bitter dark chocolate almost tobacco smoky palate and aftertaste.

Bottled. Pours a deep brown almost black. finger of creamy head. Nose is an earthy semisweet chocolate weith a hint of bannana. Initial taste is filled with cocoa. The end is more bitter with an earthy tobbacoey taste. Overall a nice brew.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff nov-12: Lukter og smaker sjokolade, stor smaksrikdom, men ikke så søt som Southern Tier sin Creme Brulee. Mer mørk sjokolade og kakao. Greit i små glass, definitivt en dessertøl eller som avec til kaffen. Fra fat (!) på Mi2, Cardinal skuddårsaften: intens sjokoladearoma uten at det blir for mye av det gode. Sjokolade og mørke bær i den supersmude smaken. Sigmund sukker henført. Opp til 3.5 fra opprinnelig 3 blank.

black color, aroma of cocoa powder, grain, flavors of bitter cocoa powder, pine hops, slight coffee on the finish, med body, slightly watery, expecting a little more body and balance out of this one, good brew but slightly disappointing

Definately one of the best smelling beers I ever tried. Almost pure milk chocolate and a subtle hint of dark chocolate along with it. The beer tasted just like smelled. It had a nice bitter finish to balance out the sweetness at the end. Honestly thought that it was just a little to carbonated. But overall excellent beer. Just wish it was cheaper.

Chocolate through and through. Pours a dark dark brown, bordering on black. Dark chocolate aroma, coco. Medium night thick foamy head color of creamed coffee, sticks to the glass as it goes down but thins out considerably. Slight bitter finish complements the chocolate flavor nicely.

Excellent if your in the mood for a chocolate stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Really nice dark chocolate flavor. Seemed overpowering at first; but once the beer warmed up a little, the malt flavors came through, and brought more balance.

Draft at the Khyber. Very dark brown pour with an off-white foamy head that left some runny lace. Bittersweet chocolate. Burnt leather. Coffee grounds. Hazelnuts. Little smoke. Slight hint of candied sugar towards the finish, but the finish itself it dry. Reads just a little thin, but otherwise well done.

Hints of coffee but mostly chocolate. Medium to heavy body. Nice malt flavor with a delicious chocolate finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured a rich dark color with a nice head. Very well balanced stout that has a light but not overwhelming chocolate finish. Very good beer.

Pours pitch black with cocoa head. Great nose...every kind of chocolate imaginable comes up in the aroma along with some nice vanilla. Too bad the flavour isnt quite as good....campfire and smokiness dominate along with some bitter chocolate and burnt malt flavours. Pretty good overall.

Pours black with light brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate and roasted malt. Flavour of roasted malt, milk chocolate and aromatic hops. Looks like this is a bit overrated. Just like milk chocolate is.

Pours an opaque brownish-black from the bottle with thin tan head and moderate lacing. Aroma of sweet and bitter chocolates, vanilla, roasted malts, and slight coffee. Taste is basically just the chocolate, but not immensly sweet or anything. Good stuff.

Now we are ticking beers! Buying up the grocery store so I dont run out of things to rate. I am a bum. Nose of bakers chocolate and roasted malts. Pours dark brown, thin tan head. Flavors of roasted malts, a little earthy, bakers chocolate sweetness, and a touch more roast in the finish.

Pours deep brown with an avarage, tan head, leaving an excellent lacing. Nose of vanilla, chocklate and dark fruit notes. Sweet flavor of primary chocolate and molasses.Full bodied, oily texture and flat to soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours dark brown to black with a dense chocolate brown head. Aroma is dense chocolate with a strange yet nice fruity note - towards berries. I pick up the same distinct berry note in the flavor too. Nicely roasted malt, bitter hops flavor and smooth yet slight dusty chocolate powdery flavor. Solid bitter and roasted finish. Strange with this distinct berry flavor, yet it is very pleasing.
Serious Belgian choc, more than Ive had in choc stout before, all.... hmmm.... 2 of them.
Jet black in the glass. Dark chocolate, edge of coffee and some roasted malt on the nose. More chocolate in the middle and finish, some hop bitterness. Flat carbonation, slick body. Very nice.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an avarage, tan head, leaving an excellent lacing. Nose of vanilla, chocklate and dark fruit notes. Sweet flavor of primary chocolate and molasses.Full bodied, oily texture and flat to soft carbonation. More dry finish and slightly bitter.
Sample @ SBWF 12. Black colour with a brown head. Chocolate and vanilla aroma. Flavour is chocolate with some bitterness and some more chocolate.

Bomber into SA glass.  Deep brown, substantial tan head.  Chocolate over coffee aroma.  Feels lighter than expected based on appearance.  Watery espresso taste, with a pleasant bitter aftertaste.  Taste falls a bit short of aroma expectations, and a little too much carbonation.  Good not great.

650ml bottle. Deep dark brown colour with average, firm, frothy to creamy, lasting, minimally lacing, tan head. Moderately sweet chocolately aroma, toast, hay, bread. Taste is moderately sweet chocolately, slightly grainy and husky; leaves a slightly artificial impression. Concerning taste not far from Strubbes Chocolat (as far as I remember).
On tap at Beer Temple. Pours dark deep brown with a moderate tan head. Aroma of chocolate malt. Medium mouthfeel, flavour is of slightly watery milk chocolate with a slight roasted malt aftertaste.

Draft at Beer Temple. Pours black with a beige head.  Aroma is simply massive, mind blowing chocolate, just awesome!  Unfortunately the flavour doesnt live up to the aroma, its a lovely chocolate sweetness but a little toned down with a watery mouthfeel.  It is good, but I expected more.

On Tap at Blake Street Vault. Pour is deep brown with a long-lasting khaki head and great lacing. Sweet chocolate, Hershey syrup, lacto, light roast, and coffee in the aroma. Taste is much more roasty, dark chocolate, a hit watered down, caramel, coffee, and anise with a lightly roasted bitter finish. Medium body with soft carbonation. Not bad.
Bottled. Poured very black in color with tan head. Cocoa, roasted malt and dark chocolate in aroma. Some coffee and bittersweet chocolate in flavour.

I thought It will be my favorite one from Rogue but not... I was a bit disappointed even if it is always a very nice chocolate stout. Brown dark color with a beautiful brown head which doesnt last long (too bad), aromas of chocolate, hops, coffee. Taste very good with flavors of chocolate (truffles), coffee, toasted bread!

Cocoa, bakers chocolate smell with some hops. Tastes like it smells. With a nice chocolate aftertaste and bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong chocolate aroma and taste with a near perfect black pour and satisfying mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; poured dark brown with a thin beige head, tastes of roasted sweet malts, with plain chocolate taste and a slight coffee taste. Low carbonation quite a thin mouthfeel I like stouts with a heavier mouthfeel but this is still quality.
Dark brown pour with fluffy tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate and cocoa. Taste of roasted malt, cocoa, unsweetened chocolate and a hop bitterness on the finish. Medium carbonation and medium bodied.
This stout isnt as heavy as normal shouts are which makes it easier to enjoy the chocolate favors. One of my favorite chocolate shouts to drink.
Poured from bottle very dark with tan head. Big aroma of chocolate and little hint of vanilla. Taste of cocoa. If you like chocolate this is a must.

650 ml bottle from Harvest Wines (Halifax).  Pours a very dark brown with fairly large, creamy dark tan head.  Aroma is roasty cocoa, vanilla and a little woodiness.  Flavour is modestly roasty chocolate, sweet vanilla and wood.  Light roasty bitterness in finish.  Qutie nice.

Numerous bottles.  Dark brown with a mocha like head.  Nose is cadbury milk chocolate,  hazelnuts, light vanilla, and roast.  Flavor is similar.  A little on the sweet side and a bit too much for me at times.  A well made beer, but not really my thing these days.

This is one of the best Chocolate Stouts I have ever had.  Wonderful chocolate, creamy head, and excellent aftertaste.  A pleasure all the way around.  I will try more of the Rogue selection after this.

On tap at Rogue.  Dark black with big chocolate nose.  Tastes bitter like dark chocolate.  Simple, ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 13C. Black with a large tan head that collapses to an inch. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, light roasted malt, hints of cardamon and cloves. Silky mouthfeel. Plenty of good chocolate and vanilla but not that sweet, roasted barley rather than malt (but not that much) balancing bitterness with a touch of orange and spices that match well. Bitterness and a slight astringency at the end. Good chocolate, texture and balance - thats about it, but thats fine.

Pours extremely dark with a beige head. It has a large arome of chocolate with a little vanilla. Taste has more cocoa and raisins. There is also a unique aftertaste almost like a cough syrup or clove. Good finish.

Drinking in dark while watching video on laptop, e.g. I have no idea about color but could be black. Head is light color, but short. Smell is very chocolate. Taste is sweet and has lots of cocoa. Quite nice. Thanks to Paul D. for bringing this all the way US for me as farewell present.

Draft at bull run tap house. Pours black with an inch of khaki foam that leaves a lot of lacing. Some roasted chocolate notes on the nose. Bitter dark chocolate on the tongue. Fairly thick mouthfeel. The bittering hops cut through most of the lactose. Im surprised Stone didnt make this.

The smell on this is super chocolatey, like chocolate milk. Pours extremely dark and thick with a moderate tan head. Just a tad more bitter than I expected or would have preferred, but sits well on the palate and goes down easily.
Rich dark chocolate, some bitterness. Chewy and thick with enough carbonation to cut this down to a manageable level. Really nice
Pours totally black with a brown head. Aroma is chocolate with some vanilla and hints of roasted malt. Taste is also chocolate with some roastiness and moderate bitterness in the finish. Pretty good.
Dark black, tan head. Chocolate, chocolate, chocolate! Standard Rogue hops all over this. Really smooth, no bitterness. Really nice.

Obsidian pour with a thin brown head. Aroma is coffee laced with chocolate, nose is strong malt and coffee which gives way to a dark chocolate taste. Just enough hops to make the finish reminiscent of bittersweet dark chocolate. Excellent beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: The appearance is outstanding. The beer appears opaque and jet black, with a towering, thick beige head over an inch thick. After several minutes, the head slowly begins to dissipate, leaving ample lacing all over the tulip glass.

S: The aroma is fabulous, with dominant scents of chocolates and chocolate syrup, followed by a roasted malt character.

T: The taste does not disappoint. Chocolate syrup and melted chocolates consume the palate without ever being overly sweet. Roast and coffee flavors come in behind, creating a wonderful and delicate dance.

M: The feel is great. Smooth and creamy, with just the right carbonation level.

D: I honestly didnt think I could drink so much of this beer and still want more. I drank most of the bomber by myself, and was a bit bummed when it ran out. A superb marriage of chocolate and beer - highly recommended.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-15-2011

Bottle poured a deep black with a medium tan head and excellent lacing.  Aroma of bakers chocolate, roasted malt, cocoa, and a hint of smoke.  Taste begins with subtle milk chocolate notes followed by palatable bitterness of dark chocolate and espresso.  Decent mouthfeel and a relatively smooth finish with a hint of alcohol.  Style name is somewhat deceiving as not very sweet and more of a toned down imperial stout.  That being said, I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Bomber to oversized snifter. Looks good; pitch black with nice carbonation and dark beige head that quickly dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; chocolate and malt. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Good.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown color with medium foamy head and lacing. Pretty lasting. Aromas of chocolate, oat, chocolate and crystal malts, and some coffee bean. Taste is very similiar to aromas with mocha chocolate, roasty malts, pine and cereal dominating. Light to medium bodied for a sweet stout.
Deep, bitter chocolate stout flavor. Smells like valentines day. Dark pour, thick root beer float style head. Very choclatey. Bitter aftertaste lingers a bit

Bottle: black with large brown head. Aroma is bittersweet chocolate milk and caramel. Flavor is much the same with bittersweet chocolate, caramel, a little coffee and some roasted grains in the background. Palate is lightly sweet with a constant grain bitterness, more than the aroma lets on, and not a huge mouthfeel but not thin either. Good flavors and goes down well with the aged funky goat cheese I just had.

Bottle. Dark brown with chocolate dominating although some bitterness does creep in. Some coffee is also present. Perhaps an acquired taste
but eventually I concluded that this is a really nice beer.

Draft @luppolo12
Very good dark chocolate aroma & coffee, but too light body for my palate. It would be better with highter alcool and a bit more body.. Too smooth

Sweet stout finemente aromatizzata con bacche di cacao.
Profumi intensi di malto tostato, vaniglia e cioccolato.
Il torrefatto prevale, ma il retrogusto lascia spazio ad aromi amaricanti di cacao.
140712. Tap on rogue distillery. Pours black with a small head. Aroma chocolate, burnt malts. Strong chocolate taste. Smooth finish. Bot Bad.
Deep mocha pour with a medium frothy head. Aroma surprisingly with a little hoppy scent. Low carbonation with a semi sweet bitter chocolate taste. Finshy is creamy and delightful.
Smooth and creamy throughout. Dense cocoa malt taste. Chocolate is bittersweet. Would be great with a piece of cake.

22 ounce bottle into Rogue pint glass, no bottle dating.  Pours fairly pitch black color with a nice 1-2 finger dense mocha colored head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Some nice soapy lacing clings to the glass.  Aromas of big chocolate, toffee, caramel, molasses, roasted malt, vanilla, cream, and light herbal hops.  Very nice and well balanced aromas with good strength; very dessert-like.  Taste of chocolate, roasted malt, toast, oats, caramel, toffee, cream, light coffee, earth, and herbal hops.  Fair amount of herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, caramel, toffee, toast, and herbal spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Nice balance of sweetness and bitterness; with a good amount of chocolate flavor and roast.  Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a fairly creamy, silky, and lightly prickly mouthfeel.  Alcohol is well hidden with pretty much no warming noticed on the finish.  Overall this is a very nice chocolate stout.  Good roasted and chocolate flavors, with good balance of sweetness; and very smooth to drink.

Pours dark with thick tan lasting head with lots of lace. Aroma chocolate, malt, and more chocolate. Taste chocolate, oats, coffee. slightly bitter creamy smooth and dry. long dry dark chocolate finish.
Chocolate, coffee and malt. Hops and a balance smooth finish..... Eating It with cake:)
Thick tan head, thick sticky palate, surprisingly bitter finish, just all sticky & sweet & awesome

Deep and rich. Thick chocolate. Smokey oats - oatmeal. A meal. Delicious.                          

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

black colour with a lively head that leaves some lace. Chocolate aroma, with bean or nut and espresso note. Sweet chocolate and bean like bitterness is met with a nice hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied brew but is quite enjoyable.
Pours dark brown/black with a small tan head.  Smells of chocolate, nuts.  Taste is sweet and bitter, strong presence of dark chocolate or cocoa, smooth and velvety.

650ml bottle. Pours opaque near black with lots of toffee coloured head that leaves a huge amount of lace. Chocolate dominates the nose but not as heavily as I expected. Theres a lot of coffee and espresso right behind it with a slight licorice edge and hint of fresh hops. Chocolate is a little heavier on the palate with a good amount of coffee and bitter espresso in the finish. Better than I remember but the body is a little light.

From the bottle poured a black hole dark brew with a very dark, thick brown head. Rich aromas of chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Wonderful flavors of chocolate, lightly roasted malt, with hints of coffee and a nice litte hop finish. Medium bodied. Lordy have mercy and give me another.

Pours a deep black with a light brown head and lacing. It has an aroma of milk chocolate, some truffles, and a bit of roasted barley. The flavor is sweet chocolate with a bit of bitterness on the back end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep drown with a small ring of brown head that leaves no lace. The nose and taste are very milk chocolate forward. The finish is a bit of dark chocolate. It's above solid for what it is- a dessert beer meant to be share with a few people. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Black, black, black with medium sized thick tan head. Aroma is chocolate. Lots of it, and cocoa, coffee, a hint of roasted barley. Taste is similarly rich in chooclate and cocoa, with low bitterness thats more chocolate than hops, and quite a bit of roasted malt. Body is surprisingly full for the ABV, and the finish is long with - you guessed it - chocolate.

Bomber purchased at Total Wine in Kennesaw, GA--> standard pint.  Pours very thick, pitch black with a foamy tan head that slowly disipates, but never disappears.  You get a nose full of chocolate and something similar to coconut.  Taste is very dark chocolate and a nice bitterness on the backside.  The most impressive thing about this beer is its nice thickness- exactly what I want from a chocolate stout.  I swore off Rogue beers about ten years ago and I am completely satisfied that I decided to give thos one a try.

Bottle. It pours very dark brown with a decent bubbly dark tan head. The aroma is nicely balanced with big notes of sweet chocolate and some lightly herbal, piney hops. The flavor is the same with more dirty roasted malt and strong earthy bitter almost woody hop presence. The chocolate comes through more in the aroma, but it does have big notes of bitter dark chocolate in the flavor. Not sweet at all, with a moderate body and good carbonation.

Pours very dark. Described as "ebony" on the label which hits the nail on the head I think.  Theres a small mocha head that stays right till the end. Chocolate, coffee and roasted malt on the nose. Taste is very smooth. Not a huge amount of chocolate but certainly noticeable, bit like a mocha. Theres also a notable creaminess from the oats.

Botella de 650ml. vaso de ½ Pinta. Resaboreada en may´12. Color marrón muy oscuro. Capa beige, persistente y cremosa de burbuja pequeña. Matices de chocolate, toque frutal y levadura en nariz. Los sabores muestran maltas torrefactas y bajo amargor. Cuerpo intenso y moderada carbonatación. Otra gran cerveza compartida con Juanjo  el artista del pan - en el Freiburg. 
22fl oz bottle. ½ Pint glass. Renjoyed on may´12. Very dark brown color. Beige, lasting, small bubbled, creamy head. Hints of chocolate, fruity touch & yeast to the nose. Flavors show roasted malts & soft bitterness. Full body, moderate carbonation. Another shared beer with Juanjo the bread artist- at Cerveceria Freiburg.

Tap. Very dark with big foamy light than head and some lacing.  Smells like a good dark today coffee bean and cocoa. This sounds wired but I almost angel a hint of Capn Crunch. I just get the roastiness and a nice dryness and a hint of bitter in the flavor. Light dry body. Mmm...

Aromas of coffee, toffee, grainy malts and significant hops. Appearance is a deep magenta with a thick, brown foam top. Flavor is roasted nuts and coffee upfront quickly followed by a sweet chocolate finish. Moderately carbonated with a suprisingly thin body. Hops are somewhat noticeable with some herb and alcohol present. Overall, this is a decent stout with flavors of chocolate and coffee being most present. Thin in texture. I wouldnt say I love it, yet its above average. C+ rating.

Sampled with K whilst watching Game of Thrones.  Not as good as I had remembered.  The chocolate, while definitely present, just comes across as a roasty, nutty/vegetal, cocoa mess.  I didnt find anything well balanced, melded together, or well defiined. Guess I could have just been in the mood for something else, but I really didnt care for it too much.

pours very dark, almost black, creamy caramel head, amazing chocolate aroma but faint chocolate flavor, more roasty notes and some coffee come through, slightly bitter finish... would prefer a stronger chocolate flavor to match the intense chocolate aroma

Pour dark brown, almost black, with a small creamy tan head.
Aroma has plenty of chocolate on the nose. Really delicious. On the palate though, not much chocolate is present. Slight coffee and roasted malts.
Taste is a little bitter, with slight chocolate - sweetness.
Watery body, with a semi-flat carb. Would have loved to get some more weight into this one.

One of my favorite stouts.  Chocolate flavor is amazing.  It's a little thin for a stout and not very complex but it's still a solid stout.  Would love to see a barrel aged type offering of this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Rose Alley.  Pours black with a thick caramel colored head.  Aroma is of chocolate, cocoa, and malts.  Flavor is of malts, chocolate, and its quite roasty.  Leaves a nice lacing.  Leaves a roasty chocolate malt finish.
great black color, light brown head...nice mocha aroma...peppery, coffee grounds, malts... bitter aftertaste lingers on the tounge. Gotta agree, the longer it sits out the better the aroma..

i was very intrigued about this beer and it didnt disappoint.  This was my first chocolate stout and I was overwhelmed by the amount of dark chocolate flavour flowing through the beer.  As it got warmer the chocolate aroma began to become more and more evident.  Was incredible.  Very smooth taste not too bitter or hoppy at all.  Definitely leave out of the fridge for 15 mins prior to drinking to enjoy the dark chocolate aroma. Must have very impressed!!!

Yep- this is exactly what it says it is. Black with a fluffy tan head. Dark chocolate nose, and a richer chocolate palate. Higher carbonation than one might expect, but rich and high in "yummy". Long finish.

Originally reviewed: 5/28/09. Pours a thick deep black with a wicked huge tan head on top. 10 minutes later, still there. Great retention. Beautiful lacing rings all over the glass. Nice historical reference of my sipping. Smells of powdered chocolate, cream, and more chocolate. 

Mouthfeel is creamy, but a little on the spritzy side as well. This is the weakest aspect of this beer. Big chocolatey flavor all over this! They werent kidding on the chocolate thing, were they? Theres a touch of hop bitterness mixed in the middle, but the finish is the most pleasant mild cocoa flavor Ive experienced. Wonderful. Wow. Why did I wait so long to pick this one up? This will be a regular dessert, celebration beer in the household from here on out...

Bottle. Pours is black with a brown head, good lace/retention. Aroma of semi-sweet chocolate, coffee, roast, vanilla. Taste is very dry, chocolate, coffee, earth, light roast, light vanilla. Palate is soft, slightly chalky, roasty finish. Good but not great.

Chocolate aroma. Taste of chocolate, oak, leather, malt, hops. As I pull my nose away I smell smoke. So much going on at once and such a smooth beer. I paid £7.95 for a bottle and it is worth it. If you get a chance to try then dont give this a miss.

Draft @ Hangar. Pours black with about a finger of dark  tan head. Aroma dominated by chocolate with a little roasted nuts. Taste is mostly dark chocolate with some nut. Medium bodied with a thick texture. Soft carbonation and a long finish. Overall, pretty good. This is a bomber you may wish to split with a friend.

From Beerlicious app:  Strong coffee and dark chocolate aroma.  Brown color with a frothy brown head.  Starts with light bitterness and finishes with light bitterness and medium sourness.  Medium body with oily creamy texture.  Average carbonation with an alcoholic finish.
Pours black with no head and decent lacing. Aroma is roast, sweet chocolate and vanilla. Taste is caramel, chocolate and a lasting bitter and roasty finish. Medium body.

Bomber poured into a tulip glass, pours a super dark brown, almost black with a small brown head. Nose is dark chocolate, cocoa. Taste is surprisingly not sweet and pretty bitter. Its a little disappointing given the nose. Medium mouthfeel, somewhat thin for a stout. Very good beer, not what I expected, but well done

The deepest brown with a khaki head aroma of bright sweet chocolate. Sweet aroma. Taste is dominated by fresh vivid  chocolate. Guess I caught a fresh batch. Back end hops bitter appropriately with slight pine.. awesome beer.
Pours black with a small white head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasty malts, and coffee. Taste of roasted malts that is nicely balanced by the sweet chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium.

Little goldy head, dark robe looks really limpid color is dark black, Not too sticky to the sides and smell dark chocolate and  even has a little bit of caramel aroma. Quite a good chocolate stout. Have a little after taste of truffles.
UPDATED: SEP 22, 2012 Excellent chocolate stout. first beer from rouge and not the last. Lots of choclate on both the nose and mouth

Dark brown, almost black, with burgundy around the edges. And it smells great. Very strong, very rich. The taste is like the smell, but with a lot of what the snobs call "complexity." Its really the only word that works, too. Heavy tones of malt, coffee, chocolate (duh) and a little bit of a burnt toast thing going on. The kick is the exhale after the sip, when new, rich tones show up. I enjoyed every drop.
A nice beer from rogue ales. Pours black with a thin brown head. Tastes like chocolate of course

06/04/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, discreta schiuma color cappuccino, abbastanza persistente. Aroma meraviglioso di cacao, cioccolato purissimo, sembra di annusare una barretta di cioccolato fondente artigianale. In bocca è appena appena dolciastra solo allattacco, cioccolatosa, quindi evolve in un fantastico finale, in cui lamaro del cioccolato nero fondente si sposa alla perfezione con quello del luppolo. Corpo medio-basso, carbonazione soft. Birra meravigliosa, di grande bevibilità. Si apprezza la genuinità della materia prima.

Nice pour, bottle is about 2 years old, seemed to age pretty well, very bitter, slightly sweet, slight nutty flavor, tasting toasted malts....a little too bitter for my taste but an average stout nonetheless.....expected more based on rating.
Bottle. Opaque. Chocolate malt, coffee, vanilla. Smooth thick body. Flavor thins out, not fleshed out enough.

Very dark brown color-- almost no light can past through. One finger head. Rich chocolate aroma. Taste is chocolate coffee with roasted malts, but a bit watered down. The finish is bitter, dry, and crisp.

Il mondo Rogue é un universo affascinante fatto di grandi birre, ho deciso di partire da un must: la chocolate stout, unimperial Russian stout brassata con il cacao prodotto direttamente dalla Rogue. Nera impenetrabile con schiuma cappuccino, i sentori di fave di cacao sono confermati al primo assaggio, così in bocca si sprigionano note di cioccolato fondente, fiori di vanilla e chicchi di caffè tostato. Una leggera nota astringente rende ancora più soddisfacente la bevuta. Ps è una pazzia non abbinarla con un dolce al cioccolato... chi ha parlato di brownie?!?!?!

Bottle from fondue place.  Dark pour and great head. Moderate chocolate taste and deep mouthfeel. Definitely past the uvula. Decent aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great think tan foamy head and black body. The aroma is a bit sweet.  Strong blend of oats and chocolate, nice balance. Dry. Thin oily palate.

Good. The nose is full on chocolate . The beer is almost opaque black with a thick creamy head. The taste is more chocolate with chocolate on top. No bitterness at all, almost cloying in high quantity. Smooth, thick, and creamy. Great for desserts.
Color is black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet an chocolate. Taste is sweet an chocolate finish. Very sweet beer.

Poured from 22oz bomber into lager glass.  
Aroma: malt chocolate vanilla
Appearance:  deep dark brown.  Almost black.  Slight reddish tint.  2 finger head that lingered. Laces glass ok
Taste:  mild sweet.  Mild bitter.  
Palate:  light and thin. Lots of carbonation.  Mild bitter aftertaste.  
Overall:   I like this.  Lots of chocolate and carbonation.  Comparing to youngs double chocolate stout which was almost flat and hardly any chocolate.  I think this is seasonal and will pickup again when I see it.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Location: 22 oz bottle from Colonial Wine and Spirits, 3/26/12


Aroma: The nose is full of rich, sweet chocolate, accompanied by a bit of roasted malt and coffee

Appearance: Pours a dark brown color with a thick foam of medium brown head and lots of lacing

Flavor: Tastes fairly sweet up-front with lots of chocolate malts balanced by a slightly astringent bitterness

Palate: The body is medium, it has a creamy feel, average-plus carbonation, and a dry/astringent finish

Overall Impression: 
I just recently realized how many of the major Rogue beers I havent rated to this point, and I figured that it would be as good an excuse as any to revisit some of them.  This is as good one to start with as any, as I cant remember the last time I had one of these before today.  This one has a sweet chocolate nose, but the flavor has a lot more bitterness.  It is a pretty good beer, but something about the flavor of this one doesnt work quite as well as the nose.
Pours jet black with a huge tan head.The smell is rich in dark chocolate and malt. A full-flavored balance of burnt malts and bittersweet chocolate. Full bodied and smooth.

This beers nose is amazing. It is a temptingly rich chocolate that is reminiscent of some of the best smelling chocolate I can think of. Sadly though, the beer itself is a bit thin and one dimensional. With its nose, one would think that it would open up to symphony of chocolate flavors that match its aroma with unreal depth, but sadly this is not the case. It is not that this is a bad beer, it just is that it is not a very remarkable beer. In its finish, it leaves very little to remember it by.
Dark brownish black with a lively frothy and creamy head. Love the chocolate smell. However, I was expecting an equally chocolately taste, so I found the bittersweet finish to be a touch  harsh.
Dark brown/black colour with brown head. Sweet chocolately aroma. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, more bitter than sweet. Nice.

Some lastin head, black. Nose is very chockolatey with mild chockolate. deep and very nice. Semifull body and medium length- Taste is a little bitter and also sweet chocolate, A bit simple but otherwise in good ballance

Dark brown color with a creamy, light brown head. The aroma is of cocoa and dark chocolates with a bit of roastiness and a solid malt backbone. The flavor is full of cocoa, with a slight roastiness and malt. It has a nice hoppy flavor as well. Full bodied.

Larôme de quick au chocolat noir méteint avant même ma première lampée. Le corps offre une belle rondeur mais est habité par cette saveur de chocolat naturelle à la pauvre personnalité. Une modeste amertume rehausse le profil chocolaté mais on est loin dune expérience extatique.
now this is one easy drinkin and  tasty chocolate stout! could enjoy a few of these in a sitting with ease!
5 ounce tap.  Tastes heavily sweet, like melted chocolate chips with a slight amount of malt.  It was a little flat and on the light side of medium bodied.

Bottle from retailer.The beer looked great but I could hardly get any aroma. The taste was mostly chocolate with faint alcohol , I found it rather weak tasting.. Thin on the palate, just not cup of jo. In all fairness I been drinking bold, lovely imperal stouts like CC Marshall Zuckov. This one just seemed very blah and forgetable for me.

Bottle at Dayton Ale Feast. My 1A favorite of the evening. Grabbed this right before everything closed down and Im glad I did. Really rich and creamy mouthfeel with tons of coffee, chocolate and roasted malt in the flavor. Well done.

Chocolate bomb! This would be a great beer with a fruit desert. Medium bodied with a strong up front chocolate taste combined with some coffee notes in the middle and hint of cherries at the end. Not a first beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes.  First reviewed 1/24/2011.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

This pours nearly black, with a few tints of ruby. A nice tan creamy head maintains well and leaves interrupted webs of lace down the glass.

The aroma is very chocolately, with roasted malt as support. Soft aroma overall, except the chocolate, with even softer earthy hop notes.

Dark chocolate starts the sip and works well with the roasted malt. Some light bitterness exists at the edge of the malt flavor and there is a smokey quality there as well. Muted earthy hops help to smooth it out. The light level of hops work well with the unsweetened taste and 

Creamy, with enough carbonation to maintain the head. Slightly sticky. Medium to full body.

Solid overall, this is a pretty good chocolate stout and worth coming back to.

On tap at Selezione Birra 2012, Rimini. Pours a dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts and licorice. Chocolate and slght coffe beans. Taste is sweet-ish but well balanced by roasted bitterness. Loads of cocoa beans and chocolate. Soft carbonation. Very interesting and not too sweet at all.

Pours black, voluminous dark brown head. Nose is predominately rich dark chocolate, a little red fruit lurks beneath, cherries... Creamy, a little on the thin side, bittersweet, finishes long with a wave of coffee-tinged cocoa; very good, lacks the complexity and deliciousness to push it to excellent.

Dark black color, with a velvety dark brown head. Even the head tastes like chocolate. Nose is chocolate, and discernable well-roasted barley notes. Flavor is intense--chocolate and chocolate malt notes dominate with counterpoint of floral hops, and a cherrylike fruity note. No sweetness or sourness in the profile. Highly drinkable--mouthfeel is not thick, low carbonation.
Draft. Pours black with a brown head. Smells of tons of mocha. Taste is very chocolate. Real good.

A fair bit of body with this stout, frothy tan head with excellent lacing on the pint glass. Smells of bittersweet chocolate, bitter coffe, pepper, roasty walnuts evident. I get alot of the walnut taste with this, a little chocolate, very earthy.

Sampled on draught.  Pours black with a reddish brown head.  Aromas of choclate nib carmel malt and toffee some aromas of toasted nuts and some hop resin.  Flavor is slightly bitter with flavors of cocoa and slight sweet malts.  Body is medium with a good finish, slightly watery for a stout.
Pours a deep chocolate with thin caramel head. Aroma of chocolate and malty goodness. Flavor is sort of meh. Sigh.

i sure had fun with this one - but, lets rate the beer... Very smooth chocolate flavor that pleases the palate. Bit bitter, but, I really dont care. Smooth finish says drink some more! I did pour slowly into a glass, and did enjoy every drop. Hope this helps, this is now my favorite share brew.

2nd Favorite Choc stout.
Love body and taste, smooth with great Choc taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A decent chocolate stout. Dark black with orange brown head. Chocolate taste much more significant then other chocolate stouts. Bitter finish. A little too intense. Have had better chocolate stouts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an amazing stout. One of my personal top 5 of all time so my rating is extremely biased. Pours a lovely dark brown/black with a light tan head. The aroma is of dark chocolate syrup with a floral hop aroma. It tastes upfront like a sweet milkshake made with chocolate syrup instead of chocolate icecream. Then you get a wonderful coffee hop balance that makes you thirst for another taste. The mouthfeel is evenly carbonated and not too thick. Again this is an amazing chocolate stout. Must try if you love stouts.

On draft at gingerman Plano.  Pours black with a medium tan head that dissipates. Quickly.  The aromas are chocolate, oatmeal, light coffee.  The mouthfeel is bittersweet and roasty with a dry finish and heavy body.  Cheers

Bottle.  Black pour with a 2 inch tan head.  Aroma of dark chocolate, or maybe cocoa.  Taste is dark chocolate, bitterness, tanginess, and a little alcohol.  Body and carbonation are at a medium level.

Appearance
Pitch black, pours a massive, creamy head.

Aroma
Chocolate, unsurprisingly. Malt, light toasty notes. And some more chocolate!

Taste
Well, Im going to go out on a limb here and say that I taste some chocolate Its a rather milky combination of chocolate and malt though, rather than the very dark, roasted chocolate flavour that you get with some Chocolate Stouts (I have Youngs Double Chocolate Stout in mind in particular). The beer supposedly packs a lot of hops as well, but I cant really taste them, the chocolate and malt are overwhelming. Perhaps there is a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste, but that as well is dominated by notes of roasted malt.

Overall
This is my first sampling of the Chocolate Stout, and I was expecting not to be disappointed  I wasnt! The beer is rated extremely highly, but there are some very valid competitors in this category...
Dark pour with about a finger of tan head. Smell is of very dark chocolate. Taste is smooth and a creamy mouthfeel. I lot like drinking chocolate milk. Medium body. Very good chocolate stout.
scura buona schiuma piuttosto persistente cioccolato in tutto ma non stucchevole
Excellent chocolate stout.  The chocolate is pretty subtle - more like cocoa.  Lots of roasted grain and very tasty.

bottle; black with small dark brown head; aroma-sweet, chocolate, roasty, vanilla; taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter finish. Bittersweet chocolate dominates. Would have preferred a little sweeter

On cask at Atlanta Cask Fest 2012.  Pours a dark brown with an off-tan head.  Nose is slight roast, definite cocoa, dark chocolate, and milk chocolate, with hints of sweetness.  Flavor is similar- nice chocolatey presence and good chocolate representation-- all manner of chocolates are present.  Light in body and nice overall.

In bottle at Appellation Wines, cheers Ash! Pours a very dark brown colour with a decent, light tan head. Aroma of chocolate milk with similar flavours of choc milk, caramel and roasty malt. Moderate carbonation and a bitter chocolate finish.

650ml bottle. Pours glossy black with a cappuccino head.
The nose has dark chocolate and smokiness. The taste has dark chocolate and raisins. Theres a dry charcoal thing on the end. The palate is full bodied, thick textured but just a little bit too much alcohol hanging around. Overall good beer but should hide alcohol better for drinkability.
Dark black color with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate. taste is bitter with a medium body and heavy carbonation

Bomber. Sweet chocolate aroma with a frothy tan head and a dark tan fill. The palate was a creamy medium body, and the taste was a great balance of sweet chocolate with a bitter base. Sweeter than Brooklyn BCS; more bitter than Southern Tier Choklat. Personally, I like the balance.
65cl, no mention of ABV, American brew, thx to Jeppe!, complex sweet Stout, malty/roasted and slightly sweet/bitter, balanced, hazy, rocky head, good brew, yet expensive!
UPDATED: JAN 29, 2012 one of the best beers i have tried. medium sweetness, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, chocolate, roasty, coffee.

Aroma: chocolate, nuts, roasty, caramel, citrus, pleasantly yeasty
Appearance: Opaque, nearly black, with a rich frothy head
Taste: Slightly sweet with light chocolate tones, maybe a bit of toasted hazelnut, and significant coffee notes, surprisingly  not bitter or sour
Palate: Medium body, medium texture, soft carbonation, long smooth finish
Overall: This is a pleasant beer, definitely lighter than I expected. Stouts arent my favorite style, and its a bit dark for my taste, but it was enjoyable for the style.

Cerveza color negro, con cabeza cafe con buena retencion, aroma con notas de chocolate y malta tostada; cuerpo de medio a completo, carbonatacion de media a alta.

El sabor es excelente, aunque es mas amargo que dulce, lo cual no es normal para el estilo, a diferencia del aroma, el sabor tiene notas mas marcadas de cafe, tambien tiene notas de malta tostada y chocolate, en resumen, el sabor es cremoso y amargo.

Dejando de lado las stout imperiales, es la mejor stout que probado.

Pours very dark with a 1/4 finger head. Aroma is huge chocolate and vanilla. Taste follows with a great mouth feel. Leaves you wanting more. Great chocolate stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle, shared with Taylor. Beautiful pitch-black color, some brown head, some lace. Crisp, light carbonation, very roasty aftertaste. Nice and sweet, great chocolate aroma... Finally, a chocolate stout that hits the mark! Great, perfect amount of bitter sweetness, an accurate chocolate-like balance. Kinda dry. Awesome caramel malt nose. Delicious beer.

In the recent past Ive avoided Rogue beers as widely available, expensive and well-hyped yuppie brews.  This one changed my mind.  Bomber pours am opaque dark brown with a tan head and lots of lacing.  Chocolate is the overwhelng smell.  Aroma is mostly chocolate with a hint of coffee.Creamy texture without much carbonation Taste is slightly sweet.  Finish is chocolate, with the finish only as bitter as chocolate can be.

[Rated 10/16/2009] Bottle. Pours dark brown with a very thick deep brown head. Aroma is of chocolate and caramel, very nice and soft. Flavor contrasts to the sweet aroma and is a little bittery -- hops and roasted grains. Overall, a good brew, but I am not that fascinated with the flavor, expected it sweeter.
Draught.Dark brown colour with beige head.Aroma is sweet of chocolate and coffee,creamy mouthfeels and light rosted taste of caramel and cream,smooth and well balanced beer.
Deep  deep brown with a tan head. Smells like bitter chocolate or cocoa.  Lots of clear chocolate and coffee taste but lots of hops too.  Its a really solid chocolate stout.

Pours a deep black color with a nice medium sized head that leaves good lace on the glass. 

The aroma is primarily roasty but is sweet smelling, fairly mocha like with more coffee character than chocolate. 

The flavor is roasty, fairly bitter,  and while full of rich dark chocolate notes the beer is decidedly not sweet and emphasizes bitterness long before any hint of sweet milk chocolaty flavor. 
This is particularly enjoyable.
Rich dark color. Full creamy head. Light coffee aroma. Smooth palate with pronounced coffee taste and subtle chocolate finish. A very good interpetation of the style!

Tasted at BevMo Friday tasting. Chocolate, chocolate all the way around. Ok palate and good aroma and light, definitive chocolate flavor. Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

strong aroma of chocolate.  chocolate flavors present, along with plenty of roasted malts.  very heavy tasting, and i couldnt take too much.  definitely a novelty beer.  not sure why this one is rated so high.  it did smell good though
Chocolate and malts/grains in aroma.  The flavor is chocolate and malts with a decent bitterness.  Overall another very good ale from Rogue.

Tap @ Beer Temple (from notes): color almost black. Beige head (not much). Smells of chocolate/cocoa powder, some fruits. Flavor is lightly sweet & bitter, lots of cocoa. Medium body. Finishes lightly bitter, bitter chocolate.

Bottle pour.  Ebony color.  Tan head.  Subtle chocolate aroma.  Slight bitter finish.  This beer is more stout than chocolate.  If you are looking for a sweeter chocolate stout, this is not your beer.  But, very good nontheless.

It pours a very dark brown to black with a foamy, milk shake-like head that lingers.  The aroma is boutinful with chocolate and a noted hopped character.  The body is thin to medium which was a bit of a letdown. The taste has a chocolate malt character with a powerful hopped finale that lingers.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2014 From a bottle poured black with a creamy dark tan head that left great lacing. Aroma was hot cocoa. Taste was dark chocolate and coffee. Nice bitterness and taste was not near as sweet as the aroma. This is very good.

Draught at Bjergtrolden.
Black with a large brown head, modest lacings. Aroma moderate malty (roasted, chocolate, light burnt). Flavor light sweet, medium bitter of roasted malts and hops. Medium body.

Pours a dark black with a nice chocolate and creamy head. Taste is sweet and heavy on chocolate with roasted malts and coffee as well. Finish is bitter, roasty, and smooth. A drinkable chocolate stout that a profound chocolate flavor.

Pours pitch black, with a nice chocolate puffy one inch head. Aroma is malty and sweet. Flavor is full of chocolate which lingers nicely. Well balanced, not bitter and a very drinkable stout.
