This is it! Dark....smooth....not so smooth...a heavy dessert!!! An event in drinking!

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2007 Re-rate:(10/26/07) this was tasted in my early days of beer drinking and it was too much for me I suppose.  Now the first thing that comes to mind is Shakespeare stout with chocolate in it.  Pretty damn tasty, IMO, though I have to admit Shakespeare is better. *** Pours black, with a big dark brown head.  Aroma is of chocolate and roasted malt.  Flavor is a tad burned for my taste, but not overwhelmingly sweet.  Not as good as Youngs DCS in my opinion.

Pours motor oil black with a thick brown head. Autocrat coffe syrup on the nose with some citrusy overtones. Slick and sticky on the palate, keeping the flavor strong in the aftertaste. Massive chocolate taste, and good chocolate at that. Toast is also present in the initial hit of flavor. Real smooth drinking stout.
A dark black pour with a good sized brown head.  Less hoppy than what Ive come to expect from Rogue.  Some chocolate in the aroma with a light chocolate flavor and some malty sweetness.

Motor oil color with a reddish/brown small head. Loads of Hershey chocolate syrup in the nose but the oats and citrus of the hops also noticeable. Sweet chocolate up front with slightly burnt toast in the middle, a tangy mineral follow. Quite tasty and not as chocolaty sweet as I thought it would be.

After opening the bottle and geting the rush of hops and chocolate, I poured it into a Westmalle glass and it showed the dark chocolate color. Smoothness is nice with a little bit of after taste. The chocolate flavor is tremendous and it tastes of roasted spices. Very excellent brew

Found this bottled at a grocery in Rockford, Illinois.  Milky, coal black pour with a very thick, brown head, gorgeous color, nice nose of cocoa and rye, oatmeal, cinnamon, black coffee, bitter chocolate and orange peel throughout.  Complex, and very good.  Another nice one from Rogue.

Bomber. A real thick pour with small dark head. The bittersweet chocolate flavor is a nice flavor. There is a roasted malty flavor as well. For a stout this is rather easy to drink and not to pungent.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2007 Black in color with a dark caramel head. Strong chocolate aroma with hints of oat and barley. Flavors a little more mild than I had expected, only hints of choclate and roasted oat. I wasnt expecting to taste the alcohol in this one but it was definitley there. A good chocolate stout, but not great.
A very good chocolate stout strong chocolate flavor other than that fairly mellow I most definitely will get this beer again

Ok. Tough Rogue is very high on my list, their chocolate stout isnt. I find the sweet flavor a bit off--kind of like carob or some fake chocolate drink. But...a little over a year ago some local store had 22oz. bottles on sale for something like $3 so I grabbed one, put it in the cellar, and forgot about it. 13 months later my mom, who gets giddy about chocolate and coffee brews, comes to visit, we open it...wow, the concentrated Yoohoo notes were gone and a really, really pleasant chocolate stout remained!

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber into a pint glass, black with a thick chocolate milkshake head. It looks more like a root beer float than beer. The flavor to me was a bit disappointing. It was more bitter than sweet, which seems to be a hallmark of Rogue ales. It was more baking chocolate than sweet with some hints of roast malt and coffee. Just was not my cup of tea.

A good, full stout, but perhaps a little on the mellow side--tad tamer than the Shakespeare Stout.  Pours black with a beautiful head.  Nice, smooth, stout flavor with chocolate overtones and tame hops and a slight chocolate flavor in the finish. Great beer to introduce someone to stouts.
Pours a deep dark brown, almost black with a huge tan foamy head. Aroma of chocolate. Tastes bitter roasted chocolate and a touch of hops. As the name states....."Chocolate Stout"

Bought a 22 oz bottle and was anxiours to try.  I have enjoyed several other Rogue beers.  It poured a nice dark color, and smelled of dark chocolates and kind of almond scent.

When I tasted it though I thought I had gone to starbucks and ordered the Chantico they used to sell.  I didnt finish a full glass.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 Very chocolaty and sweet. Perhaps a little astringent. Black black in color. The flavors are complimented by the slight accompaniment of alcohol. 6.3 shows itself slightly as the beer warms.

Black and thick.  There is a brown head, fairly large for a small pour.  I would describe this as a heavier beer than most of what I have had from Rogue.  Little chocolate in the aroma, but some is there.  Some yeast as well with a roasted/burned character.  Flavor has more chocolate than the aroma.  Chocolate flavor is bitter but balanced by some sweetness from the malt.

Pours a nice dark brown/black, with a nice brown head.  Nice sweet nose that shows off some dark chocolate, caramel, and a hint of nuttiness.  Nice sweet flavor that reminds me of milk chocolate in a bottle.  Not overpoweringly sweet, but it carries a good dose of chocolate, with a nice dose of those Rogue hops you either love or hate.  Myself personally........I love em!
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: Nice sweet chocolate aroma and flavor, pours a wonderful dark black color with a lovely medium brown head. If youlike sweet beers and sweet chocoalte this beer is right up your alley
When the label says Chocolate they aint lying. Aroma and flavor are chocolate. If you dont like chocolate stay away from this one. Makes me wish I had a bowl of vanilla ice cream to go with it.

22oz bomber.  thick black pour with a fluffy brown head.  adequate lacing.  sweet swiss milk chocolate dominates the aroma, but is complemented by the smell of chocolate covered cherries, rich toasted malts and a touch of hops and creamy vanilla.  though a sweet stout the finish is a lilttle bittersweet.  the hops really come to light in the taste, as does a well rounded earthiness.  the finish is exceptionally long, and somehow a bit rough, with hints of salt.  great beer, high drinkability.
Pint glass from a bottle. Not bad, but came off a chalky and a bit dry. Good blend of "beer" and chocolate flavor, similar to the Frederick Miller.

At one time, I was impressed by this beer.  Over time, however, I have become less enamoured.  Thats just the way it goes.  The chocolate flavor is definitely there but seems somehow too forced.  The palate is too thin to me; I remember this being thicker but that could just be my mind playing tricks on me.  Maybe Im just tired of Rogue beers.  I dont know.

Pours a pitch black with a light tan head.  Very appealing looking.  Pretty heavy chocolate notes and even get he slightest hop aroma on the first big whiff.  Pretty heavy roasted malts in this one, combined with the chocolate and very light caramel characters.  You get the hoppiness towards the finish of this beer which evens it out pretty nicely.  good brew.

bottle.  black with thick frothy tan head.  This has a nice chocolate aroma, hoppy and roasted malts.   flavor much the same with the best damn chocolate taste Ive had in a beer.  Very rich.  A chocolate lovers dream.  Makes me want to throw some ice cream in with it.
on tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Black in color with chocolatety flavor & aroma. Medium body & creamy. very smooth & enjoyable. another home run from rogue

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2007 Black with a good brown head. Light chocolate aroma. Chocolate taste and aftertaste that is nice and strong. Pretty much the perfect chocolate taste with a good body. Only problem was that some sips were more chocolately than others.

Bomber.  Very dark, black color, with a dark tan medium sized head.  Aroma was chocolate with a bitter smell to it.  Flavor was amazing.  Dark chocolates, chocolates, malts, with a great amount of bitterness.  Frankly I dont think I could drink this more than once in a while, but its great none the less.

On tap @ Rogue Pub Portland, OR

Dark brown, almost black, persistent foamy thick head, tinged with the brown color of the beer. Toasty chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, coffee aroma. Superbly balanced sweetness that guides you to a nicely bittered finish. Good stuff. Some of the best from Rogue.

This beer is black with a huge, creamy and light brown head, and the aroma is very much chocolate and cocoa. The flavour is just as intense with loads of dark chocolate, cocoa, limited sweetness, nice bitterness, that might too much for some, but not for me. The oats gives smoothness - and I must conclude: Its a really, really nice stout!!!
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2007 22 oz. bottle - heavy chocolate aroma and taste, yet very smooth and full of flavor; chocolate seems slightly overwhelming at first taste, but still a really good stout
The beer has a terrific dark chocolaty flavor, slight coffee bite and bitter cocoa finish.  Highly recommend to any fan of stouts.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle a deep black with thick,  brown, lasting head like an ice cream soda. Smelled like a chocolate bar. Flavor was chocolate, malt, roasted grains, coffee and a slight hop bitterness. Smooth and creamy, made a nice dessert beer after a spicy meal.
Deep rich color with a big off-brown head.  Nose of chocolate, roasted malt, and epresso.  Flavor with much the same, nice texture with a finish of a little pepper.

served cold, from a 22 oz. bottle. pours black with a creamy tan head that dissipates into a thin, lasting trail. the main components of the aroma are chocolate and coffee. the taste isnt full and creamy, but is rich with chocolate, and has a slight bitterness. overall its an excellent stout, one of my favorites.

Serving Type: 22oz bottle into glass

Appearance: Pours a jet black with a beautiful, creamy, red tinted 2 finger head that dissipates within a few minutes and leaves some lacing around the edge of my glass. This stout is pure eye candy.

Smell: Coffee, chocolate, and brown sugar. 

Taste: An initial very rich dark chocolate with minor hop bitterness thrown in, followed up by a pure cocoa powder. This is called Chocolate Stout for a reason. 

Mouthfeel: If there is a weak point to this stout, it has to be the mouthfeel. This one is on the thin side. It is not a bad mouthfeel by any means, I was just expecting (and hoping) for a creamier, fuller body. 

Drinkability: This stout is pretty drinkable, especially if you are a chocolate lover. I, myself, am not a huge chocolate fan, but I will have no problem drinking this 22oz bottle. However, this has enough chocolate flavor for me for a week. Will I buy this again? Of course. It is a solid stout and great to keep on hand

Starting to try out the stouts a bit more. This one was really good. I ayy need to delve into these a bit more. Pours a ridiculously dark brown. Nice foam. Faded pretty quick but could have been my cup. The smell was great. The taste i am still getting used to but it was still really good.
Great color, great aroma and great taste - this is a must try for fans of Chocolate Stouts and beer alike.

Poured a nearly opaque dark brown with a beautiful two-finger brown head.  Some lacing but nothing special.  Slightly oily look.  The aroma is sweet with chocolate punching you in the face followed by some roasted malt.  As the beer opens up a bit of oats are noted.  The flavor is all chocolate initially.  Tasted like a Yoo-Hoo at first but as it progressed I tasted smoke, some malt and a bit of hops on the finish that helps balance it out.  On par with a SS Oatmeal Stout.

Black in colour, deep dark hazelnut head, thick lacing head.  Smells of smoky rich cocoa beans, earthy and oats, with a hint of bitters.  Thick deep dark chocolate taste with an aftertaste of bitter.  Very nice and very smooth.

Its a real treat to have this on tap. I can honestly say there is a huge difference between the tap and bottle experience. 

All of the great things about the bottle just come alive in fantastic ways in the draft version of this brew. 

Its a dessert in its own right, but I recently had the experience of tasting this with Ice cream in it, and while not for everyone, is freaking fantastic.

Pours nearly black with a two inch fluffy and creamy head of foam. Great head retention and lacing. Aroma of Hersheys (with almond) chocolate bar.

Sweet candy-like chocolate melds into chocolate malt and bitter roasted grain. Some strong coffee flavors show up in the finish. Smooth, medium bodied, good carbonation.
pours a dark black color with a creamy black head good chocolate and cofee aroma flavor is mostly bitter chocolate this brew is unique and satisfying overall a nice sipping stout

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2007 Bottle.  Pours black, very black, blacker than regular stout if that is possible, with a nice brown head.  Aroma is chocolate with slight traces of hops.  Taste is a nice, rich chocolate with a slightly more bitter chocolate finish.  There might be some coffee in there too.  Better than I expected seems to be the common statement with this beer and I completely agree.  This is truly great.  Doesnt taste like beer but thats a compliment.

Pours close to black with a thick dark brown head.  The aroma has lots of creamy chocolate roasted malt and some chalkiness.  Medium / thick body with lots of carbonation.  The flavors starts with aspects from the aroma along with vanilla.  The finish adds a hoppy twang as well as a bit of sourness.  As the bottle goes down it gets smoother and richer and more bitter chocolate shows up.  A good stout, but doesnt blow me away.

wow.......talk about sweet!
aroma is BIG chocolate. 
head is very dark brown. its sooooooo sweet. makes me wonder if they used artifical chocolate flavouring. Little too sweet for my taste buds.

On Tap-Poured a dark brown color w/the brownest head Ive ever seen on a beer! Definate chocolate aroma. Flavor of bittersweet chocolate w/just a touch of coffee & roasted malt. Sweet finish, but not sickly sweet. This one is just what its advertised to be. A good way to get someone to try a stout who wouldnt usually drink one. I couldnt drink this all the time, but it is a nice change of pace/after dinner brew.
Bottle. Deep brown with 3 fingers of chewy tan head.  Definite chocolate aroma on roasted malt base. Medium bodied. High IBU but not bitter on my palate. Need totaste again soon.

Wow, nice beer.  I did not expect a lot from this beer, but this one came up big.  This beer is exactly what it says...chocolate stout.  Nice flavors, coffee, malt, carmel, roast, and then a wonderful chocolate taste at the end.  I was totally surprised that this beer actually tasted like its name!  I would have this beer again, and multiple times over.  Thank you Rogue for this one!

Pour is a very dark with a nice size tan head.  Aroma is like walking into a candy store.  Lots of chocolate.  Would almost compare this to smelling chocolate milk.  Flavor is all things chocolate. Again almost like drinking chocolate milk with a bit of a kick in the end.  Very rich and thick.  A very well done brew.

Pours dark with a a good brown head. The taste and smell of chocolate smell in this beer is very significant. The first drink was all chocolate, but then a nice coffee aftertaste. Very Very great stout!

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2008 Poured a dark brown with quickly lost but toasty-brown head, which forms a ring and a patchwork of lace on the surface of the beer. Looks thick! Aroma of milk & dark chocolate, dark malt, and vodka/alcohol. Had to sit down to drink this, as it made my knees weak. WOW. Great malting, seamlessly incorporates chocolate flavouring. Oats evident in both taste and body. Not too shy on the hops, either - grassy, almost Fugglicious but apparently not (Cascade? Really?) Taste starts out with sweet chocolate and crystal malts, segues into teriyaki & hops, evens out with roasted barley, chocolate malt, hops, and brown rice. Carbonation perfect, body creamy and thick. There are some late hop additions here, which make it rather bold for a sweet stout. My first American craft-brew, and I am very impressed!

Tasting Notes, 2008: 2007 vintage, I must mention the intense woodsy smoky taste in this bottle. Really something else.

A: Black with Dark tan head. Large bubbles
S: Mild scent of Chocolate and coffee until it warms, then WOW!
T: Bitter Chocolate, roasted malt
M: Intense and lingering. Tast carries on long after the beer is finished
D:Too intense for heavy drinking but great beer

(1pt. 6 oz bottle) poured into a sifter.  This has a deep dark ebony pour with a dark frothy head.  A light chocolate smell.  The front is heavy chocalate with a milky smooth finish.  A very good stout.

Pours a deep black that doesnt let any light through, with a two finger dark tan head that fades slowly to a thick cap, leaving behind a very nice webbing of lace.

Smell; dominant chocolate aroma up front, with some roasted malts intermingled with some hints of coffee.

Taste; as with the smell the chocolate is the dominant flavor, which isnt surprising since this is a chocolate stout. A touch of coffee bitterness is oresent, as well as a little bit of a smokey quality. this isnt to complex in the flaovr department, but it is still very good. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy, and fits the flavor profile almost prefectly. The only thing that limits the drinkability is the heaviness of the beer.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: Pours very dark, with a dark head that lasts nicely espcially for a stout. Nice sweetness but nothing cloying, good amount of hops which really help to balance the malts.Very well done one of my favorite Rogue beers I have had to date. I had shyed away from it previously because  i was worried it would be too sweet. But it was not just a really terrific brew.

An excellent beer that actually adequately portrays its name.  This beer has a wonderful aroma, beautiful dark and rich color, and a very chocolaty and heavy taste that is absolutely sure to satisfy the dark beer lover.  The only downside to this beer, is that its so dark and heavy that it almost certainly could not be drunk all the time.

22oz bottle pored black in color with a huge brown head. Aroma was an awsome chocolate mixed with some roast, oats and some hops. The taste was rich chocolate with a small amount of hop bitterness. The mouthfell was rich chocolate with a good amount of carbonation. Overall this is the best chocolate stout made and maybe the best from Rogue.
Bottle.  Very dark, almost pitch black with a small deep tan head.  Dark chocolate aroma, tastes of coffee and dark chocolate, a little smoke flavoring too.  Fairly dry finish.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2007 Roasty smoky burnt coffee, choclate, coco puff with hint of citrus and dry finish. This stuff could cause reflex coughing. Medium body.  Had a muted, truncated uneven aspect to taste/finish  that limits its appeal. Chocolate truffle is not a taste I want in a brew

Pours out in a very dark black creamy liquid.  Aroma of full on chocolates, coffee, pure malts with a silght hint of hop.  Christ Almighty, these Rogue brewers are something else!  Flavor is of pure chocolates, malts and some hops.  Some great beer,  find it and drink it!
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: 650ml - Mocha head over pitch black liquid, coffee and cocoa on nose, decent lace.  Smoky cocolate with bitter coffee finish.  OK.

Bomber. Pours virtually black with a thick mocha colored head. Tons of chocolate in the aroma.  The chocolate is very prevalent in the flavor as well. Theres also some roasted malt. Slightly bitter at the finish. Not as sweet as I thought it would, which is fine. Enjoyable and quite good.

Pours a dark, but clear brown.  A flashlight through it is a gorgeous ruby red.  Aroma reminds me of the chocolate-flavored tootsie pops.  Its sort of thin, and definitely chocolate.  The flavor is mostly dry, a bit roasty, but sort of thin, and not quite robust.  The finish is dry, and it doesnt leave much but a faint chocolate aftertaste.  I like this one, its easy to drink for a stout, but still has a nice chocolatey yum.
Blacker than used oil with a dark tan head.  Nice and thick with a roasty chocolate taste and a nice, almost bitter aftertaste that stays with you.  I am very impressed with this brew.   A must try.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2007 Bottled.  Dark pour with thick tan head. Nice body. Roasted Malt / chocolate aroma. Taste is of chocolate but not overly sweet (I liked that) Balanced well with dry finish. This is a gem. Fantastic.

Pours black w/ a full, semi creamy froth that recedes slowly to reveal a full canopy w/ dense brewers lace. Nice retention. Aromas of sweet maple and cocoa. I cant believe this is beer. Impressive. Full nectar w/ ample residual effers creating somewhat of a velvety texture. Decadent roasted malts and bakers cocoa. Huge chocolate essense. A little citrus shines through as it warms. Nice balancing hop componant. Finish has precision bittering to a pin point w/ velvety hops. This brew is amazing. Im not a fan of the chocolate thing but I really appreciate this specimen. I was able to drink the whole 22ozzies. It blows away Sam Adams C.B. and murders Youngs w/ a pitchfork. I highly recommend this to all you chocolate lovers. Overall: this brew hits all the factors I use to score a brew right between the eyes. It deserves the current score.

22 oz bomber.  Its really fascinating to me that Ive seen this brew around for literally years and never thought I should try it because hell it would always be there.  The brew pours deep black with a large dense brown head.  The aroma is delectably chocolate with hints of malt  and roastiness.  The chocolate really comes through nicely in the taste.  I grew up with a milk allergy so Ive had a lot of dark chocolate in my day and this really shines.  It delicious and ligtht and drinkable.  Ill look forward to drinking the rest of this pint, and then making a stout float with the rest.

Black colour. Creamy fluffy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts and chocolate. Flavour is sweet, smooth and creamy with a good roasted maltiness, chocolate, coffee, raisins. Bitter-sweet finish. A great tasty sweet stout!

Pours black with  tan, creamy, almost fluffy, full headwith plenty of longevity and minimal lacing.  Lots of chocolate, cocoa, toffee, and light roast in the nose.  Flavor is similar to the Shakespeare but with more chocolate keeping the other flavors hidden; dry chocolate, burnt toast, light chaulk, faint roast in the background with a moderately light bitterness and an almost cedar like note.  Palate is medium, moderate carbonation, and slick in texture.  Finish is bittersweet and even drier with chocolate, cedar, and chaulk.  Not a bad chocolate stout, but too dry too be fully enjoyable.  The Shakespeare has so much more to offer than this one and Im not sure why this is rated as high as it is?

Bottle into pint glass - Ok. I tried a few different Rogue styles a month or so ago ...when I first started this Beer tasting journey. I thought this would be my favorite beer of all the ones available to me..but I was wrong. I love chocolate, but this is toooo much chocolate, for a beer. Ive got a bottle of Shakespeare Stout in the fridge waiting...and it symbolizes Rogues last chance with The C.E.O....

Large off-white head on a dark brown beer.  Smells like chocolate.  The flavor is mostly cocoa, almost like an unsweetened chocolate.  Not bad though. Head was too large, as the liquid was gone and a couple inches of head remained
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Dark brown and perhaps unclear beer. Has a fine, big beige head, mostly lasting. Aroma and flavor is full of fine balanced chocolade. Flavor finish has clear notes of coffee.

Unclear Dark brown, nearly black with fine thick creamy Brown head. Fine lacings on the side of the glass. The aroma and taste has Roasted malts and bitter chocolate flavor. Some coffee and caramel. Very tasty. The body is medium filling. Could be a lot thicker/fuller. However its smooth and soft. Bitter hops dominates the finish! Really great chocolate stout!

pours black with a small light brown head.  Aroma:  Chocolate, and more chocolate, sweet malts.  Taste:  Dry cocoa powder, chocolate malt, notes of coffee, caramel, and citrus way in the back with a roasty, and hoppy lingering bitterness in the finish. Body is silky and smooth. Now I remember why I drank so much of this last winter.

Bottle. The initial sniff left me thinking of the Youngs Double Chocolate Stout, but this beer had so much more to disclose. Hue was roasted dark and thick density look to it. Head was average creamy with a light brown color, which was mostly lasting and left some good lacing. Aroma was heavy malty with predominant note being chocolate. Secondary notes are burnt, coffee, rye bred, smoke and candies. Some hops are also evident in aroma. Palate display excellent features with a medium to full body and an oily texture. Carbonation was flat. Initial flavor was moderated bitter with a balanced sweetness to it. Finish was again balanced and bitter-sweet with an average duration. Chocolate stout is not a style by it self, never the less this is properly the greatest chocolate stout I have had.

Bottle.   Pours an inky black color with a medium sized cramy tan head, some lacing.   Aroma is coffee, chocolate, malt.   Flavor is chocolate, coffee, nuts, some floral notes.   Palate is full bodied, mildly carbonated, creamy, silky, bitter finish.   Nice job!

This was a very enjoyable beer, and along with their Shakespeare Stout might be one of Rogues best. A nice chocolatey aroma with floral and malt notes. A deep oil, black appearance with a huge tan head and creamy on the palate. Flavor was an intense blast of chocolate, some nuttiness and a hice helping of hops. A really easy drinking, full flavored stout that would be a fantastic starting point for getting someone going on stouts.
The definitive chocolate beer!! If you like Shakespeare Stout, then you will LOVE this

22 oz bomber. Pours close to black with huge brown foamy head that lasted a long time and left big chucks of lacing.  Nose of  chocolate, hops, roasted malt and chocolate malt. Very rich body and wonderful creamy texture.  Flavor contains hops which balances the sweetness perfectly.  Great bitter finish brings it all home.  Right up there with the best stout ever.

This one seems to have a dark chocolate flavor which is more complex than a dark chocolate bar as I can sense a melding of oats, chocolates and malts with some bitter hoppiness thrown in to keep it real. I like this one better than Shakespeare Stout!

Poured out of a bomber that is a few months old into a pint glass.  It appeared almost completely black with a nice thick, off white head.  The aroma is pure milk chocolate with hardly any hope influence.  Flavor is much the same, with a sweet milky chocolate flvor upfront and undertones of semi-sweet and dark chocolate.  Creamy texture makes for a great, smooth mouthfeel.  Overall, delicious, no other words to describe it.  Id rather drink this than eat actual chocolate.

The nose is pure chocolate, like a cup of hot cocoa.  Flavor is much lighter than the nose would indicate. A nice blend of chocolate and roasted flavors, with not much hop bitterness. Mouth feel is very thin for a stout.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2006 I like beers to be on the sweeter side, so this is great stuff in my opinion. Nice chocolate smell and taste, very distinct. Hoppy at the end. Ill have another.

WOnderful brew.  
Positive: great chocolate taste, balanced flavors and alcohol taste.  Great body and lasting carbonation.
Negatives:  Unbalanced aroma, small tan brown head, "burn" on my tounge from mouthfeel.
Great sweet stout- it tastes like chocolate and is very good quality.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2007 There is more going on here than chocolate.  Grain, chocolate, coffee, cream, hops.  A great chocolate, as chocolates go
A nice try, but too hoppy for how I think a stout should be. Also a quite watery and thin body.

Bottle. Dark with nice brown head. Chocolate, chocolate, chocolate! Aroma also has sweetness and a little licorice. Flavour is...Ta-dah: chocolate! Some licorice and a light bitteness and a little dry flavour. Soft but with nice carbonation.
Dark brown with creamy tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, some coffee, and sweet cream.  Nice chocolate taste with hints of coffee, oats, and some nice hop bite to finish things off.  Well done!

22oz. Bottle:  Smells of choclate, malts, espresso, and a little bitter hops.  Smells kind of like a choclate egg cream or choclate milk.  Poured dark brown with a big, creamy, thick, dark brown head. that lasted throughout.  Very good lacing.  Opaque.  Flavor is also like a choclate egg cream.  Very choclaty.  Well balanced with some nice light bitterness as well.  Medium sweet and lightly bitter.  Medium body.  Slick texture.  Lively carbonation.  A very tasty Sweet Stout that is lacking in body somewhat.

Poured a dark black color. Not translucent. The head was thin and tan and quickly disappeared. Aroma was sweet and malty. The flavor was chocolatey, smooth, and roasted. The palate was full and the finish was smooth.
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2007 Wow!  Great taste of chocolate, yet  still has the bittness of hops.  Great thick light brown head.  Dark brown pour.  Fantastic on a cold night.
Damn good! Pours black in color, nice thick brown head. Great chocolate aroma. Full body. Velvety texture. Great chocolate taste mixed in with hops.
Very dark.  Sweet aroma, definately chocolate.  Very good.  Complex and enjoyable.  Great for this time of year.
22 oz bottle. Black-brown color with creamy head. The aroma is filled with sweet milk chocolade. Much dryer flavor but still very chocolatey with notes of coffee. Very long chocolate-coffee finish.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2006 22 oz bottle.  Pours black with dark brown lasting head.  Others may claim chocolate aroma and flavor but this is the real thing.  If you want a chocolate flavored beer, this is a good thing.  A little much for me (but the bottle did say chocolate, so I cant blame anyone but myself.)

22 oz bomber.  Pours an almost black color with a creamy beige head.  Aroma is of cocoa powder,dark baking chocolate,oats and chocolate morsels.  Flavor is of dry dark unsweetened chocolate, mild coffee beans,roasted malt,oats and more chocolate.  Very tasty brew and one of Rogues best efforts.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2007 Pours black with a frothy, cream colored head.  Aromas of many desserts - mocha, irish cream, and dark chocolate layer cake topped with caramel.  Flavors of espresso, burnt coffee beans and mounds of bitter dark chocolate give way to a finish that is rather reserved.  Sweet, roasted flavor with a sophisticated absence of overpowering bitterness or viscosity.  Successful.

An almost black pour with an almost tan head and lacing. An aroma that almost smells like coco. A rich semi sweet flavor of chocolate as well. A tad of light bitter that fits in perfectly with the flavors that continue to seep from this beer as it warms. A good almost thick palate that has a tad of fizzy with it. This I think is the best beer by Rogue that Ive had.

22oz bottle - pours dark black with a coffee/mocha head. Immediately, you can smell the chocolate. And its good! Aroma is, again, lots of chocolate (!) and some malt. The flavour is an awesome hit of quality chocolate, maybe some oatmeal, followed by roasted malt and a slightly roasty/hoppy bitter finish. You can still taste the chocolate. Chocolate, chocolate, chocolate...and Im not a big chocolate person usually. But see how many times I can say the word in this review. Lots. This is delicious stuff! Desert in a bottle, but its still a real beer - theres nothing wimpy or candy-like about this. Dark and rich and smooth. Like me.

Bottled. Pours an opaque black with a lacy tan head. Sweet aroma of chocolate with a little caramel. Creamy medium body with light carbonation. The taste starts sweet with more chocolate, then nuts, vanilla, burnt toast.  Bitter dry coffee and pine finish.

A nice dark brew that pours with an impressive head. The nose is chocolate with barley lurking in the background. Well carbonated, this brew feels good in the mouth as it releases an interestingly complex blend of chocalaty oats and malted, roasted barley. Hoppy in the finish, but balanced well against the chocolate and malts, the overall effect is a nicely warming one.

Slightly lighter than black pour with thin brown lacing. A HUGE whiff of chocolate dominates the aroma with slight notes of coffee beans. A good malty start yields to the typical bitter/roasted stout finish - only this one includes a big dark chocolate kick. A bit too acidic, but thats fixed as she warms - a fine brew.

Ebony pour produces a mocha head equal in height to the liquid; the lather displays the density and longevity of foam rubber. Nose initially exhibits briery berry and vinous notes, but soon settles into a phenominal fanfare of rich milk chocolate, cocoa powder, toasted almonds, clove, grape jam, Jaegermeister, and mint. (Toward the end of the glass, the bouquet fluctuates between the former and the latter like that girl that looks hot one day and gnarly the next.) Similarly, the first sip is startlingly fruitycranberry? crabapple? before finding a comfortable balance of decadent dark chocolate, nutty barley, dried fig, and truffles. Tartness and carbonation provide a tangy finish. Mouthfeel starts out luxurious and frothy, but develops into a firm yet slimy snaily buildup by the bottles end. Concludes with a deep aftertaste of bitter chocolate, expresso, and smoke that completely saturates the senses. One can actually feel the chocolate molecules augering into the brain and infusing into the carotid . So rich that finishing the 22-ounce bottle proves a burden; walks a fine line between flavorful treat and sensory overload.

Bomber; pours thick dense brown/black with a dark tan head.  Compelling aroma of malt, chocolate and a touch of coffee.  A very smooth balance of sweet and bitter.  Some degree of complexity with a nice finish.  Good stuff!

Black with dark head, powerfull chocolate smell, some bitterness, taste of chocolate and some pine in the background and some christmas flavour.
Still a little watery.

(Bottle) Pours opaque back with a nice beige head. Very aromatic, with dark chocolate and coffee the most noteable aromas. Full mouthfeel. Rich chocolate taste makes way for a pleasant and slightly bitter aftertaste, not unlike dark chocolate. This beer is sweet, but remarkably well balanced as well. I would love to try this on tap.

[Bottle at Pianeta Birra 2006] A luxurious stour, quite chracterful and powerfull but attractive with its chocolate that starts in the aroma and goes on in the taste, balanced by a good hop bitterness that makes the beer not cloying at all

Rogue chocolate stout is a great beer if you like chocolate,which I do.Aroma is of dark chocolate.Pours very dark with a thick brown head.Taste is of a chocolate milkshake.Mouthfeel is medium to thick with a little bite in the finish.Overall this beer should be had by anyone who likes chocolate.

dark brown appearance with a tan head, nnose of malts annd bitter chocolate.  taste has a remarkably strong bitter chocolate flavor, finishes smoothly, good beer, i may prefer Youngs Double Chocolate slightly, but this is definitely right up there

My favorite beers without comparison, it´s nothing less but extraordinary. Very harmonic in every way, and yet complex in it´s blends of tastes. You can really taste the high quality of bitter, dark chocolate.

[Sampled at SBF, 2006]
Black with a beige head.
Loads of dark chocolate in both aroma and flavour; abit too much actually.

Sampled at an American Beer Tasting Event but unfortunately I forgot my notes. A very well balanced stout with lots of chocolate and a dry medium bitter finish (notes of coffee). Nice but a bit one-dimensional...

on draft at Mellow Mushroom in WInston Salem. Wow I had a lot of good beers at the bar last night! numero quatro? opaque deep dark chocolate brown with a quickly dissipating milk chocolate tan colored head. smells of light roasted coffee and cocoa.  tastes of rich, roasty malts with deep semi-sweet chocolate undertones, somewhat sweet with the tiniest hint of dry fruit and finishes thickly bitter. full bodied. rich. silky and smooth. wowza this is good. call it dessert.

Pours black with a thick cream/brown head.  Heavy coffee and chocolate on the nose. Bittersweet chocolate and some coffee dominate the flavor. Palate is medium/full, but a bit fizzy, nicely bitter, with mocha overtones. Fairly enjoyable, but the fizzy palate makes it seem thin, and not really any complexity to speak of, plus the added chocolate is a bit much.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2007 Get ripped on real Chocolate!  If you like beer and chocolate than it just doesnt get any better.  What a great stout from rogue; way better than the shakespeare.  Im not sure what i like more, the taste, or looking at the hunks of floating chocolate?

"This is the best chocolate stout ive ever had"...Smells like a dark chocolate easter in a glass...Liquid dark chocolate..the finish is like liquid chocolate syrup minus the syrup quality...as it envelops the bitterness becomes more apparent...a little something different ...mix this brew with abita raspberry...its delicious!!!
This was very sweet and malty.Good stout but i like my a little more heavy and thick.Over all if you like stouts and chocolate it is a must.CHEERS!

650 mL bottle.  Pours black resembling watery syrup with a thick frothy tan head that lasts a long while.  Smells of chocolate, malt, and oats.  Very sweet aroma.  Very creamy and smooth taste.  Flavors of chocolate maltiness, oatmeal, roastiness, hickory, graham, smore, honey, molasses, all the wonderful flavors youd hope to find in a chocolate stout.  Damn, the flavors are rich and in your face, yet somehow at the same time they are subtle enough so that the beer is nicely balanced.  The cascade hops and barley express themselves in the chocolate truffle finish.  Also, the finish leaves the feeling on your palate that you experience with a nice sip of good Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee.  This beer is awesome.  I would consider this to be the nectar of mother earth.  I want another.

Bouteille de 650 ml par HogTownHarry. Couleur de chocolat foncé, collet mince. Bon arome de malte de chocolat style foncé, pas trop fort. Assé bon goût chocolaté, un peu sec. assé bien. Jimaginerais mieux, car elle est passé date (30/6/06).
pretty good stout, too much of an artificial chocolate flavor.  rich and malty with an overpowering chocolate taste.  good, but i doubt i could drink more than the bomber.
user_location: The Land of Milk and Honey, Ohio, USA

text: A really decent stout.  Chocolate nose, with milk chocolate onthe tongue, some malts, light hopping at the end.  Maybe a little too sweet, though.  And I thought it a tad thin.

One of my favorite Rogue products that I have had a number of times over the years. Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured thick, black and oily with a large dark brown head.  The aroma is sweet and dry chocolate with a undertone of roasty malts. The mouthfeel is fairly thick. The flavor is gritty roasty malts, strong dry chocolate and a long chocolate powder finish.  A true classic.

On tap at Rogue, Portland. Black with thin tan head. Lots of sickly dark choc. Intense choc in mouth, great dose of hops on end. Great choc stout. Great flavours. Some real intense bitter burnt malts. Never had anything like this with the thicknss.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 6 Oct) Pitch black colour with firm, but small, beige head. Roasted nose with dominant aromas of dark chocolate.  Roasted, malty taste with dark chocolate, moccha and a bittersweet finish with notes of citrussy hops.  Great beer, in perfect balance, smooth and very tasty.

22 oz. bottle from Total Wine.  Pours a near black with a creamy head.  Aroma is heavy chocolate.  Taste is heavy on chocolate and coffee with a touch of oats.  A really nice stout, but I prefer their Shakespear over this one.  Too sweet for me.

Sweet, chocolate, malty nose. Opaque with nice tan, light brown head. Pours the color of dark chocolate. Good stout fullness with dark chocolate flavor. Malty and smooth mouthfeel. So smooth it seems to flow over your tongue like chocolate syrup. Very little carbonation. Pleasant mildly hoppy finish with dark chocolate bitterness. Excellent. I want to pour it over vanilla ice cream.

Bottle.  Super strong milk chocolatey aroma, sweet and mocha-filled.  Probably the "chocolatiest" beer Ive encountered.  Pitch body with a stable dark brown spoonable head that is good enough to win an award itself.  Taste is kind of a letdown after the superb preview.  Body is too thin, but soft and creamy.  Bitter aftertaste.  Rich chocolate throughout, sweet and milky, malty, lots of mocha.  Light roastiness is, unfortunately, almost an afterthought.  Light trailing hops.  Fun but disjointed.
this one bursts with flavor, complexity, and smoothness.  one of the best stouts ive ever had.

Bottled 660 ml.  Dark brown color with nice medium brown head.  Delicious rich smell of oats and chocolate, very earthy.  The taste was fantastic with chocolate and coffee giving way to hops an oats to a very complex aftertaste of more chocolate.  The beer was thinner than expected, which was a little dissappointing.  The head was also very tasty.  I had let this bottle age quite a while, which may have made the chocolate more pronounced.  Overall I would go out of my way to get this beer again, and it made a great beer/dessert experience (although the chocolate taste fades after the first glass).
pours black, nice head, had it aging for a bit, find it brings a little more choc flavour. nice dark deep beer
Almost black color with a thick brown head. Dark chocolate tones. Medium to full body with a touch of bitter chocolate in the finish.
Being a chocolate lover, this beer was a fantastic discovery as an after dinner drink.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2013 2012-10-26, draught at Pibar, Lausanne, 6-4-5-2-11=28Black color, with creamy brown head. The chocolate aroma is rather metallic and artificial. Slim and smooth mouthfeel; too much ashy roasted malt, fake chocolate; strong ashy bitterness. Unbalanced and quite unpleasant.2006-10-04, bottle, 7-4-7-3-15=36Pours black and thick; huge creamy head. The aroma is simple, some roasted malt and cocoa. There is more to talk about the flavor; the mouthfeel is medium thick, with malt and roasted malt, with a distinctive chocolate/cocoa note. Ordinary bitterness. The style is not my favorite, but the beer is well brewed.

22 oz bottle - Pours black with a two finger black head.  The aroma has quite a bit of chocolate as well as roast malts.  The flavor is a roast malt, chocolate, and oat combination thats pretty good.  For 60 IBUs, Im not detecting much hops in it.  Its full bodied with moderate carbonation.  The hops mostly comes through in a dry, chocolatey finish.  Its good, but I didnt like it quite as much as many here.

On the pour, an immediate, frothy, dark-brown head. It nearly poured over the rim of the glass.  Ive never seen a head that was so dark.  The beer is black as night.  I held it up to a lightbulb and it let literally no light through.  The smell is very pleasant with a smell of chocolate and mocha.  The chocalte aroma intensifies as it warms.  The beer is very creamy on the palate with a sharp malt and hop taste.  The flavors are layered and intense.  It has a nice flavor, but Im not a huge stout fan, so I think its only so so.  This is more like a meal than a beer, haha. It has a decent aftertaste: slightly bitter, chocolate, coffee, malts, toffee, oak, raisen, mildly sweet. Im a little stuffed up, so that is inhibiting my sense of smell, but chocalte and coffee are dominant flavors in this beer.  Overall in my humble opinion, good but not great.
Chocolate aroma, chocolate taste, chocolate color. If you like chocolate this is the beer for you. Nice tan head that was slightly fizzy, but other than that this was a fine brew.
Bottled. Black opaque colour, mediumsized brown head. Chocolate in aroma. Flavour is hops, chocolate, malts and slight roast. Especially in aftertaste. Chocolate bomb, and I love it .)

Bottled.
Opaque black, small tan head. Strong chocolate aroma - very similar to Plevnas Suklaa Shemeikka. Chocolaty, light hoppy, long chocolaty aftertaste. Chocolate bomb.
(Stockholm Beer Festival 2006) Black with a great brown head. Choclate aroma, some bitter notes. Milky chocolate flavor. Quite a bitter finish.

Pours a beautiful black with small  tan head. Pours a little thinner than the imperial stouts that I usually drink. Aroma is full of Chocolate and quite pleasant. Not too toasty, but definitely appetizing. Flavor starts and ends with chocolate. There is also a slightly burnt taste. I prefer the Brooklyn Black Chocolate, but this is pretty good. The mouthfeel is a little thin, and could probably improve with some aging. Overall, a good chocolate stout that I wouldnt hesitate to purchase again, but definitely not the best of this style.

A:

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2007 Bottle.    

As with other Rogue brews it has a powerful look and a tasty aroma. Bitter chocolate dominates the flavor and you can smell it for a long  time after.

22 0z.  Delicious!  One of my favorite stouts.  There are a few stouts that are really great but are a little bit too rich to enjoy on a regular basis (not to mention over the top expensive.  This brew is not only accessible but inexpensive.  Unbelievable flavor - hazelnut, coconut and dark chocolate, malty goodness.  Great aftertaste.  Smooth, rich and balanced.  A must try.
Dark with no lacing, and a frosty off white descending head.  Roasted Malts and a burnt roasted flavor. Thick but outstanding full bodied and long lasting aftertaste.  One hell of a great beer.

This beer pours a head you can build a shelter with, just huge stuff there.  Abundant lacing sticks around for the entire glass.  Aroma is so enticing to this chocolate lover: smells slightly malty at first, but then the nose is immediately take over by dark chocolate, cocoa, and even brownie mix aromas.  So nice!  These are not weak aromas either.  Taste follows a simliar fashion: some light malt flavors right before the brownie mix kicks in and coats your mouth with its delicious creamy goodness.  Beer is not quite as thick as youd expect, but its still nice and creamy, neiter sticky nor cloying.  Finish is not what youd expect and has a noticable hop taste.  The hops meld with the cocoa flavors very nicely and dont feel tacked on.  Still, these are the smoothest 69 IBUs Ive ever tasted.  Yummy!

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2007 22oz bottle.  Black Opaque Pitch.  Tan head only a slight ring.  Deep chocolate nose.  Fantastic sugary chocolate aromas.  Slightly toasty.  Smooth malts with a bittersweet hop finish.  Full and smooth.  Chocolate frosting covering double chocolate chip cookies with bittersweet chocolate and vanilla toppings and then dip it into a Coke!    The second glass holds more breadiness in the nose.  and a more apparent head.  I guess that I finally got to all the gook!  Toffee flavor but still super creamy.  Top notch and absolutely delicious!  Great coffee roast.  Great chocolate note.  Fantastic hop flavor.
Dark brown with a nice rocky head. Obviously strong aromas of chocolate with strong notes of hops and hints of woodiness. Very well balanced with a long finish of chocolate.
Black, with a brown head. Aromas are chocolate, coffee, and some hops. Flavors are chocolate, hops, coffee, and smoke. Body is a little thin, but a nice anyway.

Pours a dark ebony with tan small tan head.   Smells strongly of chocolate. Milk chocolate taste at first, bittersweet as it goes down, then a dark chocolate aftertaste. Tasty dessert beer but save room because its thick and it will fill you up.
65 cl bottle. Yeast at the bottom. Black colour with a fizzy brown head. Nice aroma of dark chocolate. Nice flavour of dark chocolate and ends up quite bitter, very tasteful.

Bomber. Pours dense opaque ebony. Humongous bubbly gloopy cocoa-colored head that settles to a layer of algae and an almost uninterrupted coating of lace. This beer promises to be a meal in itself. Enormous chocolate in the nose with not much else to keep it company there. Surprising how appealing this is, actually. Chocolate absolutely everywhere in the mouth, front to back, both bittersweet and milk chocolate. Some roast, too, a little sharpness of coffee and some bitters in the finish. Thick body but not sticky or syrupy, and the chocolate flavors do *not* come with overwhelming sweetness. Very refreshing and drinkable, especially by stout standards. Rogue has a way of making sure we locals dont take them for granted; this isn;t even their best stout.

Thank you Secret Santa. Brown/Black color with a small tan head. Aroma is chocolate and burnt grain. Flavor is all chocolate with a bittersweet finish. No unexpected or "smack you in the face" flavors here. Just exactly what the name says. A solid chocolate stout.

Cask conditioned - gravity dispense - Peterborough BF.  A black coloured beer with the odd tan bubble for a head.  The aroma is very chocolatey.  The chocolate seems rich and there is a agood dose of boozy fruit in the aroma also.  The taste is also very chocolatey.  There are no real roasty stouty notes to the beer and the chocolate doesnt seem balanced against the bitter finish.  Having said that its decent enough if a little powdery.

Like the name ,a very dark chocolaty stout  The chocolate flavor is full but not overwhelming, the aftertaste is smooth but slightly bitter; the aroma is almost like mocha coffee .  The beer has a very strong taste to it, and if you love chocolate and beer, well, then this is the brew to try.

I had it too cold at pour so Ill skip the appearance. Chocolate cake nose.
Chocolate upfront more than bottle description would imply. If your scared,dont be...its a long complex journey...dark bitter chocolate,coffee with creme...oats. Mr Cascade on an end run but not much more than a hint.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2006 Very dark color.  Black!  Tan head.  Heavy aroma of chocolate, milk chocolate!  Tastes of milk chocolate!  This beer will covert anyone who drinks plain beer into something that is ART!  It did to me...

This is one of the darkest, thickest stouts Ive had to date. This pours to an opaque, used-motor oil black, with a thick, dark tan head. The real secret to enjoying htis beer, as with many stouts, is to let it warm some. In my anticipation to try, I first smelled and tasted it right out of the refrigerator...nothing special. I then waitesd 20 minutes, and what a difference. Great aroma of chocolate and toffee, smelled like fresh made Turtle candy. Taste was more of the malty chocolate, but finely balanced by enough hops to not be too sweet. From the looks and smell of this thick bodied beer, I was worried about a syrupy sweet, but instead was long, smooth and just right. A very good beer.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2009 (Bottle at OT, Stockholm) Pour black with red reflexes and a small brown head. Smells chocolate whith some rosted notes.The taste holds pretty complex chocolate notes. In the begining there is some milk chocolate (like in the smell) then the bitterness takes over and turns the taste more into dark chocolate/cocoa. Bitter aftertaste.

From 22oz Bottle.  Pours an incredibly dark black with a generous layer of well toasted head.  Loads of chocolate in the nose, almost as if dark Belgian chocolate has been melted directly into my glass.  A hint of vanilla and caramel sweetness enhances the bouquet.  Full bodied, lightly creamy mouthfeel.  Oh, the chocolate!  Tonts of dark, bittersweet chocolate.  More chocolate.  Rather one dimensional in this regard, but the flavors are so, so good.  Some light toasty flavors are in there as well, a touch of medium roast coffee, and a kiss of hop bitterness on the edges of the tongue round out the delectable finish.

Pouring the beer into a glass was a treat.  Poured a deep brown color and had a creamy chocolate off-white head.  There was a good stout smell with hints of chocolate floating in the background.  The taste was a great stout taste that left a great chocolate truffle taste in your mouth.  Very well made beer!

1 pint 6 oz bottle. Poured a deep brown color with a thick espresso head.  Aroma was very distinct of chocolate (imported chocolate!).  The taste was extremely rich in flavor or chocolate truffle, coffee and hints of nuttiness.  Was very balanced and bitter, wouldve gone great with desserts! Definately a great sipping beer; delicious!

Brown bottle, 650 ml, best before 30J06; eye: black, espresso head that falls rapidly but leaves a ring around the glass; nose: roasted malt that dominates everything, black chocolate; mouth: in that order, roasted malt, fruity, sweet, black chocolate, finale of burnt roasted malt, lighlty acrid and sweet, midly bitter, medium body, creamy and sticky texture, good carbonation; overall: good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 650 ml, meilleure avant : 30J06; oeil : noire, mousse espresso qui tombe rapidement; nez : torréfaction domine au point de cacher presque toutes les odeurs, chocolat noir; bouche : torréfaction, petit goût fruité, sucré, chocolat noir, finale en torréfaction brûlée, légèrement âcre et sucrée, moyennement amère, corps moyen, texture crémeuse et collante, bonne carbonatation; en résumé : bonne
Strong chocolate aroma, but fiinish is way too bitter.  I was disappointed in this offering from Rogue, especially since I really enjoyed their Hazelnut.

huge milk chocolate nose to this beer detracts from drinking it, imho.  i think a darker chocolate wouldve complimented it better.   unlike some others, i can definiltely taste the chocolate, but i didnt care enough for this beer to buy it again.

Lovely rich chocolate aroma with coffee undertones. Smells like hot chocolate. Pours an opaque brown with a tan head. To my surprise the chocolate didnt show up that much in the flavour. This beer definitely leans toward the bitter. Lacks the creaminess and chocolate flavours that Ive had in other stouts. And those ones didnt call themselves "chocolate". A letdown in my mind.

Pours black with a medium head that disipated very quick.  Very nice chocolate aroma.

tasted like a beerified  version of the hot chocolate served in those ridiculously expensive and snobby chocolate places we have in manhattan-i.e. damen good.  Nice balance of sour hops  and sweet choco.

Less substantial than most stouts-a little too watery.
I have to try one of those chocolate stout floats!

I thought I would hate this beer, but it has become one of my favorites.  The strong chocolate flavor hits you like a sledgehammer, and you can nurse a 22 oz. bottle for a couple hours with no difference in quality.  If youre in Eugene sometime, stop by the Eugene City Brewery and have a Chocolate Stout float.
Bottle. Very soft when it hits the tongue. It leaves a loft of nice chocolate taste. But the chocolate gets too much. Smells very much of chocolate.
A stout  with  a nice roasted chocolate taste, how can you go wrong!!! Wish I could find this in Toronto more often.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Brun/Sort øl med flot tykt chokolade-brunt skum.

Øllens duft er humlet og meget chokolade-agtig

Smagen er tydelig chokolade og humle, dog med lidt brændt smag - sødlig.

Eftersmagen er lang, og er forholdmæssig meget humlet, tør og kraftig. De brændte/chokolade smag varer længe.

Kulsyreniveauett er tilpas højt.

Poured black with tall light brown head. After a minute or so the dark chocolate goodness and dark roasted (burnt too) maltiness started coming out in force in the aroma. A minute or so later it was mostly gone. If you like good dark chocolate and stout beer, this one is for you. Its like drinking a standard dry light weight stout while consuming a bar of premium dark chocolate. Wow. Very chocolaty and the heavily roasted malts also come out. The chocolate and roasted malts dominate the flavor and I find it difficult to pick out the other flavor components. I cant help but wonder what this experience would be like if it had twice the gravity.  Mmmmm.
If your into malty, chacolaty porters and stouts, than this one is for you, and excellent after  dinner beer!

650ml bottle.Pours  very dark ebony with a light brown head.Aromas of dark bitter sweet chocolate ,roasted barlley and malt with hops.Crisp,slight bitter sweet chocolate that has a lingering effect.Well balanced and leaves you wanting more.

Brown black with a reddish tint and a tight tan head. Rich sweet chocolate aromas. Velvety smooth entry leads to a creamy dry middle with deep unsweetened chocolate and dark toasted flavors. Crisp, bittering hop and lingering bakers chocolate finish. Purely flavored and the best example of how to mix chocolate with beer.

Draught at Rogue Ales Public House in San Francisco. Opaque, black with tan head. Aroma and flavor are as advertised. Lots of chocolate. Smells like cocoa, flavor is similar with an added roasty note. If you like chocolate this is your beer.

Pours thick black with dark brown head. Looks like this is going to be a rich and nicely textured brew just from the pour alone. Head dissipates rather rapidly. Aroma is rich with roasted malt and dark chocolate. Flavor is superb. Dark chocolate flavor with a bit of hazelnut. Chocolate flavor is not overbearing. Full-bodied, smooth texture, bitter finish. Excellent.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2007 Very nice chocolate aroma, a beautiful dark black out of the bottle with a nice creamy head.  Had a good chocolate taste and finished like bitter dark chocolate.  Great beer.
This had a good head.Color was chocolate.Aroma wasnt very pronounced.It tasted like a good beer with chocolate added.It had a bitter finish,like bitter chocolate.Very good.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2006 Very nice chocolate flavor from the real chocolate syrup.  Almost black body with a thick creamy head with good lacing

Bottle. black. Almost black with creamy yellow-brown head. Aroma is pretty sweet of milky chocolate and cream with dry notes of crackers and grassy hops. Flavour is not nearly as sweet, its rather hard and bitter of black chocolate, nut-shells, grass and crackers. Solid body. Long and very bitter aftertaste of black chocolate and ink with a grassy undertone.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2007 A very good chocolate stout from a great brewer. The aroma is what you would expect, chocolate with a nutty scent as well. The taste is big and smooth--very little aftertaste at all. It has a good bit of sweetness to it, and is very, very chocolatey. If you dont like that flavor in your brew, then dont go near this one, because you cant escape the massive chocolate taste in this baby.

Re-rate:   After sampling again, I have to lower my original score for this beer.  The chocolate is definitely present, but it is chalky and not as smooth as I first thought.  The overall mouthfeel is lighter than I expect in a stout.  Not as full as noted before, and not as smooth.  Rating changed to reflect current thoughts.

What a novelty beer. And at the price of $5.95, I definatley wont be having another one. The smell is awesome. It smells like cookie dough, brownies, fresh malt, and even a little bit of chocolate. The thing that bothers me is the strange aftertaste and combination of chocolate and beer. Perhaps more chocolate? Or less? I dunno, whatever it was this beer tasted like something I would drink if I thought beer tasted bad. Im not trying to make fun of this beer or anything, it is what it is and it has its rightful place among other beers, but its just weird.

(65 cl) Pours completely opaque black with a tiny, beige head. Very roasted malt aroma plus distinct chocolate. Medium-bodied with lightly burned malt accents, some vanilla and HEAPS of chocolate - too much and too artificial to be really pleasant. Slightly burned malt bitterness in the finish. 090706

22 oz bomber.  Pours dark with a large toffee brown foamy head.  Plenty of chocolate in the aroma but little else.  The taste is almost all chocolate syrup that has that sugary fake taste that I remember in chocolate soda as a kid.  This needs some other attributes to balance out the sweet chocolate.  I wanted to like this more.

Aroma: Some vanilla, truffles and lots of milky chocolate. Colour is pitch black, the head is creamy, long lasting and light brown in colour with nice lacings. Taste is dry, slightly roasted and earthy oats and a powerful taste of dark, bitter chocolate and of cause some hops to balance the sweetness. The body is medium to full and the aftertaste long-lasting. This description is pretty close to the commercial description but it is nevertheless a superb chocolate stout.

Pours black with a tan head that quickly settles to a film.  Light lacing on the way down.  Big time minty chocolate aroma and flavor.  By far the most chocolaty stout Ive tasted.  Medium to full body.  Very smooth.  A must try.
Bottle. Almost black in colour with a rather large brownish head. Malty and sweet with strong chocolate aroma and flavour. A hint of hops. Nice palate. Creamy.

Very good brew.  Pours a black colour with a beautiful creamy brown head.  Aroma is very good, a mouth watering dark chocolate nose.  Flavor of dark chocolate covered rasberries and cherries.  Very good bittersweet dark chocolate flavor.  The sweetness is balanced very well with the hops.  Delicious with a slice of cheesecake.
Bottle. Black colour with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted chocolate. Flavour is roasted chocolate and hop. Bitter and chocolate in the finish.
Dark in color, smells like chocolate, taste wonderful. Hoppy yet you can taste the chocolate. Its amazing.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2008 Bottle. A clear, dark brown beer with a nice tan head of good retention. Mocha, chocolate, roasted malt and some coffee in the aroma. The flavor is on the chocolate side, with roasted malt, coffee and a decent hoppyness. Coffee bitter finish growing on you. Lasting coffee-bitterness and hop-bitterness. Creamy, well-carbonated, medium body. Quite dry. The aroma is the best part of this beer, as it feels a bit thin in the mouth after a few sips. Nice. Rating: 8-4-7-4-15-3.8. Bottled. Dark, almost black, with a large, tan head. Looks wonderful! Fine aroma of chocolate, cocoa, sugar and roasted malt. Lots of chocolate and coffee in the flavor, as well as hops. Fullbodied beer with a long, both roasted and hoppy bitterness. Rogue certainly knows how to make their stouts. (060616)
Black body with a light tan head.  Heavy dark chocolate aroma, with some nice sweetness.  Maniac had it right... this is basically a cold hot chocolate drink.
Dark black color with a creamy brown head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. Its flavor hits me as powdered hot cocoa, followed by a sweet coffee finish.

I wasnt expecting the chocolate to add anything good to this beer, thankfully I was wrong. This is an awesome stout with really fat bitterness and rich roasted flavours. The chocolate flavour is subtle and hides within the roasted malts and the bitterness really nicely. Palate is full yet finishes dry with an excellent crisp bitterness. This is just plain good!

I love my oregon beers...thats for sure. Was a little scared of actual imported chocolate being added to this one. Dont like my stouts too sweet. But they pulled this off very nicely. Good chocolate, coffee, bitter aroma. Very bubbly mouthfeel (little too much for me) but the chocolate smooths out the bitterness at the end and leaves a very nice chocolatly taste that lingers forever. Highly recomended.

Pours a dark black with brown highlights and a thick but quickly fading head. Aromas of PNW hops, chocolate, esspresso. The flavour is almost all chocolate and mocha with some hops and latter some roasted malt as it warms.  Nice creamy thick mouthfeel. A good rich stout.
Poured from a bomber black in color with a big thick brown head. Aroma was huge chocolate.  Flavor was more chocolate a bit bitter in the finish.
Love this beer-stout and chocolate. Im not sure I need the added chocolate, but still, its a lot of fun to drink.

Black with a lasting, creamy light brown head. Roast aroma with some chocolate - on the edge of being too much chocolate and not enough beer.
The flavour is sweet with some perfume-y chocolate, but a good bitter finish
Pours dark and oily.  Nice brown head.  Smells like a hershey bar.  Lots of chocolate in the taste.  This beer is named correctly.  A little thin feeling, but very drinkable.
Bottle. Black colour with a small tan head. Sweet malty chocolate aroma. Sweet roasted malty flavor, with lots of chocolate. Also some hints of coffee. Roasted chocolate finish.

Hints of chocolate, caramel, vanilla and mocha provide an impressive nose.  Great looking beer with a dark brown color and a thick brown head.  Very sweet taste with chocolate, oats, vanilla and a touch of espresso.  Palate was quite nice despite being a bit medicinal at times.  A masterfully done Stout.

bomber.  Aroma:  Big rich chocolate smell is my first whiff.  Second sniff is also chocolate, but more a brownie smell than a pure chocolate smell.  Appearance:  Poured very black.  No ruby or brown highlights that I can see.  Very creamy dark tan head that lingered.  Flavor:  First thing I get is the dark roasted malt.  Then the chocolate slowly begins to build.  Intense chocolate flavor when I swallowed.  I dont get much hop flavor, but the bitterness is apparent in the finish.  Other flavor notes:  smoke, coffee, oatmeal, and tobacco.  Palate: Full bodied and quite chewy.  Finish is medium and the aftertaste is chocolatey and pleasant.  Overall:  A very enjoyable chocolate beer. Only criticism is that I found it just a touch to bitter on the finish.    I will definatly be buying some more of this soon.
tastes like shakespeare stout with a little more of a chocolate taste.The chocolate tastes kind of like they added it at the end.I prefer shakespeare.

Bomber poured an opaque black with a 
lasting brown head. Aromas of  dark chocolate, a hint of roasted malt, vanilla and a hint of mocha. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of dark chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla and a hint of espresso with a smooth sweet finish.

Yeah, it is all about the chocolate note. In the nose, in the downtake, aftertaste...all over. Brownie mix chocolate everywhere. Nose is a bit soft, but an otherwise very tasty, if not dessert-style beer.  I have some reservations about Rogue in general, mere suspicions at best which do not bear any merit here, so I will still give a positive review. I cannot say for sure, but I think these guys ...oh forget it. My rating represents the beer as it tasted when I drank it. If Rogue is the devil incarnate in then craft beer world, so be it, but I like this particular product of theirs.

A wonderful chocolate stout! Well, you can expect with this one that chocolate will be the main flavor and you would be right. Dark chocolate comes through very nicely! Pours very dark. Nice, thick, rich and creamy, this one is damn good. Hops even out the playing-field nicely. Good faint espresso comes through as well. This one is definitely worth a look.

smells like a candy bar


tastes like a beer!

very nice

would happily drink it again

and again 

and again
It is very simple - as it says - Chokolade Stout. Smell and taste - Chokolade. Also roasted barley and som bitter hop in the finish. Very good cup of chokolade. Black...
Jet black in color Oats chocolate and roasted malts evident in nose. Flavor follows aroma with evident roasty malts and slight bitterness. Excellent creamy mouthfeel. a full brew

Pitch black with a light brown head with thin sticky lacing and a thin head that stays on top. All sweet chocolate smell. Real chocolatey taste thats sweet at first and almost bitter on the way down. Smooth feel. Wonderful beer. If you havent tried this, have someone hit you and then go out and pick one up.

I just realized Ive never tried this!  Pours an oily black with a thick mocha-colored head that quickly dissipates into just thin smatterings of foam.  Aroma is extremely chocolatey with significant hops and a touch of coffee.  Flavor is sublime; rich, bittersweet bakers chocolate abounds, supported with a slight hoppiness.  Palate is thin yet rich at the same time.  Rather one-dimensional, but this one dimension is so tasty that I couldnt care less for any complexity or extra flavor.  Its a chocolate stout, and at that it succeeds 100%.
Bottle. Brown creamy and lasting head. Very dark red almost black body. Aroma and flavor a nice mix of choccolate sweetness and hops bitterness.

A very nice stout and an offering by hop crazy Rogue that wasnt the same old. Poured a dark thick brown (some red edges) with a nice light brown colored head. The aroma was of chocolate. The flavor was an initially sweet and roasted chocolate that turned lightly bitter. Hops were detectable and nice, certainly not overpowering. Mouthfeel was creamy and carbonated. A nice beer.
Great flavor rich chocolate smell somethign like a cup of hot chocolate. Maybe I was to psyched by that. It was yeasty and hoppy with a touch of chocolate, ok but... i want more!!

This is one of the best smelling beers I have had.  Great chocolate aroma.  Too bad the taste wasnt as wonderful as the smell.  Pours almost pure black with a tan head.  Was hoping for more chocolate based on the smell, but overall a very drinkable.

Bomber. Black with a whopper of a dark brown head. Nose is milk chocolate, a touch of pine hop. Flavor is sweetly malty initially, then the cascade of chocolate flavors - milk chocolate, bitter baking chocolate rolled together. Creamy mouthfeel, but not overly so. Finish is pleasantly bitter chocolate. I really liked this one, even on a warm summer night it was oddly refreshing. Go figure.

My lovely wife brought home 3 bottles of this for me.  I hadnt tried the beer in a while and was somewhat reluctant to try again.  However, the first two bottles were great.  A good balance between the chocolate, bitterness and sweetness.  But, the third bottle tasted completely out of whack.  The choco-sweetness was somewhat nauseating.  Perhaps I was just in a different mindset between bottles 1&2 and #3.  But after #3, I dont think I will drink this one again.

Draft at Friscos. Black bosy with a small, tan head. The aroma is heavy with dark chocolates. The flavor is milk chocolate, bitter dark chocolates, some coffee. Medium body with a slightly bitter, tanic finish.

This beer is as dark as they come- black in color with a big fluffy brown head.  The aroma is basically malty and chocolatey!  The flavour has the bittersweet chocolate, big malt, but also some hops and a good deal of roastyness.  Its smooth enough in texture but I would have liked something even creamier.  This makes a great dessert!

Pours brownish black with a dense foamy tan head.  I cant think of a darker non-imperial stout.  The nose is bittersweet chocolate up front with roasty semisweet malt and a liberal (for the style) piney hop note.  Tiny foamy little bubbles on the tongue take this average viscosity beer and really make it very smooth and pleasant in the mouth.  The flavors are also extremely enjoyable.  The malty sweetness up front with obvious dark rich roasted notes and chocolate following.  Theres also some of those piney cascade notes coming through just after the chocolate, and it works in a strange way.  Theres something slightly acidic (stronger than Coke) about this brew, which I tend not to enjoy in general, but feels appropriate against the backdrop of the roasty lingering charcoal aftertaste.  This is mighty bold for a sweetstout, perhaps why its my favorite so far!

Frisco Grille (Rogue Wave Weekend) - Dense Black, tan creamy head.  Rich nose of milk chocolate, very mild coffee and cream, with underlying toasty caramel notes.  Flavor is more of the same, but an actual floral hop bitterness counters the chocolate malt well.  Still on the sweet side, but not overbearing.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi-bittersweet finish.  Great beer for the chocolate lover in ya....

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2008 650 mL bottle.  Pours black with thick tan head.  Sweet, chocolatey nose.  Rich chocolate flavor.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Not really a fan of Rogue beers but this one is the exception.  Usually sells out quickly whenever I see it available in the Philadelphia area.  Id doubt a chocolate stout gets better than this.
A very nice stout flavoured with chocolate.  Deep black in colour with a nice creamy head.  A lot less malty than most stouts, very smooth and easy drinking beer.   I highly recommend this stout.

Bomber.  Poured black with a monstrous brown head which hung around til the bottom of the glass.  Excellent lacing.  Looks great.  Smells great too.  Initial aromas of Hersheys syrup and some bitter cocoa.  Lightly malted, some roastiness.  Dark and bitter chocolates in the taste, some coffee, and a long, dry, bitter, chocolate truffle finish.  Medium to full bodied with a delightful creamy texture.  What a beer.  So much fun.
Black beer with a large tan head. Malty, milk chocolate sweet aroma with a light vanilla note. Chocolate bitter flavor with a light roasted note. Dry and vague hoppy finish.

This is very close to a perfect chocolate stout. Thick brown head, noticeable chocolate aroma, and a nice bittersweet chocolate taste.
Not a beer for a a warm day, or to go with many foods, but for a cold night or dessert ... very good.

22oz bottle: Pours a dark brown with a rusty brown head. Aroma of cascade hops and choc. malt. Flavor is excellent dark chocolate and cocoa with a slight hop bitterness. A nice full body and slick syrupy mouth feel. This is definitely a sweet stout to be reckon with. It has rich chocolate notes but is not too sweet. A nice dryness on the end makes you thirsty for more. Very good.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2006 Thanks to jneal from the Keg and Barrel in Hburg Ms.  This was a trully great beer.  Nice full body with smells of rich dark chocolate.  The taste was out of this world.
Puissante odeur de café-chocolat. Belle mousse peu abondante. La mousse adhère bien sur les parois du verre. Amertume assez présente en finale. Un peu mince en bouche.

Bottle. Vintage 2005. I cant believe Ive never rated this, I drink it all the time!? Pours a deep black with a  big semi-lasting fluffly light-brown head -- I love the way it looks! Wonderful aroma of bitter chocolate, sweet malt and hops -- one of my favourite beer aromas. Delicious flavour of chocolate and hops -- yum! Nice dry hoppy finish. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel, medium to full bodied. Fantastic -- I may have rated this too high but its one of my absolute favourite beers.

Bottle.
Black coloured with a beige head.
Aroma of cocoa and milk chocolate.
Sweet flavour of cocoa and milk chocolate with roasted notes.
Roasted finish.
Bottle thanx to Joergen. Black colour with a big brown head. Sweet milk chocolate, light roasted aroma and taste. Medium body with a sweet milk chocolate finish. To sweet.

My first thought: An alcoholic version of Hersheys chocolate syrup.  Silky light feel, a little hint of bitterness at the end, but everything else is pure, smooth chocolate.  Its practically bursting out of the glass.  If you dont have a sweet tooth, steer clear.  Otherwise, I cant imagine it gets much better.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 In short: A light and smooth chocolate stout.  Good but a bit thin for the style
How: Bottle 660ml, consumed fresh a few weeks after purchase
The look: Black body topped by a small beige head
In long: Liquid black chocolate.  Nice hopping with what appear to be some citric hops bringing a light astringency.  The problem is mainly the body that I find a bit thin for the style.  I expect a chocolate stout to be creamy and full, this one is light bodied and a bit floury dry.  Light fruity salad notes as the beer warms up.  Despite its lack of oomph this is a very good beer.  As simple as a Hollywood movie plot but quite enjoyable.

As close to black as brown can get with  a generous dark brown head. Wow! This has to be sniffed to be believed. The chocolate aroma is insane. The flavour is all chocolate up front, but the finish delivers darkly roasted malt character and a moderate bitterness that I thought balanced nicely, otherwise this could become a sickeningly sweet ordeal. These guys are frigging geniuses.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: A real dark beer, with little head. A real bitter/dark taste. You could really taste a burnt quality to the beer. The taste that follwed the bitter taste was a real chocolately/coffee taste that was real nice and smooth. I would definitely buy this again.
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2006 Super Dark - like a moonless night.  This is a very rich beer!  Has a lot of bitterness.  Smooth Chocolater flavor more of a coffe taste though -- Overall Excellent.

The 22 oz bottle poured a near-opaque black beverage with a good-sized thick, creamy tan head that lasted for ever and left good lacing on the glass. The aroma is true to its name ... dark chocolate with notes of roast coffee and caramel. The body was medium-full with soft carbonation and a thick, creamy texture. The flavor starts off presenting bitter-sweet dark chocolate then the medium bitterness of dark-roast coffee beans surfaces. The finish lasts a long time and ends up with a slight alcohol warmth and coffee bitterness. A very nice beer.

(22 oz. bottle from <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/massachusetts/w target=blank>Julios Liquors) Pours very dark coffee brown, nearly opaque. Thick tan rocky head. Has an aroma of sweet chocolate, molasses, coffee and caramel. Smooth slick mouthfeel. Spotty lacing. Tastes like Hersheys semi-sweet chocolate and rich coffee, but has a grassy flavor, esp. in finish. Has a moderately bitter finish.

Almost black with a huge firm tan head.  Surprisingly chocolate nose until you realize that this has chocolate in it, not just chocolate malts.  Taste is chocolate, with a touch of malt and enough hops to balance the chocolate.

Bottle.
Pours a very dark color almost looks like liquid chocalate being poured. Tastes is very sweet with subtle chocalate tones. Palate is fantastic, very satisfying. Cheers!

22 ounce bottle shared with fellow ratebeerian el gaucho while he was back in Mpls.  Chocolate is the ingredient of the day here, no mistaking that.  It may be the strongest chocolate brew Ive ever had, almost like eating a chocolate bar.  And I dont mean that in a negative way, it this beer is very well done!  A good after dinner dessert beer.  Thick and syrupy, with a nice hoppy bite at the end.

Color is dark as night, awesome. Aroma is waffing of chocolates, roasty. Flavor is very much the same. Nice and malty, with a little of bit hops showing some face. The chocolates, and malts are the real players here. I liked it, but didnt love it. Just another good beer from Rogue.

Bottle. Very distinct, strong, dark chocolate aroma. Its like putting a bar of chocolate up to your nose. Opaque body with a small, light brown head. Nice lace. Strong chocolate flavor, like they melted a chocolate bar into the beer. Very long chocolate flavor.
